funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Graduate Scholarship Program; offers full financial support.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (about 16,000 Baht) for living and housing expenses
Return flights in economy class (reimbursement varies based on applicant’s home location)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries (or 'all around the world', 'all Nationals'). Students from ASEAN nations, other regions of Asia, Europe, Africa, Australia, and beyond are eligible, provided they fulfill academic requirements. There is no application fee. Students who have been studying in any programme at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for the scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Subjects / Wide range of disciplines (e.g., Information Studies, International Business Management (MM))

academic_requirements.min_gpa: typically around 3.25
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s and Doctoral degrees (2-year Master's, 3-year PhD)

experience_requirements.min_years: at least 3 years
experience_requirements.accepted_types: any field (applicants with less than 3 years of work experience may request a waiver)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Strong command of English must be demonstrated, either by a certificate of English proficiency from the applicant’s prior university or by results on standardised tests like the TOEFL or IELTS.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The term of the scholarships cannot be extended.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form and relevant documents. The application form for “The Graduate Scholarship Programme for ASEAN or Non -ASEAN Countries” can be downloaded from www.academic.chula.ac.th.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must be screened and recruited by the Faculty/Programme of their choice before their names are forwarded to the Office of Academic Affairs, Chulalongkorn University.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chulalongkorn is Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious University, offering a Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants should send their application form and relevant documents directly to the Faculty/Programme of their choice at least 2 weeks prior to the deadline set by the University’s Office of Academic Affairs.

basic_info.provider: Government of Brunei Darussalam (Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: Economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course.
Economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the course.

Baggage allowance for shipment of the scholarship recipient's personal effects to his country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the programme, at a maximum amount of BND$250.00 to a country within the ASEAN region.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international/foreign students. Applicants must pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, or Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines / different fields of study

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No GPA requirement
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master’s Degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency test required (specific tests not listed in content). Other language tests not required.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Not exceed 25 years old for Undergraduate and Diploma programmes. Not exceed 35 years old for Postgraduate Master's programmes.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect upon completion of the program. Scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country’s representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship. Scholarship recipient is urged to obtain additional insurance prior to travel to Brunei Darussalam and for the whole duration of the Scholarship at their own expense. Scholarship recipient must conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for Foreign Students (BDGS) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship offered annually for the 2025/2026 academic session. It provides opportunities for international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at leading institutions in Brunei Darussalam, including Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB) / Brunei Institute of Technology (ITB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025/2026 academic session opened at an unspecified date and closed on 15 February 2024. The official website states applications are now closed.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: Funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Higher Education Authority. 60 scholarships are awarded annually for one year of full-time study.
covered_expenses: €10,000 stipend for one year of full-time study
Monthly stipend directed at supporting student costs and living expenses

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to outstanding/exceptional high-calibre international students from non-European Union (EU)/European Economic Area (EEA) countries, United Kingdom or Switzerland (domiciliary of origin outside these regions). Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10, i.e., Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD). Applicants who have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again. Candidates should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines across eligible Irish higher education institutions.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (mentioned as an assessment criterion and 'Guidance for Referees' document)
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age limit prescribed
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Outstanding academic record, personal statement, leadership potential, commitment to global engagement, carefully prepared application demonstrating alignment with scholarship goals.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: 2025 Call document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, indicative application form. Applicants must possess a valid offer letter from an eligible institution while applying.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Primary assessment criteria include prior experience, personal statement, and references. Applicants complete the official GOI-IES scholarship application through the Higher Education Authority (HEA) portal.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious, highly competitive, and flagship scholarship program designed to attract top-tier international students to Irish higher education institutions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2025 call for applications for the 2025/2026 academic year is open, with a deadline of 5 March 2025. (Note: One university website states applications for 2025/26 are closed, but official and other university sources indicate it is open with the stated deadline).

basic_info.official_name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
basic_info.provider: Danish Government, Ministry of Higher Education and Science

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, covering full tuition fees and a monthly/sizeable living stipend. Note: One source indicates the scholarship may also be granted as partial tuition fee waivers, covering tuition for one year (second and fourth semester), requiring payment for the first and third semester.

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 15, 2024 (for 2024-2025 intake); October 15, 2025 (for February 2026 intake); February 1, 2026 (for September 2026 intake)
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2026 scholarship.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: limited number; very limited number

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a non-EU/EEA citizen; highly qualified applicant; international student; eligible to pay tuition fees; must not have had a previous Danish Government Scholarship or similar funding award from a Danish university.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s degrees, specifically in Engineering programs offered on SDU's new campus in Vejle or at the Sønderborg campus.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to be eligible for Master's studies)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS score of 6.5 or higher; TOEFL score of 575 (PBT), 230 (CBT), or 88 (iBT)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants eligible to receive the Danish State Grant cannot be considered for the scholarship. Exchange or guest students at the master level must have completed what compares to 180 ECTS credits (i.e. three years of studies) of relevant courses at the university level.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must apply for an eligible Master’s program through the SDU portal; complete and submit the online admission application for the chosen master’s program at SDU. A separate scholarship application is not needed as eligible students are automatically considered once admitted. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online admission application for an eligible Master’s program at SDU. A separate scholarship application is generally not required, as eligible students are automatically considered upon admission.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The university automatically considers eligible students once admitted. Scholarships are awarded to highly qualified applicants.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is intended to draw in top talent from all around the world, recognizing the important investment that overseas students make during their education. It offers an exceptional opportunity to study in Denmark for free and pursue postgraduate education.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship offers full financial support, with specific funding levels depending on the prize type (first prize or second prize). It can be fully funded or partially funded. For Master's students, tuition fees are covered up to 30,000 RMB per academic year. A monthly stipend of up to CNY 2000/month is also provided. Another source indicates 10,000 for Master's degree.

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 31, 2025 (for Tianjin University Bachelor and Master programs); June 30th, 2025 (for Tianjin Normal University)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students (non-Chinese citizens) and in good health. The scholarship is open to both prospective applicants and current international students at the university. Applicants must be foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, PhD students who have normally enrolled in Tianjin. Applicants could apply to Higher Education Institutions that are eligible to enroll.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: No Limit (for Chinese Government Scholarship, often similar for TGS)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or equivalent (for College/University applicants)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants for Master's degree programs must have a Bachelor degree diploma.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Chinese-instructed program applicants: HSK-5 certificates with a minimum score of 180. For English-instructed program applicants: English Proficiency Certificates. Applicants should meet the language requirements of the higher education institutions and provide relevant proofs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from professors or associate professors.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement, including study or research plan (no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal Statement (including personal background, financial situation, personal strengths etc., written in Chinese or English); Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form; Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths etc., written in Chinese or English, no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree); HSK-5 certificate (minimum score 180) for Chinese-instructed programs or English Proficiency Certificate for English-instructed programs; Bachelor degree diploma; Two recommendation letters from professors or associate professors.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Tianjin University will announce admission results officially on its website and send Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) to scholarship winners from July 1 to August 31. The assessment results are publicized for one week and then submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. The Scholarship List is determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a one-year duration scholarship, renewable year by year. It is available for undergraduate, master's, and PhD studies. It provides an opportunity for prospective and current students at Tianjin University (one of China’s leading research institutions) to develop professional skills and study in China.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period for Tianjin University: October 15, 2024, to May 31, 2025. Result release for Tianjin University: July 1 to August 31.

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government; Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (manager); Tempus Public Foundation (coordinator)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity
covered_expenses: Preparatory Hungarian language year (for programs taught in Hungarian)

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 15, 2026 (specific times mentioned: 12 noon, 2 p.m. Central European Time / 9 a.m. Atlantic Standard time, Saint Lucia)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For foreign students; applicants are eligible to apply only for those scholarship types and study fields determined in educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and the specific sending partner (Ministry of Education); applicants must ensure the selected programme is eligible under the agreement with their home country’s sending partner.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Over 800 full-degree programs across all fields of study
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible to apply only for those scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific sending partner (Ministry of Education).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 56 points on a 100-point scale for 'acceptable' or 'conditionally acceptable' status
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelors, Masters, One-Tier Masters, PhD (Doctorate)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For programs taught in Hungarian, language proficiency is not mandatory as the scholarship includes a preparatory Hungarian language year.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students at Risk Subprogramme
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must also submit required documents; applicants may need to complete and submit a country-specific scholarship application (e.g., Government of Saint Lucia Scholarship Application); scholarship holders are required to comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements; third-country nationals holding a residence permit for studies may engage in work for not more than 30 hours a week during the teaching period, and full time for a maximum of ninety days a year outside the teaching period; internship opportunities are available and often required as a prerequisite of the last semester.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed jointly by the sending partner (in the applicant’s home country) and the Hungarian host institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013; managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and co-ordinated by Tempus Public Foundation; enables scholars to study in over 30 Hungarian universities; offers dual education with internship opportunities; scholarship holders are entitled and often required to participate in an internship opportunity as a prerequisite of their last semester; allows part-time work (max 30 hours/week during teaching period, max 90 days/year full-time outside teaching period).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call for Applications for 2026/2027 academic year published; online application submission period: January – February 2026.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, with monthly stipends. Amounts mentioned include €8,000 per year (general), and €6,250 per year disbursed over 12 monthly installments (for ITALYOU program).
covered_expenses: university tuition fees (exempted, but regional tax and stamp duty must be covered)
tuition and enrollment fees (required for Italian language and culture advanced courses)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, foreign students residing abroad, and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the Italian University/Institute.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s Degree programs, PhD programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, Italian Language and Culture Courses (advanced and short-term), research/training programs. Specific program 'ItAS – Italian for Teaching to Foreigners' at University for Foreigners of Perugia (ITALYOU program).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Relevant bachelor’s degree (for Master’s), Master’s degree (for Doctoral), or appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the Italian University/Institute.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: B2 level in Italian or English for Italian/English-taught programs. Italian A2 (CEFR) for Italian language and culture advanced courses.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for Master’s Degree/Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs/Italian Language and Culture advanced Courses must be at least 18 years old and shall not exceed the age of 28 by the call's deadline (born after May 16th 1996). PhD applicants need to meet the entry requirements and academic qualifications established by the University.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Age limits have a sole exception for renewals. The grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Scholarships can be renewed for the following academic year if students meet performance requirements.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Letter of acceptance on behalf of the relevant Italian University (for PhD programs). Applicants are required to undertake their own research into programs and institutions.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Study in Italy portal (for application submission), esteri.it (Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation official website).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: A set of documents to support eligibility and qualifications, certificate proving proficiency in Italian language, certificate proving proficiency in English language, letter of acceptance (for PhD).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language, depending on the program requirements.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An esteemed initiative designed to support international students in pursuing higher education in Italy. Funded by MAECI, it aims to promote cultural exchange, strengthen academic cooperation, and allow students to experience Italy’s rich academic and cultural heritage.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for the academic year 2025–2026. 9-month scholarships are available from 1st November 2025 to 31st July 2026 (renewable). 3-month scholarships are available from 1st January to 30th September 2026 (exclusively for advanced courses in Italian language and culture).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded, government-funded scholarship program. It covers all tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend to cover living expenses. Health expenses are covered by general health insurance.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 5,000 new scholarships are awarded each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Students from all countries can apply. Individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities are ineligible to apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Numerous departments in fields such as engineering, social sciences, health sciences, basic sciences, humanities, natural sciences, agriculture, life science and environment, information, medicine, performing arts, music, and fine arts.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For associate and bachelor's degree candidates: 70%; For graduate candidates: 75%
academic_requirements.required_degree: For PhD Degree Programs, a Master's degree is required.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: International exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc.) and international language test results (TOEFL, DELF, etc.) are required if specified by the chosen university or program. Candidates for English or other language medium programs must provide an internationally accepted language proficiency certificate. All awardees without a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate must attend a 1-year Turkish Language Course.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter(s) required (number not specified).
additional_requirements.age_limits: For master’s programs: under the age of 30; For PhD programs: under the age of 35; For Research Scholarship: under the age of 50.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A valid identification card or passport; Recent passport photo.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Valid identification card or passport, recent passport photo, international exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc.) if required, international language test results (TOEFL, DELF, etc.) if required, recommendation letter(s).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process takes 30-60 minutes via the Türkiye Scholarships Application System (TBBS). The interview process is conducted from April-June.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A government-funded, competitive program for outstanding international students, offering university placement. It is the largest Turkish scholarship program for international students, with 5,000 new scholarships awarded annually. It offers opportunities at associate, undergraduate, master, and PhD levels, as well as short-term research, merit-based, and art scholarships. The program aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties between Türkiye and other countries. It received over 165,000 applications in 2022 (165,500 from 178 countries in 2021).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Undergraduate Degree programs: 4-6 years; Master’s program: 2-3 years; PhD program: 4 years.

basic_info.provider: Government of Flanders; Flemish Ministry of Education and Training

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Includes a grant of €10,020 and a tuition fee waiver per academic year.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 30

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be outstanding students worldwide. Must be accepted by a Flemish host institution for a master's degree program in Flanders or Brussels. The previous degree (used to enroll for the master program) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+) are still eligible. Students who are already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programmes in Flanders and Brussels
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preparatory programmes and distance learning are not eligible. Students enrolled in certain unspecified programmes for the 2025-2026 academic year are not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5 minimum
academic_requirements.required_degree: Must be pursuing a master's degree program. Previous degree cannot be from a Flemish higher education institution.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Overall minimum band score of 7.0 on the IELTS test; Minimum total score of 94 on a TOEFL test; C1 level of the Common European Framework.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Mandatory Master Mind Scholarship Application Form. A letter of motivation is highly recommended.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Master Mind application form, required documents, KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven), proof of admission to a master's program.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must first apply to an eligible master's program at a Flemish host university. The host institution then starts the application procedure for the Master Mind scholarship by creating the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool and nominates eligible students. Acceptance by the host institution for a degree program is required to receive the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Duration is one academic year for a 60 ECTS master's programme or two academic years for a 120 ECTS master's programme. Cannot be combined with another scholarship from the Flemish Government.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are open. The application deadline is January 15, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Chinese Government, China Scholarship Council (CSC), administered by Chinese Embassies/Consulates and partner institutions (e.g., AASCU)

funding_info.funding_details: Full scholarship covering tuition waiver, accommodation, stipend, and comprehensive medical insurance. Some awards range from $6,000 to $10,000 USD (AASCU specific). Tuition is fully funded by the host university, covering education, administration, and health insurance costs. Accommodation includes free university dormitory or equivalent. Living expenses are also covered.

timeline_info.application_deadline: November 30, 2025 (for CSC submission via Ghana Scholarships Secretariat); February 8, 2026 (for CGSIS online application); February 25, 2026 (for email submission to Ireland's Department of Further and Higher Education); February 28, 2026 (for Zhejiang University specific program)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 59 Pakistani students (in 2021); up to two candidates per member country (Great Wall Program, including at least one female); Four full scholarships (Bahamas Embassy)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens and in good health. Specific nationality requirements apply for certain programs/channels (e.g., Pakistani/AJ&K national, US citizens, South African students, Ghanaian students, nationals of countries belonging to the ‘One Belt One Road’ initiative for Silk Road program). Dual nationality holders are not eligible to apply (Pakistan specific). Some programs are open to all nationalities (e.g., Chinese Universities-Postgraduate Program). Applicants must not have finished their previous study within China or it has been at least a year since they completed their previous study if it was completed in China. Minimum age of 18 years by application (University of Houston specific).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate (Bachelor's), postgraduate (Master's or PhD), non-degree Chinese language studies, general scholar, and senior scholar programs in a variety of study fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: If the study plan goes beyond the academic year 2026/2027, the host university is responsible for covering the exceeded period. Candidates are encouraged to apply to AASCU recommended Chinese partner universities.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 2.7 (University of Houston specific); National Senior Certificate (or equivalent) with a minimum of 60% average, excluding Life Orientation (South Africa, undergraduate). Marks of pre-requisite subjects for chosen field of study will be reviewed separately (South Africa).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduate (for undergraduate applicants, proficiency equivalent to Chinese senior high school); Bachelor's degree holder (for master's applicants); Master's degree holder (for doctoral applicants); Applicants for graduate programs or senior scholar programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Valid HSK score report that meets corresponding Chinese language proficiency requirements for Chinese-taught programs. Bachelor’s applicants for Chinese-taught programs (Silk Road) need HSK 3 (180 points). Master’s and PhD applicants for Chinese-taught programs (Silk Road) need HSK 4 (180 points). Minimum 180 points for UIBE High Level Postgraduate Program. Those with minimum HSK but not meeting direct major entry requirements may receive one-year Chinese Language study.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs or senior scholar programs).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Research proposal (for postgraduate studies).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 25 (for undergraduate applicants); Under the age of 35 (for master's applicants); Under the age of 40 (for doctoral applicants); Age limit is 35 (for General Scholars). Applicants must be at least 18 years old by the application.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: At least one female candidate (Great Wall Program, per country nomination).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants for master's, doctoral, general scholar, and senior scholar programs taught in Chinese must submit a valid HSK score report. Applicants with minimum HSK but not meeting direct major entry requirements may receive one-year Chinese Language study.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants for postgraduate studies must also submit any admission documents from Chinese universities. Successful applicants must sign a contract and return to South Africa upon completing their studies.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application materials, Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (online and potentially a copy/English version), all other supporting documentation, Degree certificates (for Master's or PhD applicants), research proposal, admission documents from Chinese universities, valid HSK score report, two letters of recommendation, Admission Notice, Visa Application for Study In China (JW201), Foreigner Physical Examination Form, valid ordinary passport.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Online application via Chinese Government Scholarship Information System (CGSIS). Applications processed by Chinese Embassies/Consulates (e.g., in USA, FSM, Bahamas) or national departments (e.g., Ireland, Ghana Scholarships Secretariat). Scholarship applicants accepted by Chinese institutions will be officially confirmed as Chinese Government Scholarship students with endorsement from the Ministry of Education of China. The Chinese Scholarships Council (CSC) has an online application system. Each member country may be invited to nominate candidates (e.g., Great Wall Program).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is for the Academic Year 2026/2027, supporting short-term or long-term study at over 250+ (or 273) designated Chinese universities. Various program types exist, including 'Chinese University Program', 'Silk Road' program, 'Great Wall program', 'Youth of Excellence Scheme of China Program', 'BTBU Chinese Government Scholarship'. Programme Category 'Type A' with Agency Number 2881 is mentioned for Ghana.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application for Academic Year 2026/2027 opened as early as January 4, 2025 (US Embassy). Online application materials must be submitted to CGSIS (www.campuschina.org) no later than February 8, 2026. Specific national deadlines include November 30, 2025 (for CSC submission via Ghana Scholarships Secretariat), February 25, 2026 (for email submission to Ireland's Department), and February 28, 2026 (for Zhejiang University specific program).

basic_info.provider: Romanian Government, through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity, covers tuition, living expenses, and accommodation, ensuring a hassle-free study experience. Tuition fees waived, monthly stipends, subsidized accommodation, and a preparatory year for learning the Romanian language.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 500 scholarships granted by the Government of Romania to foreign students from 5 continents

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens from non-EU countries. Applicants must not have previously received a Romanian Government scholarship for the same level of study.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study are available for selection.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Medicine, Dental Medicine and Pharmacy are not eligible fields of study.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: An average of the study years, for the last graduated school, of at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the scoring system in Romania or the Good score.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree: addressed to graduates of high school studies or pre-university studies at the end of which they obtained a baccalaureate degree or equivalent. Scholarships may require applicants to have relevant prior experience or certain level of diploma in their field of study.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Bachelor's and Master's studies, applicants must study in Romanian, with a mandatory preparatory year if they do not speak the language. For PhD programs, applicants can choose to study in Romanian or another language set by the doctoral school.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (letters of recommendation).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Copy of the certificate proving that the person in the final year of studies is to take the graduation exam at the end of the school/university year and the authorized translation into English, French, Spanish or Romanian, if applicable. Copy of the transcript attesting to the academic record of the person in the final year of studies, until the moment of submitting the application file, and the authorized translation into English, French, Spanish or Romanian, if applicable. A duly filled in MFA application form for a scholarship to study in Romania. Cover letter issued by the diplomatic mission. Motivation letter.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, motivation letter, letters of recommendation, copy of the certificate proving that the person in the final year of studies is to take the graduation exam, copy of the transcript attesting to the academic record of the person in the final year of studies, MFA application form, cover letter issued by the diplomatic mission.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The annual scholarship programme for foreign citizens offered by Romania for the 2025-2026 academic year. It promotes education and cultural exchange, aiming for long-term development and deepening of bilateral relations and the promotion of Romanian higher education institutions worldwide. Offers world-class education in a European country known for its rich culture, affordable living, and academic excellence.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship program is for the 2025-2026 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Thailand Government / Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA) / Ministry of Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded; fully-funded fellowships; 100% tuition coverage
covered_expenses: Settlement allowance (6,000 Baht / USD173.36 on first arrival)

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 31, 2025 (for submission to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate General for 2025 intake); January 30, 2025 (by 5pm for submission to Ministry for 2025 intake)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 70 postgraduate scholarships (out of over 700 training fellowships and scholarships)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must fulfill all requirements; international students from developing countries; government officials from developing countries; candidates must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs); must be from eligible countries/territories.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agriculture and Food Security, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG Model), other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs); Food Security, Climate Change, Public Health, other topics related to Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and “Sufficiency Economy Philosophy” or SEP; Scholarship Programme in different fields of study.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Focus on development topics of Thailand's expertise.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 2.75 out of 4.0 or equivalent; or higher than 2.50 or at least 1st Division.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s scholarships; postgraduate scholarships; Master's degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum 2 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application; or minimum 3 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience with the nominating agency.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Candidates whose first language is not English and Bachelor's degree was not instructed in English, have to pass an English Language proficiency test.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters from three (3) persons.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: For people in other developing countries across the world; for government officials from developing countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Relevant qualification requirements; relevant current work; check eligibility; check list of eligible countries/territories.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form; Guidelines for TIPP; List of Eligible Countries/Territories; recommendation letters.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Introduced in 2000 (or established in 1999) as a framework for providing postgraduate scholarships for people in other developing countries; aims at sharing Thailand’s best practices and experience with the world; expands Thailand’s commitment to fostering cooperation partnerships among developing countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Offered annually (TIPP 2028, TIPP 2027, TIPP 2026, TIPP 2025, TIPP 2023, TIPP 2022, TIPP 2021, TIPP 2020, TIPP 2019); scholarships for 2026-2027 also mentioned; a deadline of March 27, 2027, for submission to Ministry of Tertiary Education, Science, Research is mentioned.

basic_info.official_name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
basic_info.provider: Government of Slovakia; Ministry of Education, Science, Research, and Sport of the Slovak Republic; administered by SAIA, n.o. (Slovak Academic Information Agency)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: travel allowances (for students and PhD students in case of international scholarship holders)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Supports mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists to stay at Slovak universities and Slovak research organisations. Also supports mobility of university students, PhD students and postdocs of Slovak universities or research organisations to cover living costs during their study or research stay outside Slovakia. Eligible candidates are international nationals (excluding Slovakia) studying or working outside Slovakia, who are accepted by Slovak host institutions for mobility stays. The program does not support: international students and PhD students accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies) in Slovakia, or those already studying in Slovakia (full degree higher education) who would like to fund their studies in Slovakia by the NSP; university teachers, researchers and artists without PhD degree (or its equivalent) and at the same time with more than 4 years of work experience as a university teacher/researcher/artist (PhD studies are considered as work experience) on the indicated application deadline (with some exceptions for 4-7 years of experience); international applicants who within the period of 36 months prior to the application deadline have spent in the territory of the Slovak Republic 15 or more months (in total); international applicants who are accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia in the framework of other scholarship programmes funded from public resources (e.g. International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements, etc.).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: study, research, teaching, artistic stays

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s and PhD students; PhD degree (or its equivalent) for university teachers, researchers and artists (with specific experience rules)

experience_requirements.min_years: Experience is a factor for university teachers, researchers, and artists, with specific rules regarding PhD degree and years of work experience (e.g., young researchers < 4 years, PhD holders > 4 years, senior researchers > 10 years). Those without a PhD and with more than 4 years of experience are generally not supported, with exceptions up to 7 years.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: university teachers, researchers, artists; PhD studies are considered as work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: SAT score minimum 1100 (mentioned in a social media post); applications and attachments must be in Slovak or English language

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Unofficial translations may be accepted in extraordinary circumstances caused by force majeure, with official translation required later. Exceptions for experience requirements may be made in individual cases worth special consideration (force majeure).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: International applicants who within the period of 36 months prior to the application deadline have spent in the territory of the Slovak Republic 15 or more months (in total) are not supported.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: motivation letter; list of publications/artistic activities; detailed teaching and/or research/artistic programme (for PhD students); original documents with official translations into Slovak or English (unofficial may be accepted temporarily in force majeure cases); online application form
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A Committee awards scholarships (e.g., 146 awards from 864 applicants in a past call).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic to support mobility for short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays at Slovak higher education and research institutions. Supports international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call for applications for study, research, teaching and artistic stays during the summer semester of the academic year 2026/2027.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships; financial assistance offered by the Indonesian Government; all expenses covered.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 200 scholarships across all levels of study and fields

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from developing countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctoral degrees in engineering, economics, health sciences, social studies, educational science education, and across 998 study programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.75 on a 4.00 scale
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school degree for Bachelor's; Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees for respective programs. Masters Degree/ MBA / B.Sc Honors (4 years) from a recognized institution.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work history (if any)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency test report (for applicants from non-English-Speaking Countries)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or the Indonesian Consulate General; Recommendation letter from an employer or direct supervisor (if working); Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools; Recommendation letter from a supervisor from one of the research universities (partner of KNB scholarship); Recommendation letter from the potential research supervisor (for Doctoral applicant only).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Statement of purpose of their studies in Indonesia (for Doctoral applicant only)
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum 21 for bachelors, 35 for masters, and 40 for doctoral degrees.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants from developing countries; part of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts (South–South Partnership).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Bachelor's Degree Applicants: Must not already hold a degree.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Recommendation letter from Indonesian Embassy/Consulate General; Recommendation letter from employer/immediate supervisor; Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools; Academic Certificates; Academic Transcripts; English proficiency test report; Passport; Statement of purpose (for Doctoral applicant only); Recommendation letter from potential research supervisor (for Doctoral applicant only); Offering Letter; Formal Photo; Curriculum Vitae; High school degree certificate and academic transcripts (for Bachelor applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection Results announced online via KNB Scholarship Website and officially through Indonesian Embassy publication network. Monitoring and evaluation processes for scholarship allowance.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious scholarship program for international students from developing countries to pursue Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctoral degrees at 31-34 participating Indonesian universities (e.g., University of Indonesia, Indonesia University of Education, Universitas Brawijaya, Universitas Airlangga, Universitas Atma Jaya Yogyakarta, Muhammadiya Malang University, UII, Unsoed). Offers quality degree programs and cultural experience.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period for 2025/2026 is 17th February to 7th March 2025. Immigration documents to be sent to university person in charge no later than July 11th, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program
basic_info.provider: Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and Ministry of Science and Education

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 15, 2025 (for first stage nomination by home country government authorities)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 100 educational grants annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from eligible countries (Organization of Islamic Cooperation members, Non-Aligned Movement members, Small Island Developing States, or countries with cultural, ethnic, or historical ties to Azerbaijan). Must be officially nominated by home country government authorities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Preparatory courses, Undergraduate, Master’s, Doctoral, General Medicine, Residency programs (including engineering, public health, international relations, and other high-demand fields). A list of 435 eligible study programs is available.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate students are advised not to apply for medical-related degree programs in Azerbaijan universities, as they are not recognized by the Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC) as of now.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 70% GPA (or 7 on a 10-point scale)
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Undergraduate: Secondary school certificate. For Master's: Bachelor's degree. For PhD: Master's degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Undergraduate: IELTS 5.0 or TOEFL 40. For Postgraduate (Master's/PhD): IELTS 5.5 or TOEFL 50. Proof of proficiency in Azerbaijani or English (if language of prior education was English).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Academic Recommendation Letter
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 for undergraduate/general medicine, under 40 for graduate/medical residency, and under 45 for doctoral programs (by September 15, 2025).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed nomination form (submitted through home country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education), Academic Recommendation Letter, Academic documents (transcripts/certificates), National ID, Bio-data page of passport (or evidence of processing).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Two-stage process. Stage 1: Official nomination by home country government authorities (Ministries, Embassies). Stage 2: Nominated candidates apply through the Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service (SIACAS) website (portal.edu.az), selecting 'Heydar Aliyev – International Education Grant' as the admission channel. Applications are reviewed and evaluated by government authorities and then by SIACAS. Selected candidates are notified. Final confirmation upon delivering required documentation to the higher education institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program, funded by the Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, is for the 2025/2026 academic year. Formerly known as the Scholarship of the Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, it was renamed in honor of Heydar Aliyev, the National Leader of Azerbaijan, to support the education of foreigners in Azerbaijani higher education institutions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Submission of applications (first stage) to relevant government authorities: March 15 to May 15, 2025. Review and evaluation by respective government authorities: May 16 to May 31, 2025. Registration of applications (second stage) in SIACAS: June 1 to June 20, 2025. Review and evaluation of candidates (SIACAS): June 20 to July 15, 2025. Notification of selected candidates: July 16 to July 31, 2025. Start of academic year: September 15, 2025. Last date for arrival in Azerbaijan: September 30, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners
basic_info.provider: ICETEX (Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad), an institution of the Colombian State

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program, providing non-refundable financial support within the framework of the Strategy of Reciprocity for foreigners.
covered_expenses: Monthly Stipend (one million six hundred (1.600.000) Colombian pesos or equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages)
One-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card

timeline_info.opening_date: May 28, 2025 (for the 2025 Beca Colombia program call)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 81 scholarships (granted in 2024)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be foreign citizens from all nationalities, not holding dual Colombian nationality. They must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last 6 months prior to applying for the scholarship. Applicants must not have been beneficiaries of this program in previous calls. They must have a professional or bachelor's degree and meet additional requirements specified by the Colombian university. Applicants should generally be between 25-49 years old.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate studies including Specialization, Master's, Doctoral degrees, and Perfectioning of Spanish. Available for a variety of degrees and academic disciplines in public and private Colombian higher education institutions, in accordance with the Academic Offer Catalog.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Change of academic program or university is not allowed after selection. The only letter taken into account for the scholarship will be the initially submitted letter.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 4.0 on the Colombian scale of 1 to 5
academic_requirements.required_degree: An undergraduate degree (university degree or bachelor) is required to pursue postgraduate studies (Master's, Doctoral, or Specialization degrees).

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 1 year
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in their field of study

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Not generally required, as IELTS or other English language proficiency tests are not mandatory. However, applicants may be required to submit IELTS/TOEFL scores or equivalent proof of English proficiency if applicable.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: One recommendation letter from a university professor is required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Between 25-49 years old (not older than 49)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship recipients agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends and must return to their country of origin or residence to apply the knowledge acquired. Scholarship holders attending academic programs longer than 12 months must request renewal from ICETEX each year.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Not residing or having started postgraduate studies in Colombia at the time of application. Must select a Bachelor's or Master's program at a Colombian university.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents (detailed in the call), verified copies of Educational Transcripts, certification issued by a financial institution (for account number and foreigner's identification card), recommendation letter from a university professor.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme is part of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, designed to promote academic, cultural, and technological exchange. It aims to strengthen social ties between international students and Colombian institutions by forming foreigners in Colombian institutions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are awarded for academic years such as 2025, 2025-2026, 2026, 2026-2027. The maximum duration is up to 6 months for Perfectioning of Spanish, up to 18 months (3 academic semesters) for Specialization, up to 24 months (4 academic semesters) for Master's, and up to 48 months (8 academic semesters) for Doctorate.

basic_info.official_name: Australian Government Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. RTP scholarship provides a maximum monthly stipend of $52,352 (ScholarshipRoar) or a tax-exempt living allowance of A$37,000 p.a. (Murdoch). Fees Offset pays for the tuition fees and allowances to assist students with ancillary costs. RTP Funds are used to support Higher Degree by Research (HDR) candidates through scholarships such as the RTP Tuition Fee Offsets, RTP Stipends and RTP Allowances. Scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years for full-time research doctorate students, and for a minimum of 6 years up to a maximum of 8 years for part-time research doctorate students.
covered_expenses: Relocation costs (up to A$2,000 at UniSC)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university and round. Examples include: 31 August 2025 (general/ANU International Round 1), 30/9/2025 (StudyAustralia), 27 February 2026 (Sydney Research Period 3 and 4, 2026), Friday 19 June 2026 (CSU AGRTP International 2027), 30 September 2025 (CDU International), 30 September 2026 (Murdoch International). Application period typically begins around August and closes by October or December.
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by university. Generally opens in the second half of the year. Murdoch International: 1 July 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: A limited number of scholarships are available.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available for both domestic and international students undertaking postgraduate research degrees (Research Doctorate and Research Masters) at Australian universities. Applicants must fulfill specific criteria set by the university. Candidates must be enrolled in or have a current offer for admission to a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) program. Must not be receiving an equivalent award or scholarship from the Commonwealth Government. New students typically select a checkbox when applying for admission to be considered. Current HDR students may need to submit a separate scholarship application. All RTP Scholarship students must be enrolled (without suspension) in a current HDR course to receive support. Domestic students require a CHESSN.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate research degrees, Research Doctorate, Research Masters, Higher Degree by Research (HDR) programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Available for Joint Research Awards when Monash University is the home institution.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: A perfect or very close to perfect GPA is often required. GPA is calculated over a set of courses or specified number of courses at a particular level (maximum 7 points).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree with first class honours or qualifications and/or research experience deemed equivalent by the University (for international students at UTAS). Satisfy all entry requirements for a higher degree by research.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency is required, typically strong IELTS, TOEFL, or PTE scores (e.g., IELTS 7+). Other accepted tests include GRE, SAT, ACT.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applications for AGRTP Indigenous and AGRTP Return to Study scholarships are open year-round (CSU).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Students may undertake work outside their graduate research course, but scholarship duration will not be extended. Applicants are required to familiarise themselves with university procedures and comply with Scholarship Conditions of Award and all applicable University policies. Obtaining an Invitation to Apply from a registered supervisor may be required (e.g., Curtin).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: May include a 'Request for a current ANU student to be considered for a HDR Scholarship form' for current students. Current students may submit an online graduate research application for Scholarship Only (Macquarie).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarships are awarded through competitive application processes. Applicants are ranked based on selection criteria (including GPA) and awarded to top-ranked applicants by a Scholarship Committee (e.g., Bond University HDR Scholarships Committee, central scholarship selection committee, RTP Scholarship Committee). University-specific application and selection processes apply, including considerations of the Research Environment (Macquarie).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The RTP program aims to provide flexible funding to support the training of domestic and overseas students undertaking postgraduate research degrees at Australian universities, and to deliver graduates with skills for academia and other sectors. It provides financial assistance to high-quality higher degree by research candidates.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application dates generally open in the second half of the year, typically beginning around August and closing by October or December, but specific dates vary significantly between universities and rounds.

basic_info.official_name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded master’s scholarship program designed to nurture future leaders who are dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries. It offers a comprehensive support package.
covered_expenses: Tuition fees to the Swedish university
Monthly stipend of SEK 12,000 for living expenses
A one-time travel grant of SEK 10,000
Membership in the SI Network for Future Global Professionals (NFGP)
Lifelong membership of the SI Alumni Network

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 351 recipients awarded the SI Scholarship for Global Professionals for the academic year 2025/2026. Usually 4-6% of applicants are awarded.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open for international students from a selection of countries (33 eligible countries mentioned, with a partial list including Armenia, Azerbaijan, Iraq, Jordan, Kenya, Liberia, Ecuador, Egypt, Ethiopia). Applicants must be a citizen of an eligible country and required to pay international tuition fee. Must be admitted to a master’s programme at a Swedish university that is eligible for the SISGP. Applicants should not have previously lived in Sweden for more than two years, be currently enrolled for a master's programme at a Swedish university, have previously been awarded an SI scholarship, or hold a degree from a Swedish university.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time, one- or two-year master’s studies at Swedish universities, across a wide range of English-taught programmes. The master’s programmes you apply for must be eligible for the SI scholarship. Examples include European Studies, Global and International Management, Sustainable Development, Environmental Change and Global Sustainability, Sustainable Cities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only master's programmes that are eligible for the SI scholarship. Not for Bachelor or PhD degrees.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a scale of 4.0 or equivalent.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work and leadership experience. Applicants must use SI’s form for proof of work and leadership experience.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Reference Letters
additional_requirements.career_plan: Motivation Letter/Statement: A detailed letter explaining why you are applying for the scholarship and how your studies will contribute to sustainable development in your country or globally.
additional_requirements.age_limits: None (SI welcomes applicants regardless of age)
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: None (SI aims at diversity and gender equality among scholarship holders)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants should not have previously lived in Sweden for more than two years, be currently enrolled for a master's programme at a Swedish university, have previously been awarded an SI scholarship, or hold a degree from a Swedish university.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Proof of university application fee payment of 900 SEK (Swedish kronor) prior to applying for the scholarship. Passport/National ID.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV (max 3 pages), Proof of Work and Leadership Experience (using SI’s form), Two Reference Letters, Passport/National ID, Motivation Statement/Letter, Admission Proof (proof of application to an eligible master’s program), Proof of university application fee payment.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Winning is competitive; successful candidates combine a strong academic profile with clear leadership potential, relevant work experience, well-aligned motivation, and an application that matches Sweden’s development priorities and the scholarship’s selection criteria. Usually 4-6% of the applicants are awarded a Global Professionals scholarship. Only applicants admitted to an eligible master’s programme by 26 March 2026 will be considered.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious, fully funded master’s scholarship program designed to nurture future leaders who are dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries and regions. It replaces the Swedish Institute Study Scholarships (SISS).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Mid-November 2025: SI Scholarship application documents and eligible master programmes are published. Deadline to pay university application fee + upload required docs to University Admissions: 2 February 2026. Scholarship portal opens: 9 February 2026. Scholarship portal closes: 25 February 2026. Applicants admitted to eligible master’s programmes considered: 26 March 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: One year of Korean language training fee
Monthly allowance (includes living expenses, health insurance)

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 17, 2025 (Thu) 15:00 (for mail/in-person via Embassy Track); October 31, 2025 (for online applications)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 280 undergraduate slots globally (150 for Embassy Track bachelor's, 130 for University Track bachelor's and associate degrees); Approximately 1,900 scholarships across undergraduate and graduate levels for 2026 academic year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must hold citizenship of an NIIED-designated country invited to the GKS program. Applicants must be in good health. Applicants may apply to only one track (General or R-GKS). Applicants with provisional/temporary graduation certificates can apply but must submit official graduation certificate and final academic transcript to GKS Center, NIIED by December 31st, 2025. Embassy Track applicants must submit documents to the Embassy of the Republic of Korea in their respective countries of citizenship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study offered by GKS participating universities, including environmental sciences and food.
field_restrictions.restrictions: MBBS is not available under the GKS scholarship, but some related fields are.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) equivalent to or higher than 80% on a 100-point scale, OR ranked within the top 20% of your class, OR a CGPA of 2.68/4.0 (or equivalent).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High School Graduation Certificate (or certificate of expected graduation) for bachelor's degree; Graduation certificate (or certificate of expected graduation) of associate degree program for associate degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS, Duolingo, General English, TOEFL. English proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS) is required for programs taught in English. Score report of valid TOPIK (original) or English Proficiency Test (copy) is optional.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (FORM 4 Recommender’s Information); original recommendation letter, sealed in an envelope, to be submitted to the first-round selection institution by applicants who pass the first round.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Required (FORM 3 Study Plan)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Proof of Overseas Korean Document (Optional), Proof of Korean Citizenship Renunciation Document (Optional), Proof of Korean War Veteran’s Descendant (Optional).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal Statement (FORM 2), GKS Applicant Agreement (FORM 5), Personal Medical Assessment (FORM 6).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: FORM 1: Application Form, FORM 2: Personal Statement, FORM 3: Study Plan, FORM 4: Recommender’s Information, FORM 5: GKS Applicant Agreement, FORM 6: Personal Medical Assessment. Required Certificates (Must be Apostilled or Consular confirmed): Proof of citizenship (applicant and parents) and proof of family relationship, High School Graduation Certificate (or certificate of expected graduation), Academic transcript of high school curriculum. Optional Certificates (Apostilled or Consular confirmed): Graduation certificate (or certificate of expected graduation) of associate degree program, Academic transcript of associate degree. Other Optional Documents: Proof of Overseas Korean Document, Proof of Korean Citizenship Renunciation Document, Proof of Korean War Veteran’s Descendant, Score report of valid TOPIK (original) or English Proficiency Test (copy), Copy of awards and other certificates, etc.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Two application tracks: Embassy Track and University Track. Applicants may apply to only one track (General or R-GKS). Embassy Track applicants submit documents to the Embassy of the Republic of Korea in their country. R-GKS Track applicants may apply to up to 2 universities, both of which must be Type B universities. Starting from 2026 GKS-U, applications must be submitted online only via the Study in Korea website (www.studyinkorea.go.kr), though some embassy tracks still mention mail/in-person submission. First round selection followed by submission of original recommendation letter. Second round announcement within November 2025 (successful applicants contacted by University). Embassy Track applicants passing the 3rd round selection notify NIIED of their final university choice by January 2, 2025.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Global Korea Scholarship (GKS) is a Korean Government Scholarship designed to provide international students with opportunities to pursue higher education in Korea, offering outstanding students from around the world the chance to study in the country for free.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Duration for Bachelor’s Degree Scholarship: 1 year Korean language training + 4-6 years degree program (total 5-7 years). Duration for Associate Degree Scholarship: 1 year Korean language training + 2-3 years degree program (total 3-4 years).

funding_info.funding_details: Covers tuition fees, fully or partially. Full Scholarship for Master's is 30,000 RMB per year. Partial scholarships can cover half or a quarter of tuition fees.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students applying for or already admitted to Master's degrees in Chinese universities and colleges in the Beijing region. Duration of scholarship should be under 4 years. Must be admitted as a graduate student at an eligible Beijing university (e.g., PKU, USTB, BFSU, UIBE). Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds. Can be for new applicants or registered self-funded students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's degrees at eligible Higher Education Institutions in Beijing, including but not limited to Peking University, University of Science & Technology Beijing (USTB), Beijing Foreign Studies University (BFSU), University of International Business and Economics (UIBE), Beijing International Studies University, Beijing University of Technology, Beijing University of Chemical Technology, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing Forestry University, Beijing Normal University, Beijing Sport University, Beijing Language & Culture University, Beijing University of Chinese Medicine, Beijing Union University, Beijing Information Science & Technology University, Beijing Technology and Business University, Beijing Wuzi University, Beijing Open University.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants for a Master’s program should hold a Bachelor’s diploma and degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For programs taught in Chinese, a valid HSK score report that meets corresponding Chinese language proficiency requirements is needed. For programs taught in other languages, relevant language proficiency certificates, such as IELTS or TOEFL score reports, are required in accordance with university requirements.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors for graduate programs.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants may need to provide a pre-admission document issued by the universities they are applying to. Candidates may need to first apply as self-funded students before applying for the scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for Beijing Government Scholarship (can be collected from the institutions in Beijing or downloaded from the school’s website of the targeted HEIs).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) in Beijing are authorized by the Beijing Municipal Government to be responsible for the acceptance, review, and approval of scholarship applications. HEIs will assess all applications and send Scholarship Admission Notice, Admission Notice, and Visa Application Form for Study in China (JW201) to candidates three months before the study begins. University International Student Centers (e.g., USTB) take charge of the application, selection, and annual review.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by the Beijing Municipal Government to encourage and support outstanding international students to study and conduct research in the capital city. The scholarship needs to be applied for every year. It is available for the 2026-2027 academic year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2026-2027 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Academy of Research and Higher Education (ARES) of the Belgian government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 200 fully funded awards (65 for Specialized Bachelor/Master and 35 for short trainings earmarked for Sub-Saharan Africa)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a permanent resident and work in one of the 31 eligible partner countries (Africa, Southeast Asia, Latin America, and the Middle East). Eligible African countries include: Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Guinea, Kenya, Madagascar, Mali, Morocco, Mozambique, Niger, DR Congo, Rwanda, Senegal, South Africa, Tanzania, Tunisia, Uganda and Zimbabwe.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Specialized bachelor’s degrees (undergraduate specialization), specialized master’s degrees, and continuing training programs (2-to-6-month advanced training courses). Examples include Master de spécialisation – Design d’innovation sociale and Data Science in Global Health.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Previous degree (Bac+3 for specialized bachelor’s, Bac+5 for specialized master’s and continuing education students) to meet professional experience criteria.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years of relevant professional experience after graduate studies (Bac+3 for specialized bachelor’s, Bac+5 for specialized master’s and continuing education students).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant professional experience in an ARES partner country. Priority is given to people who work in an institution with which ARES has entered into a partnership (Institutional Support or development research/training project in the South).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in the language of instruction is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: 2 recommendation letters (academic and/or professional)
additional_requirements.career_plan: Motivation letter explaining career goals and programme relevance
additional_requirements.age_limits: No strict age restriction
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Half of all ARES scholarships (65 for Specialized Bachelor/Master and 35 for short trainings) are earmarked for applicants from Sub-Saharan Africa. Priority for applicants working in ARES partner institutions.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: CV or résumé; Certified copies of original documents; Any additional documents requested in the online form.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: 2 recommendation letters (academic and/or professional), certified copies of original documents, CV or résumé, motivation letter explaining career goals and programme relevance, any additional documents requested in the online form.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The ARES International Training Scholarships offer young professionals from 31 partner countries the opportunity to pursue a fully funded academic or professional training in Belgium. Three types of training are offered within the framework of the ARES 2022-2027 cooperation program.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026-2027 academic year.

basic_info.provider: VLIR-UOS (Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded Master's programmes, full financial support covering all study-related expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number of yearly scholarships per programme (8-12). 10 scholarships are awarded for each Master's programme (specifically mentioned for 15 ICP Master's programmes and IOB Advanced Masters). Specific numbers for Professional Bachelors (8), Initial Masters (10 or 12), Advanced Masters (10).
