eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants from 29 eligible countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year. Candidates may not have previously received a scholarship from the Belgian government to attend a study programme, nor may they have enrolled in a study programme at a Belgian higher education institution before 1 January of the year of intake. Preference will be given to candidates who have never received a scholarship to study in a higher income country (bachelor or master).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Five master's programs at KU Leuven. 15 ICP Master's programmes at participating Belgian Universities. Specific programs listed: Professional Bachelors (Bachelor of Hotel Management, Bachelor of Applied Computer Science), Initial Masters (International Master of Science in Agro- & Environmental Nematology, International Master of Science in Rural Development (IMRD), Master of Aquaculture (IMAQUA), Master of Epidemiology, Master of Science in Food Technology, Master of Science in Marine and Lacustrine Science and Management, Master of Statistics and Data Science, Master in Sustainable Development, Master of Transportation Sciences - Road Safety, Master of Water Resources Engineering (WRE), Master of Science in Nutrition and Food Systems, Master of Science in Sustainable Land Management, Master of Science in Tropical Biodiversity and Ecosystems (Mundus tropicalis c/o TROPIMUNDO)), Advanced Masters (Master of Human Settlements, Master of Development Evaluation, Master of Cultural Anthropology and Development Studies, ICP Master in Sustainable Development).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants must choose one of the eligible ICP Connect programs.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Full-time bachelor’s or master’s degree. Initial or regular Master’s programmes are open to bachelor’s graduates. Advanced Master’s programmes are typically for those who already hold a Master's degree. Certain advanced Master’s programmes accept applicants with a four-year bachelor’s degree; please confirm this with the organising institution for specific eligibility details.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: If you studied in an English-speaking institution, some programmes may waive this requirement. For other programmes, the medium of instruction is not accepted as proof of English proficiency. Minimum scores required in accepted tests for each programme can be found on specific program pages (e.g., Master of Cultural Anthropology and Development Studies, Master of Human Settlements, Master of Food Technology, ICP Master in Sustainable Development, Master of Water Resources Engineering). Test results must be available for online verification.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Candidates for a bachelor or initial Master programme cannot be older than 35 as of January 1 of the intake year. Candidates for an advanced Master programme cannot be older than 45 as of January 1 of the intake year.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: VLIR-UOS strongly encourages female candidates to apply. VLIR-UOS promotes diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all qualified applicants, regardless of gender.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Regional balance: A reasonable cross-section of scholars from different countries and regions is considered.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year. Only complete submissions will be taken into consideration. Applicants must choose one of the eligible ICP Connect programs.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Only complete submissions will be taken into consideration. Regional balance and diversity are considered.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The program supports outstanding students from Africa, Asia, and Latin America (29 eligible countries) who wish to pursue a full-time bachelor’s or master’s degree at a Flemish university in Belgium. VLIR-UOS funds study scholarships and academic partnerships between Flemish higher education institutions and universities in partner countries. Ambition: Support changemakers aiming to drive social change in their home country or region after completing their studies, focusing on the global need for experts in relevant fields.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are now open for the 2026/2027 academic year. Deadline is 31 January 2026.

basic_info.provider: Association of Global Universities with the support of the Russian Government

funding_info.funding_details: Tuition-free education. Covers tuition fees and a monthly stipend of approximately 25,000 Russian Rubles per month (around 310 USD at current exchange rates). Over $52 million awarded annually (historical).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: More than 12,000 winners have received free education (historical). 3,700 participants received full scholarships (historical).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, foreign citizens, stateless persons, and Russian nationals permanently residing abroad (with a residence permit). Students from any educational background can apply. Minimum 2.7 GPA required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic fields and majors. Specific examples include: Artificial Intelligence, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Political Science, Russian Language and Culture, Psychology, Economics, Neuroscience & Psychology, Economics & Econometrics, Materials Science & Technologies, Metallurgy, Nanotechnologies and Microsystems Technology, Technological Machines & Equipment, Technosphere Safety, Standardization and metrology, Quality management, Control in Technical Systems, Physics, Electronics & Nanoelectronics, Power & Electrical Engineering, Chemical technology, Material processing technology.
field_restrictions.restrictions: If chosen as a winner by both Rossotrudnichestvo and Open Doors, you must choose between the two scholarships; you cannot get both.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate track (secondary education completion), Graduate track (Bachelor’s or Specialist’s degree), Doctoral track (PhD), Postdoc track (PhD or DSc degree as of registration start date).

experience_requirements.min_years: For Postdoc track: at least 5 years of experience in the specialty.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: For Postdoc track: work experience in the field of research declared by the project; availability of copyright certificates for inventions.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Training and working languages are English and Russian; no specific language barrier mentioned, implying proficiency in either is sufficient.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor's Degree: 16-23 years old. Master's Degree: 20-33 years old. Doctoral Degree (PhD): Not specified.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Statement of purpose or motivational letter. Pass an online exam or assessment in their field of study. Documents confirming completion of secondary education (for undergraduate), Bachelor’s or Specialist’s degree (for graduate), or PhD/DSc degree (for postdoc).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Statement of purpose or motivational letter, two letters of recommendation, documents confirming completion of secondary education (for undergraduate), Bachelor’s or Specialist’s degree (for graduate), or PhD/DSc degree (for postdoc).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process is fully online and takes place in several stages. It involves an online exam or assessment in the field of study and portfolio submission and evaluation. Winners and runners-up are determined based on the results of two stages, using ranked lists of participants by overall scores. Winners of the intellectual competition may enter programs without entrance examinations. For the postdoc track, winners may get a job in a proposed research project.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Allows students to study tuition-free at some of the best universities in Russia. More than 24 leading Russian universities are part of the project. Scholars have the opportunity to choose their university from an eligible list.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Opening Date: September 1, 2025. Portfolio Submission Deadline: November 16, 2025. Portfolio Evaluation: November 17–27, 2025. Announcement of bachelor's and master's track winners: December 30, 2025. Announcement of doctoral and post-doctoral track winners: February 27, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Full academic scholarships and short term training, covering most costs.

timeline_info.opening_date: 1 February 2026 (for major academic scholarships); 1 December 2025 (for some short courses)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: approximately 1,100 scholarships are awarded each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to citizens from eligible developing countries who are international students. Applicants must complete an online eligibility test. Scholars are expected to return home to assist in social and economic development.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate or postgraduate qualification in academic study to learn new skills and acquire knowledge for social and economic development. Specific short courses include Good Governance and Sustainable, Resilient and Productive Agri-Food Systems.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or equivalent; for postgraduate, minimum equivalent GPA of 3.6/4.0 or an A to A+ average.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, postgraduate, or Ph.D. qualification.

experience_requirements.min_years: One year of full-time work experience (30+ hours/week) OR two years of part-time work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time work experience, part-time work experience.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants under 40 years of age are preferred.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants need to choose their preferred education institution and courses.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Involves an online eligibility test and online application system. Selection can take six to ten months.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Manaaki New Zealand Scholarship Programme aims to enhance the mana of partner countries and Aotearoa New Zealand through manaakitanga. It supports sustainable development, poverty reduction, and a more secure, equitable, and prosperous world. The program has a 70-year history, awarding scholarships to scholars from 112 developing nations.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Selection process can take six to ten months from the time of application.

basic_info.official_name: Aga Khan Foundation’s International Scholarship Programme (AKF ISP)
basic_info.study_country: Any highly reputable university worldwide, with specific country exclusions.

funding_info.funding_details: Scholarships are awarded on a 50% grant and 50% loan basis. For PhD students, scholarships are awarded for the first two years, after which funding from alternative sources is expected.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number of scholarships each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding scholars from selected developing countries (e.g., India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Afghanistan, Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and others from Asia and Africa) who have no other means of financing their studies. Applicants must be eligible nationals residing in a country with a local Aga Khan Foundation (AKF), Aga Khan Education Services (AKES), or Aga Khan Education Board (AKEB) office which processes applications and interviews candidates.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any field of study at a highly reputable university
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not available for study in universities in UK, Germany, Sweden, Austria, Denmark, Netherlands, Italy, Norway, and Ireland.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate education (Master's level courses are prioritized; PhD programmes considered for outstanding students highly recommended by professors and needing a PhD for career objectives).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet the language proficiency requirements of the university (e.g., TOEFL/IELTS).

additional_requirements.career_plan: Prepare for employment, primarily within the AKDN.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 30

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are handled by local units of the Aga Khan Foundation, Aga Khan Education Services, or Aga Khan Education Boards in the applicant's country of current residence. The selection process is competitive and occurs once a year in June or July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Aga Khan Foundation’s International Scholarship Programme (AKF ISP) is an opportunity for outstanding scholars from selected countries, who have no other means of financing their studies, to pursue postgraduate education, aiming to develop effective scholars and leaders for employment primarily within the AKDN.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open in early January each year, with a deadline of March 31st. The competitive selection process takes place in June or July.

basic_info.provider: Nuffic (funded by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs)
basic_info.study_country: Netherlands (also possible in an OKP country)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded with tuition and travel costs for professionals. A €260 million global development programme. Intended to supplement the salary that you should continue to receive during the scholarship period.

timeline_info.application_deadline: The programme has ended, and there are no new application rounds.
timeline_info.opening_date: The programme has ended, and there are no new application rounds.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 510 scholarships were awarded for Masters Degree.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Mid-career professionals from 52-55 eligible OKP countries (e.g., Asia & Africa). Must be working for a government, secondary or higher vocational or academic education institution, university, or private sector. The need for training must be demonstrated in the context of the applicant's employing organization. Application is reviewed on how it fits the embassy's country focus. A government statement expressing support may be required for some countries. Scholarship holders are expected to return to their home country and employer.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: 400+ master’s programmes or short courses, including Certificate courses. Examples include MSc in Urban Management & Development.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.4 on a 4.0 scale (or 3.17/4.0, may vary).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Minimum of a Bachelor's degree. Scholarships awarded for Master's degrees, short courses, and PhDs.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 2-3 years of appropriate and relevant post-graduate work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional work experience, specifically for those working in government, education institutions (secondary, higher vocational, academic, universities), or the private sector.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English or French language skills required. Demands for certificates showing language skills. Generally, IELTS 6.5 overall or TOEFL above 100 are considered good, but requirements may vary by course.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Considered in the selection process.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Motivation letter is considered. The need for training must be demonstrated in the context of the organization that employs the applicant.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Approval from the applicant's organization to undertake the study. Government statement (if applicable) expressing support. Must fit the embassy's country focus.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Government statement (if applicable), Guidelines and criteria to apply, Scholarships FAQ, Delta application form. Motivation letter and recommendation letters are implied as part of the application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are nominated by Dutch institutions. RNTC Media Training Centre provides the Dutch embassy a shortlist of candidates. The selection committee focuses on GPA, motivation letter, recommendation letters, and experience. Applications are reviewed based on how they fit the embassy's country focus.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Orange Knowledge Programme (OKP) was a €260 million global development programme, funded by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and ran by Nuffic since 2017. It aimed to advance the development of capacity, knowledge, and quality of individuals and organizations, strengthening professionals through education and training. The programme has ended, with its final phase-out in December 2024, and there are no new application rounds.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Ran from 2017 and is planned to end on 31 December 2024, celebrating 7 years of impact. No new application rounds are available.

basic_info.official_name: Kazakhstan Government Scholarship for International Students
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan

funding_info.funding_details: Described as fully funded, covering full tuition fees and providing a monthly allowance for living expenses. However, one source mentions it as a partially funded program, and a monthly stipend of $100 for the bachelor's program is also mentioned.
covered_expenses: Assistance with visa and registration process

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 550 scholarships (490 for Bachelor's, 50 for Master's, 10 for PhD)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan, who want to study for a bachelor's, master's, or PhD degree at top universities in Kazakhstan.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various fields and areas of professional activity. (The Bolashak Program specifically mentions economics, public policy, science, engineering, medicine and other key fields).
field_restrictions.restrictions: For Bolashak Program alumni, there is a requirement to return to Kazakhstan to work for five years in Kazakhstani companies, government structures, or international organizations. This requirement is specifically for Bolashak and not explicitly stated for the Kazakhstan Government Scholarship for international students.

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD programs. Master's applicants need a Bachelor's degree diploma and transcript. PhD applicants need a Master's degree diploma and transcript.

experience_requirements.min_years: For Bolashak International Scholarship: at least 3 years of total work experience, including the last 12 months in the chosen area of specialization.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: An international certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.) with respective minimum scores as specified (for Master and Doctoral applicants).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: One recommendation letter from the educational organization in which the applicant studied, or from the employer (in Kazakh, Russian, or English).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) for Bachelor's degree applicants.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Document on previous level of education with transcript (notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English); Bachelor's and Master's diplomas and transcripts (minimum GPA 3.0/4.0, notarized and translated); Motivation letter; One recommendation letter; Medical certificate; Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available for Bachelor's applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Online application submission. Shortlisted applicants will be interviewed online by representatives of Kazakhstan’s Ministry of Science and Higher Education, the Operator, and universities. Results announced by July 31, 2025.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Kazakhstan Government Scholarship for International Students 2025 is offered by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan for full-time study under Bachelor, Master, and PhD educational programs at top universities in Kazakhstan.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2025 academic year. Application deadline is May 31, 2025. Results are announced by July 31, 2025.

basic_info.study_country: Malaysia, Turkey, United Kingdom (University of Queen Mary), Uganda (Makerere University) are mentioned as having cooperation agreements with IsDB for MSP. For SPMC, studies are supported within applicants' own countries and across IsDB member countries. IsDB member countries include: Afghanistan, Maldives, Albania, Mali, Algeria, Mauritania, Azerbaijan, Morocco, Bahrain, Mozambique, Bangladesh, Niger, Benin, Nigeria, Brunei Darussalam, Oman, Burkina Faso, Pakistan, Cameroon, Palestine, Chad, Qatar, Comoros, Saudi Arabia, Cote d’Ivoire, Senegal, Djibouti, Sierra Leone, Egypt, Somalia, Gabon, Sudan, Gambia, Suriname, Guinea, Syria, Guinea Bissau, Tajikistan, Guyana, Togo, Indonesia, Tunisia, Iran, Turkey, Iraq, Turkmenistan, Jordan, Uganda, Kazakhstan, United A. Djibouti, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Mali Protected, Mauritania, Mozambique, Niger, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Sudan, Togo, Uganda, Yemen.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program providing financial support for undergraduate, master's, Ph.D., and post-doctoral studies, with a special focus on 'Sustainability Science'. The program is also a development program, requiring students to play a leading role in assisting the development of their communities and countries after completion of their studies.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend commensurate with the cost of living of the country of study
Cost of medical treatment at university/government hospital

timeline_info.application_deadline: 5th April, 2025 (for 2025-2026 Undergraduate, Masters, PhD Scholarship Programme); March 20, 2025 (for IsDB Turkish Government Scholarship)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Historically, IsDB has awarded scholarships to 19,491 students and scholars from 56 member countries and 66 Muslim communities since inception. Over 14,500 scholarships have been awarded since 1984. For the Islamic Development Bank – QMUL PhD Scholarships, up to 10 PhD students per year are offered.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be academically meritorious students and mid-career professionals. They must be citizens of any of the IsDB member countries or Muslim communities in non-member countries. Students are required to play a leading role in assisting the development of their communities and countries after completion of their studies, through their respective professions. The Scholarship Program for Muslim Communities (SPMC) is dedicated to supporting academically gifted yet financially constrained Muslim students. Eligible IsDB Member Countries: Afghanistan, Maldives, Albania, Mali, Algeria, Mauritania, Azerbaijan, Morocco, Bahrain, Mozambique, Bangladesh, Niger, Benin, Nigeria, Brunei Darussalam, Oman, Burkina Faso, Pakistan, Cameroon, Palestine, Chad, Qatar, Comoros, Saudi Arabia, Cote d’Ivoire, Senegal, Djibouti, Sierra Leone, Egypt, Somalia, Gabon, Sudan, Gambia, Suriname, Guinea, Syria, Guinea Bissau, Tajikistan, Guyana, Togo, Indonesia, Tunisia, Iran, Turkey, Iraq, Turkmenistan, Jordan, Uganda, Kazakhstan, United A. Djibouti, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Mali Protected, Mauritania, Mozambique, Niger, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Sudan, Togo, Uganda, Yemen. Eligible Muslim Communities in Non-Member Countries (2025-2026): Australia, Cambodia, Croatia, Ethiopia, Fiji, Ghana, India, Kenya, Liberia, Macedonia, Madagascar, Mauritius, Myanmar, Namibia, Nepal, Netherlands, Republic of Congo, Russian Federation, Rwanda, Singapore, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Tanzania, Thailand, The Philippines, Trinidad-Tobago, Vietnam, and Zambia. Least Developed Member Countries (LDMCs) for IsDB-ISFD TVET program include: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Benin, Burkina Faso, Djibouti, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Mali Protected, Mauritania, Mozambique, Niger, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Sudan, Togo, Uganda, Yemen.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Scholarships cover diverse fields related to sustainable development, with a special focus on 'Sustainability Science'. Specific fields include: Medicine, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Information Technology, Agriculture, Marine Studies Energy (Electrical Engineering, Insulation Technologies, Renewable Energy, Energy Technologies), Sustainable Cities (Civil Engineering, Surveying, Urban Planning, Sanitation, Transportation), Responsible Growth (Urban Planning, Economic Geography), Waste Management (Recycling Technologies & Engineering), Population Growth (Demography, Statistics, Econometrics, Population Studies), Green Chemistry (Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Chemical Physics, Green Technologies), Biodiversity (Marine Sciences, Biological Sciences, Ecosystems), Plastic pollution and Micro-plastics (Product Development and Innovation, Plastic Production Industry), Water and Hygiene (Water Resources Management, Water Refinement), Health (Medicine, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Nursing, Medical Laboratories, Microbiology, Public Health, Nutrition, Health Services Management, Bio-Medicine, Medical Technology, Biology, Biotechnology), ICT for Development (Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunication and Electronics, Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, Physical and Numerical Modelling), Innovation & Infrastructure Development (Industrial Technologies, Mechanical Engineering, Surveying), Islamic Economics, Finance and Banking (Islamic Economics, Islamic Finance, Islamic Banking), Social Sciences (Economics, Law, Media and Journalism, Political Sciences, Entrepreneurships).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants must choose a field of study listed among the approved disciplines of the program.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or higher; minimum of 70% in high school final GPA; Second class or 2.0 CGPA in under-graduation, graduated, or masters; a grade above 'Good' in bachelor studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's, Ph.D., and Post-doctoral studies. For MSP, an M.Sc. in the field is required for Ph.D. applicants. Ph.D. students at Birzeit University in Computer Science and related disciplines are highly encouraged to apply for the Master’s Scholarship Program (MSP).

experience_requirements.min_years: 2 years research experience (for MSP applicants)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS or TOEFL Optional

additional_requirements.career_plan: Research must be relevant to the applicant's country. Graduates are required to take part in the development of their communities/countries through their respective professions.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 30 (general); up to 35 years for Ph.D. study; up to 40 years for post-doctoral research (for MSP); under 35 (for MSP).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The Scholarship Program for Muslim Communities (SPMC) supports academically gifted yet financially constrained Muslim students. The program also aims to empower Muslim communities in non-member countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Priority is given to Ph.D. applicants with secured admission at countries and universities that have concluded a cooperation agreement with IsDB.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application through the IsDB scholarship online portal. Essential resources include Scholarship Program Booklets. Academic records are required.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants should prepare for potential interviews. For joint scholarships (e.g., with Queen Mary), offer holders are nominated to IsDB, which then selects the best candidate.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The IsDB Scholarship Program was introduced in 1984. The Scholarship Program for Muslim Communities (SPMC) was launched in 1983. The Merit Scholarship Program (MSP) was launched in 1992. The program is committed to empowering member countries and Muslim communities in non-member countries through education and scientific research. It is a scholarship and development program, requiring students to contribute to their communities/countries after graduation.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the Academic Year 2025-2026.

basic_info.provider: Government of the Czech Republic, Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Health

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships. Full Tuition Fee Coverage for the entire study duration. Monthly stipend: CZK 16,000 for Master's students; CZK 17,000 for PhD students.
covered_expenses: free Czech language and preparatory course (for Czech-taught programs)

timeline_info.application_deadline: 30 September 2025 (for academic year 2026/2027); 30 September 2024 (for academic year 2025/2026)
timeline_info.opening_date: July 20th (for academic year 2025/2026); 4th August (for academic year 2026/2027)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 18 scholarships for students from Ethiopia (academic year 2021/2022); 18 scholarships in English language for academic year 2025/2026 (for Cambodian students)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Foreign nationals from developing countries. For academic year 2026/27, eligible countries include: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Ukraine, Belarus (democratic forces), Ethiopia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Zambia, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Guatemala, Jordan. Scholarships are only available to applicants officially nominated by relevant authorities in eligible countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Economists and data analysts (for 2026/2027 Master’s programs at Charles University). Applicants must choose study or research areas relevant to their current or previous academic focus.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree courses (for Master's applicants); Follow-up Master’s Study programme (for Doctoral applicants). Scholarships are available for Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral study programs, as well as for students, graduates, and Ph.D. candidates.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Academic staff (can apply, implies research experience).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Instruction is given in the Czech language (for some programs, implies Czech proficiency). Instruction is given in English (for some programs, implies English proficiency). Applicant has a good command of English (for English-taught programs). Scholarships without IELTS (implies IELTS might not be strictly required).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants are normally required to sit entrance examinations at the higher education institution concerned. Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies. Free Czech language and preparatory course (for Czech-taught programs). Academic staff are required to submit a letter with their application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: For Doctoral Study Programme Pursued in the English Language: Application Form; CV with a focus on studies and employment; Photocopy of passport; Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships; Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services; Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies; Legalised copy of birth certificate with a certified Czech translation; Medical confirmation (no more than two months old) with a certified English or Czech translation; Legalised copy of a foreign diploma (Master's for Doctoral program) with a certified Czech translation; Legalised copy of a Diploma Supplement or list of completed subjects and examinations including their scope and grades (marks) achieved with a certified Czech translation.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Offered within the framework of its Foreign Development Cooperation. Governed by a Resolution of the Government of the Czech Republic No. 870 as of 27th November 2024. In 2019, the Government of the Czech Republic approved its new Strategy for Granting Governmental Scholarships for Students from Developing Countries. Historically, upon Government Resolution No 301 as of 25 April 2012 on the Strategy for Granting Government Scholarships for Students from Developing Countries in 2013 – 2018.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Education and Higher Education (Qatar Government), Qatar University, Doha Institute for Graduate Studies, Education Above All Foundation, Texas A&M in Qatar

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded (for Qatar Government Scholarships); comprehensive financial support worth up to $200,000 per program.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Qatar Government Scholarships 2026-2027: October 31, 2025 (Source: Instagram/glorno.com); Qatar Government Scholarships 2026-2027: 23 January 2026 (UK time) (Source: Facebook/glorno.global, linking to glorno.com)
timeline_info.opening_date: Qatar Government Scholarship Programmes: Applications officially opened for 2026–2027; Doha Institute for Graduate Studies: September 1, 2025 (for admission application)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Qatar University: around 20 scholarships annually to international students; Education Above All Foundation (EAA) through Qatar Scholarship Programme: commits to award 1200 scholarships (American University of Beirut), 4,000 scholarships throughout the Middle East (five-year expansion)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: General: Highly competitive, often requires strong academic records. Qatar Government Scholarships: Be a Qatari citizen; not older than 25 years for undergraduate abroad, 40 years for PhD, and 45; not previously awarded a scholarship funded by any other entity nor enrolled in any educational institution for the same or higher academic degree as funded by the government. Qatar University (Competitive Admission Scholarship): Residents of Qatar applying for a Bachelor’s degree. Qatar University (GCC States Scholarship): Students from GCC states (excluding Qatar). Qatar University (GCC Qatari Certificate Scholarship): GCC students with Qatari high school certificate. Doha Institute for Graduate Studies: No prior funding from the same DI scholarship program. Education Above All Foundation (Al Fakhoora programme, UDST): Eligible non-Qatari students living in Qatar who have studied in Qatar for at least eight years. Texas A&M in Qatar: Merit-based.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Subjects (for Qatar Government Scholarships); Computer Science & Engineering, Faculty of Health Sciences (mentioned for Qatar University, not as exclusive)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Qatar University (Competitive Admission Scholarship): Must maintain GPA ≥ 3.0; Texas A&M in Qatar: at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA; General for international students: GPA of 3.5/4.0 or equivalent (highly competitive programs)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (for Qatar University Competitive Admission Scholarship, and Qatar Government Scholarships abroad); Master’s and Doctoral Studies (for Doha Institute for Graduate Studies); High school diploma (for Qatari students applying for Qatar Government Scholarships); Bachelors, Masters, PhD, Diploma (for Qatar Government Scholarships)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Qatar University (graduate admission): TOEFL exam or equivalent within the last two years; International students (outside Qatar) requested to submit only IELTS. Many scholarships in Qatar (including QU, HBKU, Doha Institute, government programs) don't require IELTS, accepting alternative English proof; proof of English language proficiency is a prerequisite.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Doha Institute for Graduate Studies: Minimum of THREE academic reference letters to be sent via the online application form.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Qatar Government Scholarships: Not older than 25 years for undergraduate abroad, 40 years for PhD, and 45
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Qatar Government Scholarships: After graduation, the student would be required to work at the candidate’s respective workplace for an equal duration as that of the scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Qatar University (Competitive Admission Scholarship): Final acceptance in QU. Qatar University (GCC States Scholarship): Meet college admission requirements, Embassy nomination letter, apply after receiving final admission decision. Qatar University (GCC Qatari Certificate Scholarship): Qatari certificate holder, meet admission requirements. Doha Institute for Graduate Studies: Submit an admission application to the Doha Institute; once admitted, eligible students will receive a scholarship application form; complete scholarship form with all required documents. Qatar Government Scholarships: Student should not have been previously awarded a scholarship funded by any other entity nor enrolled in any educational institution for the same academic degree (exceptions apply).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Qatar University (Competitive Admission Scholarship): High school certificate or equivalent. Qatar University (GCC States Scholarship): Embassy nomination letter. Doha Institute for Graduate Studies: Copy of official identification (Passport for International students - Qatari ID for citizens and residents of Qatar), academic transcripts, financial proof, research proposal (if applicable), minimum of THREE academic reference letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive. Doha Institute for Graduate Studies: Once admitted, eligible students will receive a scholarship application form from the Admissions Office.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Guided by Qatar's 2030 vision and Sustainable Development Goal 4, the Qatar Scholarships program aims to ensure inclusive and equitable access to quality education and foster lifelong learning opportunities for all. It partners locally and globally with leading institutions. Qatar's scholarship ecosystem provides international students with comprehensive financial support. Qatar University currently awards around 20 scholarships annually to international students, making it highly competitive. The Education Above All Foundation, through its Al Fakhoora programme, awards scholarships for each academic year at University of Doha for Science & Technology (UDST). The Qatar Scholarship Programme is part of a five-year expansion in which EAA commits to awarding 4,000 scholarships throughout the Middle East.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic year 2026-2027 is frequently mentioned for various programs.

basic_info.official_name: ETH Zurich Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering living and study expenses (CHF 12,000 per semester) as well as a tuition fee waiver. The scholarship covers the full study and living costs during the Master’s degree course.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 60 scholarships per year (e.g., for 2025/26 academic year, starting from autumn 2020/21)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international students and outstanding young people from Switzerland and around the world. Applicants must apply to ETH Zurich for a Master's degree programme (no MAS). Must have very good results in their Bachelor's degree programme (top 10% of Bachelor's programme = grade A).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's degree courses generally, including examples like Physics, Robotics, Biology, Computer Science, Science, Technology and Policy, Energy Science and Technology.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No MAS (Master of Advanced Studies) programmes.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Top 10% of Bachelor's programme (equivalent to grade A)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to apply for a Master's degree programme)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research experience, Work experience (considered factors)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL iBT: 100 (or usually 90-100); IELTS: 7.0 overall band score (or usually 6.5-7.0).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from professors (if the Master's programme doesn't already demand references). Must be submitted with the Master application online.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation letter, pre-proposal for Master's thesis, CV, academic transcripts, language proficiency proof. Must be reachable under the telephone.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV, motivation letter, pre-proposal for Master's thesis, academic transcripts, language proficiency proof, two reference letters, and other documents required for Master's admission.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive. Includes an interview. The final decision rests with the Rector of ETH Zurich.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious grant that supports excellent Master's students with a scholarship, mentorship, and a network of the ETH Foundation. It encourages outstanding young people to complete their Master’s degree at ETH Zurich, allowing them to focus fully on studies and research.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded, covering the full cost of studying at Cambridge, and providing financial and non-financial support.
covered_expenses: Full cost of studying at Cambridge
Normal maintenance allowance while on fieldwork as part of a PhD

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding applicants from countries outside the UK (international students), including graduating seniors or alumni. Must pursue a postgraduate degree in any subject at the University of Cambridge. Selection criteria include academic excellence (through transcripts, references, experience, and potential to succeed), superior fit with proposed graduate program, leadership potential, and a commitment to improving the lives of others. Applicants must be able to justify their chosen course and university, and show relevant and advanced coursework. Must meet the University of Cambridge's English language requirements. Financial need is not required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject available at the University of Cambridge

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No strict GPA cutoff, but 3.65 minimum advised, 3.7 or higher (3.8+ highly recommended) is competitive. Average GPA of successful applicants is 3.7-4.0. GPA requirements are ultimately determined by individual graduate programs at Cambridge.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate degree (e.g., PhD, MSc)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Extensive research in the chosen field is valued.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must meet the University of Cambridge's English language requirements (typically IELTS/TOEFL).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References are required and asked for their assessment of an applicant’s suitability based on the four main criteria.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Normally under 30, maximum 30 (conflicting information exists stating no age limit from one source).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must apply for both a Gates Cambridge Scholarship and admission to their chosen postgraduate course at the University of Cambridge. The scholarship application is a supplement within the university admissions application. A research proposal is required for PhD applicants if not part of their admission application, but not for other degrees. A statement (approx. 500 words) explaining why the applicant is applying and how they meet the four main criteria is required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form to the University of Cambridge, Gates Cambridge funding section, transcripts, references, research proposal (for PhD applicants if not part of admission application), personal statement (approx. 500 words).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Academic departments at the University of Cambridge nominate the most academically outstanding applicants. Selection is based on academic excellence, fit with proposed program, leadership potential, commitment to improving lives of others, and assessment from references.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious, fully funded postgraduate scholarship aiming to build a global network of future leaders committed to improving the lives of others. Scholars receive financial and non-financial support, dedicate themselves to their course of study/research, and become part of a vibrant community with alumni connections.

basic_info.study_country: USA, UK, Japan, Australia, Sweden, Thailand & Uganda

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded fellowships.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: up to 130 fellowships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Master’s Degree Program: Minimum three years of related full-time work or volunteer experience, bachelor’s degree, proficiency in English (proficiency in a second-language is strongly recommended), strong commitment to international understanding and peace as demonstrated through professional and academic achievements and personal or community service, excellent leadership skills. Certificate applicants: Minimum five years of related full-time work or volunteer experience, strong academic background. Applicants may not attend a center in their home country or country of permanent residence.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Peace and conflict prevention and resolution, peace and conflict resolution, peace and development.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants may not attend a center in their home country or country of permanent residence, with the exception of Japanese citizens or residents of Japan who have completed a course of study outside Japan and are interested in attending the Rotary Peace Center at International Christian University.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (for Master's degree program)

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum three years (for Master's degree program); minimum five years (for Professional Development Certificate program).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Related full-time work or volunteer experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required TOEFL or IELTS scores for non-native English speakers; GRE scores (required for consideration to UNC; highly recommended for all Duke-UNC Rotary Peace Center Candidates).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Master’s degree program: one academic and one professional. Professional development certificate program: two professional (one from a current employer). Optional: club recommendation.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Articulate clear career goals, showcase how the fellowship supports future aspirations, and demonstrate how the program will enhance career.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No specific age limit.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Japanese citizens or residents of Japan who have completed a course of study outside Japan are an exception to the home country restriction for attending the Rotary Peace Center at International Christian University.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Connect with a Rotary district, obtain district endorsement, submit candidate’s certification (signed and dated). Fellows must maintain full-time academic studies in good standing, speak to various Rotary and non-Rotary audiences, participate in Rotary events, represent The Rotary Foundation, participate in seminars, mentor other fellows, be available for media interviews, submit required reports, and maintain contact with the Foundation after the fellowship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Résumé or curriculum vitae, undergraduate transcripts (required for master’s degree program only), TOEFL or IELTS scores (required for all non-native English speakers for master’s degree program only), GRE scores (required for consideration to UNC; highly recommended for all Duke-UNC Rotary Peace Center Candidates).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application selection results November.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Each year, Rotary awards up to 130 fully funded fellowships for dedicated leaders from around the world to study at one of its peace centers. Since the program began in 2002, the Rotary Peace Centers have trained more than 1,800 fellows who now work in over 140 countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application available online February. Submit application between February and 15 May. Application due to district 31 May. Endorsed applications due to The Rotary Foundation 1 July. Application selection results November.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Covers 100% of course fees and a grant for living costs (stipend of at least £18,622, with some sources stating £20,780). Awards cover the full duration of the student's chosen graduate course.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 28, 2026 (for 2026-27 entry). General deadlines for courses are typically December or January.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2026-27 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 35 scholarships are awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students for select taught Master’s programmes at the University of Oxford.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Select taught Master’s programmes at the University of Oxford, including MBA, 1+1 programme, and MSc in Financial Economics.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only for select taught Master’s programmes listed on the University's website.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 2.8/4.0 or equivalent, with some sources indicating 3.5 or above. Applicants should have an excellent academic record.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate level (Master's, PhD). Applicants must hold a Bachelor's degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years of previous full-time work experience after the bachelor's degree (average class has 5-6 years).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS (minimum score 7.5) or TOEFL score required for English language proficiency (if applicable). GRE required for some programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (Letters of Recommendation).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Required, applicants must explain the relevance of the proposed course of study to their future professional objectives, career goals, and how the course will support them.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Completion of at least one academic semester or quarter by the application deadline. Demonstrated leadership potential. Participation in the Leadership Programme is a compulsory requirement.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Weidenfeld-Hoffmann Scholarships Statement form, Resume/CV (one-page, relevant professional experience), Statement of Purpose (SOP), Official transcripts, Letters of Recommendation, Evidence of English language proficiency (if required), IELTS or TOEFL score, GRE score (if required), Valid Indian Passport (mentioned in one source).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application is made alongside the graduate course application via the Oxford University Admissions Portal. Candidates must tick the 'Weidenfeld-Hoffmann Scholarships and Leadership Programme' checkbox in the 'Funding' section and upload the Weidenfeld-Hoffmann Scholarships Statement form. The process includes an online assessment (three questions) and interviews. Successful applicants receive scholarship offers in May/June.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Weidenfeld-Hoffmann Scholarships and Leadership Programme cultivates the leaders of tomorrow. The Leadership Programme is a unique and compulsory part of these scholarships, focusing on public policy and evaluation of social programmes.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is primarily for the 2026-2027 academic year, though some sources mention 2025 or 2024.

basic_info.provider: Commonwealth Scholarship Commission in the UK (CSC)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO). The CSC’s family allowances are intended to be only a contribution towards the cost of maintaining a Scholar’s family in the UK; scholars must be able to supplement these allowances.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend of £1,781 for living expenses

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Close to 800 students are awarded a Commonwealth scholarship for master's annually. The SIDS stream will offer 20 fully-funded Master's scholarships per year for two consecutive years.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must demonstrate the potential to contribute to the sustainable development of their home countries. Applicants must be from eligible low and middle income Commonwealth countries and be unable to afford to study in the UK without this scholarship. The scholarship requires that applicants are not in full-time employment, as they need to be fully committed to their studies.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subject areas

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 1st Class or 2nd Class Upper Division for Masters in his/her 1st Degree
academic_requirements.required_degree: 1st Degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must have passed an international test for the English language, such as IELTS (minimum overall score of 6.5), TOEFL (minimum overall score of 92), or PTE.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Applicants are required to submit details of three referees. Two recommendation letters from current or former professor, supervisor, or business leader, stamped and/or signed. References should typically address skills, achievements, and past performance.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants should not be in full-time employment. Family allowances are a contribution, and scholars must be able to supplement these to support any family members who accompany them to the UK.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have gotten at least two admissions from UK Universities. Applicants should apply to study at a UK university which has a part funding agreement with the CSC. The CSC does not accept direct applications; candidates must complete an application using the CSC’s online application system in addition to any other application required by the nominating agency. Agencies will nominate candidates to the CSC by December of the application year. Scholarships are for full-time Master’s study at a UK university.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Commonwealth Scholarship Commission in the UK (CSC) provides the UK government scholarship scheme, led by international development objectives. Funded by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), these scholarships enable talented and motivated individuals from eligible low and middle income Commonwealth countries to gain the knowledge and skills required for sustainable development. Established in 1959, over 30,000 individuals have held a Commonwealth Scholarship or Fellowship, with 28,500 funded by the UK government.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for the 2026-2027 academic year, for the 2026 intake, with study in the UK beginning in September/October 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program (JJ/WBGSP)
basic_info.study_country: Worldwide (including USA, Japan, Netherlands, Australia, UK, and other leading universities across the world)

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded master's scholarship for international students, providing comprehensive funding.
covered_expenses: Economy class air travel (round-trip from home city to study location)

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 23, 2025 (12:00 noon EST) for Application Window #2 (2025 intake); April 17, 2026 (for Japanese nationals, 2026 intake)
timeline_info.opening_date: March 25, 2025 (for Application Window #2, 2025 intake); February 16, 2026 (for Japanese nationals, 2026 intake)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 300 scholarships are awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to professionals with relevant experience applying for a master’s degree within the development field. Applicants must be citizens of an eligible World Bank member developing country and not hold dual citizenship of a developed country. They must have a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts. Japanese mid-career professionals dedicated to poverty alleviation and shared prosperity in developing countries, currently enrolled in a master’s or PhD graduate degree program outside of Japan in development-related fields, are also eligible. Applicants must be accepted unconditionally to enroll in the upcoming academic year in one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs by the application deadline date. Not eligible if a World Bank Group staff member (including consultants) or a relative of a WBG staff member. The program ensures gender balance, geographical diversity, and prioritizes applicants with limited access to other financial resources. Eligibility is also tied to admission to one of the 41 Participating Master’s Programs.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s degree programs in development-related fields, including key areas of sustainable development such as economic policy management, tax policy, infrastructure management, public planning, global sustainability policy and management, global health policy and management, public policy, public health, urban management and development, development studies, water and sustainable development, and public policy and taxation.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants can only apply for one master’s programme when applying for the JJ/WBGSP scholarship.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) earned at least 3 years prior to application deadline date (for master's scholarship applicants). Japanese nationals may be enrolled in a master’s or PhD graduate degree program.

experience_requirements.min_years: 3 years or more
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Paid professional experience in a development-related area, with a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Official English test results (TOEFL, IELTS, etc.) are required. Only original official certificates are accepted.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two professional letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A compelling Statement of Purpose (SOP) is required.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Prioritizes applicants with limited access to other financial resources.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: An unconditional offer of admission from a participating master’s program is required. Applicants are often shortlisted by the university before being invited to apply for the scholarship. Not eligible if a World Bank Group staff member or relative.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form, official academic transcripts, updated CV, two professional letters of recommendation, compelling Statement of Purpose (SOP), unconditional offer of admission from a participating program, and official English test results (TOEFL, IELTS, etc.).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Following pre-screening based on online information, shortlisted applicants meeting eligibility criteria and deemed suitable for admission will be invited to submit additional documents. Universities often shortlist candidates, and the scholarship application link is then communicated to those shortlisted.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The program is now in its 25th year. It has awarded 3,503 scholarships in its regular program to applicants from over 150 World Bank member countries. The program ensures gender balance, geographical diversity, and prioritizes applicants with limited access to other financial resources.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship typically operates with two application windows annually. Applicants for some programs (e.g., IPADS MSc) must apply to the World Bank in Application Window #2 after securing admission.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering course fees and providing a generous grant for living expenses. For full-time courses, scholars receive an annual grant for living expenses of at least the UKRI minimum doctoral stipend rate, which is normally sufficient to cover the living costs of a single student living in Oxford.

timeline_info.application_deadline: December or January admissions deadline, whichever is relevant to your course (e.g., 01-Jan-2026 for the 2026/27 cycle).
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2026/27 cycle.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 200 new, fully-funded scholarships are offered each year (some sources state around 140 awards annually).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from all nationalities and all subject areas. Candidates must apply for a new Master's or DPhil course at the University of Oxford. Current students who will continue to study for the same degree at Oxford in the next year are not eligible. Applicants must demonstrate exceptional academic performance, leadership potential, and for DPhil applicants, research potential. English language proficiency requirements (IELTS/TOEFL) must be met if applicable.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subject areas; all full-time and part-time DPhil and Master's courses are eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Typically requires a minimum GPA of 3.7 (for MBA applicants) or 80% equivalent, or ranking in the top 20% of their class. An exceptional Master’s degree can compensate for a moderate first degree performance.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's or DPhil (PhD) courses.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years of full-time professional experience (for MBA applicants).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time professional experience (for MBA applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency requirements (IELTS/TOEFL) must be met if applicable.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required for selection process.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must meet academic standards of chosen graduate program, demonstrate leadership skills, show research potential (for Ph.D. applicants), have an excellent academic record (usually first-class honors), and meet the conditions of the offer of a place to study at Oxford.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Research proposals (for DPhil applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are automatically considered for a Clarendon scholarship when they apply for a new Master's or DPhil course at Oxford by the relevant December or January admissions deadline. Selection criteria vary by subject and degree type, focusing on academic potential, aptitude for the proposed study, and evidence from references and research proposals. Successful applicants are contacted by the Clarendon Fund Administrator with an offer letter once the shortlist is confirmed.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A fully-funded, merit-based graduate scholarship for outstanding students worldwide, offering the opportunity to join an active, internationally diverse, and multidisciplinary community at Oxford and form lasting social, academic, and professional networks.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2026-2027 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: The Rhodes Scholarship is fully funded, covering University of Oxford course fees and providing an annual stipend. It covers students' fees, accommodation, and living costs for up to three years at Oxford. For the 2025-26 academic year, the stipend is £20,400 per annum (£1,700 per month).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 102 scholarships awarded annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to exceptional young people globally, committed to service, impatient with the status quo, and courageous. Candidates must have satisfactorily completed two years of full-time study and received a bachelor’s degree, or will have in the year following the Rhodes Scholarship application. Applicants should have outstanding records in academics, leadership, and community service, as well as sustained and energetic participation in areas such as sports, music, debate, dance, theatre, and artistic pursuits, particularly where teamwork is involved. The detailed eligibility criteria varies slightly depending on the constituency; Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration is available for those with strong connections to multiple Rhodes constituencies but not meeting their specific nationality or citizenship criteria.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excluding professional degree programs such as law and medicine

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.7; successful applicants for institutional endorsement typically have 3.8 or higher
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (completed or to be completed in the year following application) for post-bachelor/graduate study

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language proficiency test results (IELTS Academic or TOEFL IBT) are required. Recommended scores: at least 95 on TOEFL, 7.0 on IELTS, or 130 on Duolingo English Test. Language requirements must be met by the application deadline.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Minimum of 4, typically 5-8 letters of recommendation required. At least 3-4 must be academic references.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Post Scholarship Plan (150 words max) describing immediate plans upon completion of the scholarship and how a UK degree would enhance these plans. A Personal Statement or essay is required, including a clear statement of what the applicant wishes to study at Oxford and why.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Must be 19-27 years old as of the application deadline.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Candidates with strong connections to two or more Rhodes constituencies but not meeting their specific eligibility criteria may consider Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should have a desire to study at the University of Oxford and a clear sense of what the University would gain from their presence. Demonstrated sustained commitment to serving others, leadership, initiative, and extracurricular interests are important. University endorsement is often required, necessitating participation in campus application processes. It is highly recommended for candidates to get in touch with degree programs or faculty within their proposed program of study at the University of Oxford to demonstrate commitment.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Contact information, evidence of eligibility, education history including university transcripts (and high school marks/certificate), proposed Oxford course(s), CV/resumé, Academic Statement, Personal Statement, English Language proficiency test results, photograph (not visible until short-listing), and details for 4-8 referees.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The scholarship has rigorous selection criteria. Applications for the Rhodes Scholarship will require University endorsement, and candidates selected for endorsement will work with their institution's scholarship office to finalize materials before the national deadline. The full application of successful candidates will be accessible to Rhodes House, Oxford, where references can be re-used for subsequent application to the University of Oxford.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Rhodes Scholarship is the oldest and most celebrated international fellowship award, funding two to three years of graduate study at the University of Oxford. It aims to bring together and develop exceptional young people from around the world, across all fields of study, who are committed to service, challenge the status quo, and possess the courage to act.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application cycle for Rhodes Scholars beginning their program of study in October 2026 opens in Spring 2025, with a global application deadline of 31 July 2025. The scholarship funds two to three years of study.

basic_info.provider: Asian Development Bank (ADB) with financing from the Government of Japan.
basic_info.study_country: Designated educational institutions across Asia and the Pacific, including Japan (15 institutions) and the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa (UHM) in the USA (specifically Hawaii).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering full tuition fees, subsistence (including housing allowance), book allowance, medical insurance, travel, and research subsidies.
covered_expenses: Roundtrip airfare from home country to Hawaii
Housing in the East-West Center residence hall (single occupancy)
Monthly stipend for subsistence and incidental expenses
Allowance for books and study materials

timeline_info.application_deadline: Deadlines vary significantly by institution and year. Examples include: September 5, 2025 (general), June 30, 2025 (U-Tokyo), August 19 - September 6, 2024 (Kyoto U GSM), November 21, 2025 (GRIPS/National Graduate Institute for Policy Studies), March 31, 2025 (AIT), November 15, 2025 (International Public Policy, Tsukuba).
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by institution; Kyoto University GSM had an application period starting August 19, 2024.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 135-140 graduate scholarships a year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be well-qualified citizens of ADB borrowing member countries and Japanese Official Development Assistance scholarship eligible countries. They must agree to return to their home country after studies to contribute to its development. Not eligible are: Executive directors, alternate directors, management and staff of ADB, consultants, and their close relatives; staff of ADB–JSP partner institutions; applicants already enrolled in graduate degree programs; applicants living or working in a country other than their home country. Applicants from countries no longer borrowing from ADB are generally not eligible, though applications from other Developing Member Countries of ADB may be considered under specific circumstances by some institutions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Economics, business and management, science and technology, and other development-related fields. Specific examples include: Business Administration (Global MBA), Economics (MA), Geography (MA), Law (LLM), Natural Resources & Environmental Management (MS), Ocean & Resources Engineering (MS), Oceanography (MS), Pacific Islands Studies (MA), Public Administration (MPA), Sociology (MA), Tropical Plant & Soil Sciences (MS), Urban & Regional Planning (MURP).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excluding IMAT program applicants at APU.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Varies by institution; some institutions like AIT require at least 2.75 out of 4.0 or equivalent, while others state no specific GPA requirement.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree or postgraduate studies (maximum duration of two years).

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of full-time professional working experience (acquired after a university degree) at the time of application.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional working experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required English proficiency tests include IELTS, TOEFL iBT, and TOEIC. Minimum scores vary by institution (e.g., IELTS 6.5, TOEFL iBT 85 for some; no minimum IELTS score stated for others).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation Letters are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants must agree to return to their home country after completion of studies to contribute to its development.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants must not exceed 35 years of age at the time of application.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submission of Certificate of Income (if selected as a candidate), finding an academic supervisor (for some institutions like Institute of Science Tokyo), preparing an ADB-JSP Information Sheet, a one-page research proposal, and participation in the EWC Leadership Certificate Program (for EWC scholars).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application forms (ADB-JSP specific and institutional), Passport, Essays, Recommendation Letters, Proof of English Proficiency, Academic Transcript, Standardized Tests (if required), ADB-JSP Information Sheet, Income Certificate, one-page research proposal. Separate applications are often required for the scholarship and university admission.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Academic institutions screen and rank applicants, then submit recommendations to ADB. No separate application to ADB is required; applications go directly through the academic institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in April 1988 to encourage human resource development. Offers about 135-140 graduate scholarships annually for studies in development-related fields at 25 designated institutions across Asia and the Pacific (including 15 in Japan) and UHM/EWC. Maximum duration is two years for a Master's program, with an initial award for one year and possibility of extension. APU was selected as a designated institution in 2010. The JASAA is an alumni organization for past scholars.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Established in April 1988.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program; comprehensive support; provides up to $50,000 per year for financial, social, and academic support.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for 2026/2027 academic year are now open (University of Cambridge)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 25 (University of Toronto for 2025-2026 academic year); 40 (Arizona State University); approximately 55 master's degree students with a new cohort of 29+ entering (UC Berkeley); 40 (for 2026/2027 academic year, general)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Talented young Africans; students from Africa with proven academic and leadership potential who have access to few educational opportunities; high-achieving African students; citizens from Sub-Saharan Africa; young people who face the highest social and economic barriers to opportunity; refugees, forcibly displaced youth and host communities; expected to return home after graduating from Berkeley and undertaking any optional practical training in accordance with visa regulations; required upon review and approval to undertake an internship in Africa during their studies at Berkeley.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any full-time one-year postgraduate courses (University of Cambridge); postgraduate on-campus (Master's) and online scholarships (Master's & Postgraduate Diplomas) (University of Edinburgh); undergraduate, accelerated master's, and technology/innovation (Arizona State University); health-related disciplines (University of Toronto); master’s degree (general).
field_restrictions.restrictions: University of Cambridge excludes: MBA, MFin, MAcc, Master of Corporate Law, and other business/finance programs, 2-year master's programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA above 2.80 out of a 4.0 GPA Scale; satisfactory scholastic average; expected to remain in good academic standing throughout their program (UC Berkeley).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (for Master's/Postgraduate Diploma applications).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Refugees, forcibly displaced youth and host communities.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must first be admitted to one of CMU-Africa's degree programs; Scholars will participate in activities as part of the wider Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program at the University of Edinburgh, including work-based placements, mentorships, and other activities during the academic year; leadership development, career preparation, and community service (CMU-Africa); F-1 Student visas (UC Berkeley starting Fall 2026).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program Application Form (UBC); online application to UBC (after MCF application); request a fee waiver when submitting application package (UBC).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are submitted directly to partner universities; application process and decision-making are managed individually by each partner; students must first be admitted to one of CMU-Africa's degree programs; eligible applicants will be invited to apply to the Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program by October 15th 2025 (UBC).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Enables talented young Africans to pursue a master’s degree and grow their leadership potential; network of young people embarking on a journey toward inclusive and equitable socio-economic change in Africa; comprehensive support to enable young people to attain inclusive and relevant education, transition smoothly into dignified and fulfilling work, and lead transformative lives; implemented through partner universities and non-governmental organizations; global network of 33 Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program partners; over 57,000 scholarships committed and a growing network of Mastercard Foundation Scholars and Alumni; aims to provide scholarships to 25,000 refugees, forcibly displaced youth and host communities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2026/2027 academic year are now open; 2025-2026 academic year (University of Toronto).

basic_info.provider: Southeast Asian Regional Center for Graduate Study and Research in Agriculture (SEARCA)
