funding_info.funding_details: A prestigious, comprehensive, and fully funded scholarship program for master’s and doctoral degree studies. The program is supported by the SEDF, Philippine Government, AF, BulSU, DAAD, NU, NTU, SU, Tokyo NODAI, and UPM.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for Academic Year 2026–2027

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to nationals of SEAMEO member countries (Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Timor-Leste, and Vietnam). Applicants must be regular employees of academic or research institutions or government agencies.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Agriculture and related sciences

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's (MS) and Doctoral (PhD) degrees

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Regular employees of academic, research, or government institutions

additional_requirements.age_limits: Master's Degree: not more than 35 years old; PhD: not more than 40 years old at the time of application.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: DAAD In-Country/In-Region scholarship holders are encouraged to apply for a research grant in Germany for 2 to 6 months and are expected to pursue a career in teaching and/or research at a higher education institution in their home region or country.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must not have any pending scholarship applications under another program; Research must align with SEARCA priorities.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: SEARCA Scholarship Application Form (2 copies), application forms for admission to the Graduate program, and other required documents. All required documents must be uploaded online.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: SEARCA screens and evaluates application documents. Longer evaluation for joint scholarships or applicants awaiting university admission. SEARCA sends official invitations to Ministries, universities, and partner agencies to nominate candidates. SEARCA reserves the right to make the final decision on the choice of study post.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Designed to empower the next generation of agricultural leaders and professionals, cultivate experts for agricultural innovation and sustainable development, and strengthen leadership and expertise in agriculture across Southeast Asia.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for Academic Year 2026–2027 are open, with a deadline of September 30, 2025.

basic_info.study_country: North America, Europe (including United States and United Kingdom)

funding_info.funding_details: Up to USD 100,000. Need & Merit-based. If total funding required (tuition + living allowance) exceeds USD 100,000, candidates must show evidence that they have the ability to cover the additional requirement needed.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Between 10-12 scholarships each year (not a strict number)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all Indian citizens continuously resident in India for the past six months at the time of application. Must be bright Indian students with exceptional academic achievements. Not eligible if studies abroad have already begun. Must be Indian passport holders residing in India, born on or after January 1, 1995. Must hold a first-class degree from a recognised Indian university (UG degree holders). For full-time Master’s, MPhil, or doctoral programs. Applicants should highlight how studies abroad will contribute back home.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time Master’s, MPhil, or doctoral programs in Social Sciences, Humanities, Law, Fine Arts, Architecture, Mathematics, Sciences, Environment and related subjects.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum academic grade of 65% (CGPA 6.8/10, GPA 2.6/4) for Social Sciences, Humanities, Law, Fine Arts, Architecture; or 70% (CGPA 7.2/10, GPA 3/4) for Mathematics, Sciences, Environment and related subjects, from a recognized university/institution.
academic_requirements.required_degree: First-class undergraduate degree from a recognised Indian university, for pursuing full-time Master’s, MPhil, or doctoral programs.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience in the chosen field may be advantageous.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language requirement (e.g., IELTS/TOEFL) must be fulfilled and certificate submitted before online application if it's a conditional part of the offer letter.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Letters of Recommendation (from academics/professionals)
additional_requirements.career_plan: Detailed study or research proposal (500-1000 words)
additional_requirements.age_limits: Born on or after January 1, 1995
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be high achievers academically and otherwise (proof required). If total funding required exceeds USD 100,000, candidates must show evidence of ability to cover additional requirement.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Valid passport, academic transcripts, Two Letters of Recommendation (from academics/professionals), detailed study or research proposal (500-1000 words), proof of additional funds if total funding exceeds USD 100,000.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Implies an interview stage. Between 10-12 scholarships awarded annually.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1976, the Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarship offers comprehensive financial support for exceptional Indian talent to pursue postgraduate or doctoral programs in top international institutions across North America and Europe. It aims to bridge financial gaps for Indian students aspiring to global education. The Foundation also offers other fellowships and grants, such as the Inlaks Fine Art Award (₹3,00,000 for a year for art residency).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open from 14th February to 31st March 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Awards financial aid of up to $12,500. The scholarship is based upon demonstrated need and is not intended to cover all academic or personal expenses. A $10,000 scholarship renewable for a second year is also mentioned. 209 scholarships were awarded during the year, totaling $2,233,548.

timeline_info.application_deadline: December 15, 2025 (Last day to submit Eligibility Forms; applications accepted until mid-December 2025)
timeline_info.opening_date: September 15, 2025 (IPS begins to accept Eligibility Forms; applications accepted from mid-September 2025)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: A woman is eligible for consideration if she is an international woman student (citizen of a country other than the U.S. or Canada) seeking to pursue graduate study (Master's or Doctoral degree programs) in the U.S. or Canada. She must be accepted into an accredited U.S. or Canadian postsecondary institution. Doctoral students who have completed coursework and are working only on dissertations are not eligible as first-time applicants. Doctoral students in medicine or dentistry will be considered in the final two (2) years of coursework, internship or residency. Applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrate financial need. She must have a full year of coursework remaining and be enrolled and in residence in the U.S. or Canada for the entire school year, or be an international student attending Cottey College.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Graduate studies, including master's and doctoral degree programs. Doctoral students in medicine or dentistry are considered in their final two years of coursework, internship, or residency.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Doctoral students who have completed coursework and are working only on dissertations are not eligible as first-time applicants.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Must intend to return to her home country to utilize her education to make a positive impact and foster global peace.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: International students attending Cottey College are also eligible. Doctoral students in medicine or dentistry are considered in their final two years of coursework, internship, or residency.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Depending on her visa status, an applicant will be required to fill out and sign a document agreeing to leave the United States or Canada and return to her home country within sixty (60) days of finishing her degree program(s) or Alternative Practical Training (OPT). At the time of application, the applicant is required to indicate additional financial resources adequate to meet her estimated expenses.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Eligibility Forms, Application Form
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1949, the P.E.O. International Peace Scholarship Fund (IPS) provides scholarships for international women students to pursue graduate study in the U.S. or Canada to foster global peace through education. Since 1951, IPS has also assisted international Cottey College students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-27 International Peace Scholarships are accepted from mid-September to mid-December 2025. Eligibility Forms are accepted from September 15, 2025, with the last day to submit being December 15, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Brazil Postgraduate Student Agreement Scholarships (PEC-PG) / Programa de Estudantes-Convênio de Pós-Graduação (PEC-PG)
basic_info.provider: Brazilian government, Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MRE), Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel (CAPES), National Council for Scientific and Technological Development (CNPq), Brazilian Federal Agency for Support and Evaluation of Graduate Education (CAPES)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarship, fully funded opportunities, full financial coverage, full funding, financial assistance and tuition coverage.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 29 September 2025 (For Masters), 30 December 2025 (For Doctoral), November 14, 2025 (Last Date to Submit Application Forms)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 650 scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students; Nationals of PEC-PG partner countries who meet academic requirements; Citizen of a developing country with which Brazil maintains an Agreement or Memorandum of Understanding in the area of Cultural, Educational or Science and Technology.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of disciplines, across different fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (for Master's program); Master's degree (for PhD program); Diploma or certificate of completion of undergraduate, Masters or nursing home (in the case of candidate of medical area).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Test Application Portuguese CAPES, duly signed by the applicant and responsible for the Embassy of Brazil.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If you completed your master's degree in Brazil through PEC-PG, or with a scholarship from a Brazilian agency (including CAPES or CNPq), you must have spent at least 2 years outside Brazil.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must apply for a Master’s, PhD, or Sandwich Doctorate at a Brazilian Higher Education Institution (HEI); IES acceptance letter from a Brazilian public or private HEI, indicating the graduate program, area of interest, research interests, dissertation/thesis topic, and guiding candidate's name under the Manual model attached; Applicant should start their scholarship no later than three years after graduating with their Bachelor's degree.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: IES acceptance letter from a Brazilian HEI; Test Application Portuguese CAPES; Diploma or certificate of completion of undergraduate, Masters or nursing home (in the case of candidate of medical area), front and back in Spanish, Portuguese or English.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Brazil PEC-PG Postgraduate Scholarship Program is a fully funded scholarship for International students to undertake a full-time doctoral, Sandwich doctoral, or full-time Master program from the Brazilian Institutes. It promotes international cooperation, cultural exchange, and academic excellence, attracting foreign students to Brazil and encouraging the exchange of knowledge among partner countries, while simultaneously benefiting Brazilian institutions through the interaction of students and faculty with qualified researchers working abroad. The program aims to continue the training of professionals from other countries in Brazilian universities and enhance Brazil’s standing as a global leader in education, research, and technology by drawing highly skilled students from all over the world, hence aiding in the internationalisation of Brazilian universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic year 2026 / 2026–2027 intake.

basic_info.provider: Marshall Aid Commemoration Commission, Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

funding_info.funding_details: Funds one or two years for master's degree programmes, or up to three years for doctoral study. For PhD/DPhil candidates, the Commission provides three years of guaranteed funding subject to academic progress.
covered_expenses: Living expenses (stipend of £1,160 per month mentioned)
Flights/Travel to and from the UK

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 50 per year (some years may be less, e.g., 36)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be citizens of the United States (at the time they apply). By the time they take up their scholarship (September 2026), they must hold their first undergraduate degree from an accredited four-year college or university in the US. They must not have studied for, or hold a degree or degree-equivalent qualification from a British University or GCSE or A Levels taken at school in the UK. Selection committees seek candidates with the potential to excel as scholars, leaders, and contributors to improved UK-US understanding, demonstrating leadership and ambassadorial potential.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject at graduate level; most kinds of Masters and PhD programs at UK universities.

academic_requirements.required_degree: First undergraduate degree from an accredited four-year college or university in the US (by September of the scholarship year).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three letters of recommendation are typically required. An undergraduate institution's letter of endorsement is also required, submitted by the institution to the regional committee.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A Post-Scholarship Plan essay is required (150 words or 500 words depending on source, one-year applicants must explain why they cannot spend more than a year). Demonstrated relevance of program to career or personal goals is important.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Cambridge Marshall PhD Scholarships offer third-year funding extensions by the University of Cambridge for those pursuing a doctorate there.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Potential to excel as scholars, leaders, and contributors to improved UK-US understanding. Demonstrated leadership potential and ambassadorial potential.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, 2026 Statements for Marshall Scholarship Application, 5 short written components (including a 750-word Personal Statement and a 150-word Post-Scholarship Plan essay), Certified transcript(s), Three letters of recommendation, and an institutional letter of endorsement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates complete an online application and submit it to their undergraduate institution. If endorsed, the institution adds a letter and submits it to the appropriate regional committee. Selection committees look for successful candidates with leadership and ambassadorial potential, and the ability to contribute to UK-US understanding. Campus interviews for endorsements may be held (e.g., early September). Students must be nominated by their university's UK Scholarship Committee.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Marshall Scholarship is the UK’s flagship scholarship programme with the United States, established by an Act of Parliament in 1953. It enables American graduates to pursue postgraduate study at any British University in any subject at graduate level. It is one of the most prestigious forms of funding for American Masters students in the UK, having supported over 2,000 American students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is for the 2026-27 academic year, with studies commencing in Fall 2026 (September 2026). Application materials for the 2026 cycle are available.

funding_info.funding_details: Funded, Fully Funded. Scholarships help with tuition fees and general expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: about 30 scholarships (Limited number)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international students from developing countries and ADC priority countries (e.g., Armenia, Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Georgia, Mozambique, Moldova, Palestinian Territories, Uganda). Applicants must be passionate individuals eager to learn and grow while contributing to their home countries’ development. Must meet admission requirements specified by ITH and visa processes.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diploma Course of the Institute of Tourism and Hotel Management (ITH) in Hospitality or Tourism Management.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: HSC = GPA 4.50 (2023 science), SSC = GPA 5.00 (2021 science)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma Course (implies completion of secondary education)

experience_requirements.min_years: 1 year
experience_requirements.accepted_types: hotel or tourism industry

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No IELTS Required. Excellent command of English language. TOEFL scores (95 minimum) or equivalent proof of English fluency (Code is 8707).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter (from your present work)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Provide all admission requirements (read the ITH application information and visa process carefully).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship Application Letter, Letter Of Intent For Scholarship, Recommendation letter (from your present work), Birth certificate, Copy of passport, Certificate proving knowledge of English (TOEFL).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students will be informed about the results of their application in May 2025. Awarded students will receive a letter of acceptance.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Austrian Development Cooperation offers scholarships every year to students from developing countries to help with tuition fees and general expenses. This scholarship empowers students to pursue educational and professional goals in tourism and hospitality management. The ITH Diploma Course offers advanced training tailored to the needs of developing countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025 Austrian Development Cooperation Scholarships are now open with a deadline of March 16, 2025. The application form for the next cycle (2026) will be available from September 2025 to January 6, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Commerce of the People’s Republic of China (MOFCOM)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering tuition, accommodation, living allowance, and international airfare.
covered_expenses: Free dorm stay (on-campus accommodation or subsidy)
One-time round-trip international airfare (first trip to China after enrollment, and trip back to home country upon graduation)
Up to 'n-1' round-trip international airfares for home visits (one time per year, 'n' is length of schooling year, max 3 years)

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 8, 2026 (for CGSIS submission for 2026 cycle); deadlines vary by country and program (e.g., May 31, 2025 for 2025 cycle, or Nov 1, 2023 - Mar 31, 2024 for other cycles)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 111 scholarships were reportedly handed out at undergraduate and post-graduate level in a past instance.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of developing countries, under 45 years old (for Master's programs). Applicants must not be currently studying in China or have been admitted to other Chinese government scholarship programs. Admission requires decent physical conditions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: One-year or two-year Master’s programs, three-year Doctoral programs, undergraduate (Bachelors) studies, and non-degree Chinese language studies. Programs offer inter-disciplinary education in fields such as government, trade, foreign affairs, agriculture, technology, education, culture, and health. Specific programs like Master of Meteorology are mentioned.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarship winners at some universities (e.g., Tianjin University) must register for English-taught programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA ≥3.25 (4-point scale) or ≥4.0 (5-point scale). For non-degree Chinese language studies, a National Senior Certificate (or equivalent) with a minimum of 60% average (excluding Life Orientation) is required. Marks of pre-requisite subjects for chosen field of study will be reviewed separately.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree for graduate programs (Master's/PhD). Master's degree for PhD programs. National Senior Certificate (or equivalent) for undergraduate or non-degree Chinese language studies.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of professional working experience in international taxation, tax policy and/or administration, and/or any related area (specific to some programs/universities). General 'relevant working experiences' are also required.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional working experience in fields like international taxation, tax policy, administration, or other relevant areas.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants for master's, doctoral, general scholar, and senior scholar programs taught in Chinese must submit a valid HSK score report that meets the corresponding Chinese language proficiency requirements. Only Chinese and English are accepted for online application forms.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation, in Chinese or English, from professors or associate professors. For some programs, letters from a current employer and academic sources are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study plan or research proposal.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 45 years old (for Master's programs).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Successful scholarship applicants may be required to sign a contract and return to their home country (e.g., South Africa) upon completion of their studies. Applicants should not be currently studying in China or admitted to other Chinese government scholarship programs.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Decent physical conditions.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed MOFCOM Scholarship Application Form, Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship online, copies of Bachelor's/Master's degree certificates and academic transcripts, valid HSK score report (for Chinese-taught programs), two letters of recommendation, study plan or research proposal, health certificate, and other supporting documents.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process varies depending on the university and program. Applicants must choose an eligible university and program. Online application involves registering on the Chinese Government Scholarship Information System (CGSIS), inputting personal details, selecting program category 'Type A', inputting agency number (e.g., 00010), and uploading supporting documents. Some universities (e.g., Wuhan University of Technology) require a separate online application through their own system. Scholarship-receiving authorities will inform qualified candidates of the program category and agency number.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The MOFCOM Scholarship is a prestigious government scholarship program by the Ministry of Commerce of the People’s Republic of China, designed to attract outstanding international students from developing countries to study in China. It aims to build intellectual capacity and facilitate economic and social development in recipient countries. The scholarship supports Master’s programs (1-3 years) and PhD programs (3 years). There are 26 designated universities for the MOFCOM Scholarship.

basic_info.provider: Mexican Agency for International Development Cooperation (AMEXCID), Government of Mexico, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Mexico

funding_info.funding_details: Fully or partially funded program. Includes a one-time grant of US$1,200 (from OAS or AMEXCID, related to the CONAHCYT-OAS-AMEXCID scholarship announcement).

timeline_info.opening_date: August 15, 2025 (for Canadian students, potentially general opening)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign individuals/citizens/international students and researchers from over 180 countries with diplomatic relations, bilateral legal frameworks, multilateral mechanisms, and special agreements with Mexico. Specific eligibility details are available on the official AMEXCID website. Selection criteria include geographic distribution (applicant's country of origin and receiving institution in Mexico), human development index, gender diversity, and student rank.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Programs with interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary approaches, various areas of sciences. Must be academic programs registered with the National Council for Science and Technology (CONACYT) as National Quality Graduate Programs or recognized in the National Postgraduate System, offered by over 90 Mexican Higher Education Institutions.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 85/100 or 8.5/10 (per the Mexican system)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s mobility, undergraduate, specialization, Master’s, doctorate/PhD, postgraduate research, postdoctoral fellowships, and graduate-level academic mobility programs.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Acceptance letter from host university (issued within 60 days, indicating min GPA 85/100 or 8.5/10, study start/end dates) for non-residents of Mexico. OR Letter of presentation from receiving University in Mexico (issued within 60 days, indicating GPA 85/100 or 8.5/10, regular student status, study start/end dates) for persons residing in Mexico. Formal submission of documentation to Academic Exchange Department required upon selection. Applicants must attach documentation as per system indications and call provisions. Gender diversity is a selection criterion.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Acceptance letter from host university (for non-residents of Mexico) OR Letter of presentation from receiving University in Mexico (for residents of Mexico). All documentation must be in accordance with the indications of the Academic Cooperation Management System (SIGCA) and the 2025 call provisions.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are made electronically through the Academic Cooperation Management System (SIGCA). Selection criteria include geographic distribution (applicant's country of origin and receiving institution in Mexico), human development index, level of study (PhD preferred over Master's, Master's over Specialization), gender diversity, and student rank provided by the university coordinator. Results are announced on the webpages of OAS, CONAHCYT, and AMEXCID.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A fully or partially funded program promoting international collaboration, human capital development, and cultural exchange. Focuses on interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary learning. Offers opportunities to study or research in over 90-91 Mexican Higher Education Institutions (HEIs), with programs registered with CONACYT as National Quality Graduate Programs or recognized in the National Postgraduate System. Duration ranges from 3 to 24 months depending on the scholarship component.

basic_info.official_name: ICCR Scholarships (Indian Council for Cultural Relations)

funding_info.funding_details: ICCR scholarships are a fully funded opportunity for international students, covering various expenses to alleviate financial burdens.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 3000+ scholarships under 21 different schemes annually (640 slots for Atal Bihari Vajpayee General Scholarship Scheme for 2025-26)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Interested international students are invited to apply. Applicants must have completed the required level of education for their chosen course. Students already pursuing UG/PG courses in India and intending to pursue further studies must apply afresh. Proficiency in English is expected. A passport is a compulsory requirement for foreign students to study in India. It is compulsory for all ICCR scholarship students to procure a Medical Insurance policy with a minimum sum assured for Indian Rupees Five Lakhs per annum.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Courses offered in Indian State and Central Universities. The list of courses is available with the application form on the A2A ICCR Scholarship Portal.
field_restrictions.restrictions: ICCR scholarships are offered only for studies in Indian State and Central Universities. They are not offered for studying in Private Indian or Deemed Universities.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 60 percent marks or GPA 3 out of 5 (or equivalent)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Completion of the required level of education for the course (Undergraduate, Postgraduate, Ph.D. programs are eligible)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants are expected to have proficiency in English. There is an optional provision for providing marks obtained in English Proficiency Tests like TOEFL/IELTS. No separate English Proficiency Test will be conducted by the Embassy or Consulate General of India.

additional_requirements.age_limits: 18 to 40 years for Undergraduate and Postgraduate courses; 50 years or younger for Ph.D. programs.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants have the option of applying to 5 Universities/Institutes of their choice in preferential order through the A2A Scholarship Portal. Students are advised to visit respective University/Institute websites for courses, eligibility, and general information before applying. After acceptance, applicants must approach the Indian Mission/Post for a Student/Research Visa. Upon arrival, students must register with the respective ICCR Zonal/Sub Zonal Office. Regular half-yearly progress reports/results, attendance certificates, and valid medical insurance policy must be submitted for stipend release.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Admission by an Indian University does not guarantee an ICCR scholarship. Indian Missions may offer scholarships to other students if initial acceptances are less than allocated seats.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Indian Council for Cultural Relations administers various scholarship programs annually, awarding scholarships to foreign students from about 180 countries. The A2A portal contains relevant information, including Indian Universities, courses, and guidelines.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: A2A Portal opens on 20th February 2025. Last date for uploading applications is 08 June 2025. Last date for students to confirm/reject scholarship offer is 22 June 2025. Indian Mission may offer scholarships to other students from 01 July 2025 if seats remain.

funding_info.funding_details: Awards range from $20,000 to $50,000. Up to five International Master’s/First Professional Degree Fellowships are renewable for a second year.
covered_expenses: travel to professional meetings, conferences or seminars

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 7, 2025 (extended deadline for 2026-2027 Fellowship & Grant cycle); September 30, 2025 (for 2025/2026 cycle); Applications are open until November 15.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies every year, generally between 50 to 100 awards.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to women, including people who identify as women. Applicants must not be U.S. citizens or permanent residents. Must be pursuing full-time postgraduate studies or research in the U.S. at an accredited institution. Master’s/first professional degree and doctoral applicants must be enrolled in a U.S. accredited institution located in the U.S. during the fellowship year. Applicants can apply for the fellowship for any year of their program but must be conducting a full year of study or research. Postdoctoral fellows are also eligible for research. Applicants must intend to return to their home country to apply their expertise, professional skills, and leadership in the context of their home countries and pursue a professional career. If applicants plan to pursue studies or research outside of the U.S. during the fellowship year, they must be members of Graduate Women International and pursue study at an international institution recognized as eligible to participate in U.S. federal student aid programs.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale for the highest degree earned.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s/first professional degree, doctoral, or postdoctoral study/research.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must be proficient in English. Institutional TOEFL scores and other English proficiency test scores (such as IELTS) will not be accepted. Accepted tests and minimum scores: TOEFL iBT (Internet-Based Test): 79; TOEFL Essentials: 8.5; Revised TOEFL Paper-Delivered Test: 60; IELTS: 6.5; Paper-based TOEFL: 550.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Intention of applying expertise, professional skills, and leadership in home country; intend to return to home country to pursue a professional career.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Women, including people who identify as women.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Master’s/first professional degree and doctoral applicants must have applied by the application deadline to an accredited institution of study for the period of the fellowship year and must indicate the institution’s name in the International Fellowships application. For International Postdoctoral Research Fellowships, applicants must begin their program on or before September 1, 2026, and complete it on or after May 30, 2027.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No application fee. Proof of Graduate Women International Membership is required if applicants plan to pursue studies or research outside of the U.S. during the fellowship year.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official institutional letter confirming CGPA and degree completion date, or a CGPA equivalent calculation using a GPA/credential conversion tool (e.g., Scholaro’s GPA Calculator), or a credential evaluation report from services like WES or ECE (General with GPA) including a detailed list of all grades.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The program aims to educate women and promote global equity for women. It invests in international applicants pursuing postgraduate studies or research in the U.S. with the intention of applying their expertise, professional skills, and leadership in their home countries. Originally designed for Latin American women, it now includes women from over 150 nations, with more than 3,600 women awarded since 1917.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The fellowship will begin in July 2026. For International Postdoctoral Research Fellowships, programs must begin on or before September 1, 2026, and complete on or after May 30, 2027.

basic_info.official_name: Justus & Louise van Effen Excellence Scholarships

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering both tuition and living costs for outstanding, motivated students.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 2 scholarships per faculty

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Excellent international applicants (conditionally) admitted to one of TU Delft's 2-year regular MSc programmes (not a Joint Education Programme). Must have outstanding academic results and be motivated. A complete MSc application must be submitted before the scholarship deadline.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All regular (non-joint) 2-year MSc programs at TU Delft
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not a Joint Education Programme

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 80 percent or higher of the scale maximum in the bachelor's degree
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree from an internationally renowned university

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship Application Form, two reference letters. All documents must be submitted together with the MSc application via the TU Delft admissions portal.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A transformative opportunity for outstanding, ambitious international students, aiming to stimulate and financially support excellent international MSc students. The scholarship is awarded for the duration of the Master's program, typically two years.

basic_info.official_name: Allan and Nesta Ferguson Charitable Trust Masters Scholarships
basic_info.provider: University of Sheffield, Allan and Nesta Ferguson Charitable Trust, and the Sheffield Institute for International Development

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering full tuition fee waiver and a maintenance stipend.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from developing countries; eligible overseas fee-paying students; must hold an offer for an eligible course at the University of Sheffield for the 2025-26 academic year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A number of courses affiliated with the Sheffield Institute for International Development; 7 postgraduate programs linked to international development.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Taught Master's degree (one-year postgraduate taught program)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience and/or extra-curricular activities (considered)

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years for Master's applicants

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship selection committee will review applications and select candidates.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Sheffield, in collaboration with the Allan and Nesta Ferguson Charitable Trust and the Sheffield Institute for International Development, offers these scholarships as part of its commitment to international development and global education. Targeted at international students from developing countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2025-26 academic year, with studies starting in September 2025. Covers the full duration of a one-year postgraduate taught program.

basic_info.official_name: Émile Boutmy Scholarship at Sciences Po

funding_info.funding_details: Up to €14,720 per year. Specifically, €13,100 per year for two years of Master’s studies.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Multiple

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to top international students from outside the European Union (non-European countries). Applicants must be first-time applicants to the scholarship and have been admitted to an eligible Undergraduate or Master’s programme at Sciences Po. Students who have previously been denied the Émile Boutmy Scholarship are not eligible to apply again. Candidates from Quebec for a bachelor's degree are eligible; Master's level dual-degree candidates are eligible, but students who enrol in a dual degree programme directly in the third year lose their Boutmy scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Policy, development, or international affairs (implied career aim)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Students who enrol in a dual degree programme directly in the third year lose their Boutmy scholarship. Only applicants for specific dual degrees are eligible (specific degrees not listed).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 2.7-3.0 GPA/CGPA
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's Degree (or Bachelor's for undergraduate program)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL, if applicable)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are required
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum 30 years old for Master's applicants
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship is merit and need-based. Students cannot apply for the scholarship after being admitted to Sciences Po or during their studies there. Applicants must indicate their application for the Émile Boutmy scholarship in the “Financial information” section of their Sciences Po application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Two recommendation letters. No separate essay is required for the scholarship; it involves a simple checkbox and a space in the application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Merit and need-based. Applicants must be admitted to a Bachelor or Master program at Sciences Po to be considered for the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious merit-based award created after the founder of Sciences Po to attract the very best international students from outside the European Union.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025/2026 academic year are open, typically from October 1, 2025, with deadlines around December 1, 2025 (Master's) or January 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded; much more than financial support for your studies.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to exceptional young African leaders from anywhere on the African continent, demonstrating outstanding academic and leadership abilities. Applicants must have already assumed leadership and made an impact on their campus or community, and possess potential for growth.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any field of your choice
field_restrictions.restrictions: MBAs are not funded.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate study (Honours and Masters degrees)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Only provides funding for a single person – the selected Scholar (does not cover dependents/family).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have already assumed leadership and made an impact on your campus or community. Must be curious about doing the (implies growth potential).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicants are advised to start gathering their documentation.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A life-changing leadership journey. Includes a compulsory leadership development programme (1-2 years depending on course duration) delivered through a series of week-long in-person workshops. The programme aims to equip scholars with competence and courage to positively impact Africa. It also includes a unique mentoring system with highly-skilled personal mentors for holistic development. The fellowship builds knowledge assets and provides experiential learning opportunities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are now open for the 2026 Mandela Rhodes Foundation (MRF) Postgraduate Scholarships, with an academic year start date of October 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: full scholarship of €25,000 (covering tuition and living expenses) for one academic year with the possibility of extension for a second year (for two-year Master’s programmes). The value of the award is 25,000 Euro per annum for a maximum of 2 years.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: no set number of scholarships to be awarded under this programme.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: outstanding students from outside Europe; Students must be in the top 10% of their class; must be eligible for a Master's course at the University of Amsterdam; Students must be based outside the EU; not have the nationality of one of the countries of the EU/EEA or Suisse; not be eligible for support under the Dutch system of study grants and; Not receive financial support from any other scholarship or loan; Not have received a full coverage scholarship for the same period of study as; Previous degrees from UvA or Dutch institutions render you ineligible; Demonstrate academic excellence, such as GPA equivalent to: First Class.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Masters level programs at University of Amsterdam; Humanities; Psychology; Law; Communication; Child Development; eligible Master’s Programmes offered at the University of Amsterdam; Science Programme.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: top 10% of their class; GPA equivalent to: First Class
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree

additional_requirements.career_plan: considered in selection process; explained in AES letter of motivation (broader context, relevance for future career)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Letter of Motivation: A personal statement outlining the applicant's reasons for choosing their specific program at the University of Amsterdam, their academic interests, and how the scholarship will help achieve their future goals; academic excellence and promise in the proposed field as evidenced by:

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Letter of Motivation
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Recipient Selection committee makes final decision considering ambition, career goals, and how well selected program serves future plans; selected on the basis of their academic excellence and promise in the proposed field.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: award available to outstanding students from outside Europe; purpose is to provide excellent students with the opportunity to complete a Master's degree at the University of Amsterdam; awards scholarships to exceptionally talented students from outside Europe to pursue eligible Master’s Programmes offered at the University of Amsterdam; College-Specific, Merit-Based.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: one academic year with the possibility of extension for a second year (for two-year Master’s programmes); maximum of 2 years.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarship, provides financial coverage for all study-related expenses for the 2026–2027 academic year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Admission offer for a Master's program must be received before 1 December (to be considered for the scholarship).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited (approximately 4-5 per year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students undertaking a Master’s Degree Program at the University of Groningen. Applicants must have received a provisional or unconditional admission offer for a Master's program before 1 December to be considered for the scholarship. Must be in good health so that health insurance in the Netherlands can be arranged. Available to citizens of eligible developing countries (partial list includes: Afghanistan, Angola, Bangladesh, Benin, Bhutan, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Chad, Comoros, Djibouti, Equatorial, Ethiopia, Ghana, India, Indonesia, Kenya, Kyrgyzstan, Mongolia, Nepal, Nigeria, Pakistan, Rwanda, Sudan).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Master’s Programs (MSc/MA/LL.M.) taught at the University of Groningen.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: University of Groningen admission typically requires a minimum GPA of 3.5 (USA applicants: 3.0/4.0 unweighted, Dutch grading scale: 7.0 out of 10).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree program (MSc/MA/LL.M.). Applicants must hold a Bachelor's degree to be eligible for Master's admission.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency test results are required.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have received a provisional or unconditional admission offer for a Master's program before 1 December (for scholarship consideration). Must be in good health for health insurance arrangements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: It is not possible to actively apply for an Eric Bleumink Fund Scholarship. Consideration is based on the Master's program application. Required documents for Master's admission typically include: CV/Resume, Certified academic transcripts and degree certificates, English proficiency test results, Admission letter (provisional or unconditional).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The University of Groningen Admission Office, in consultation with the Admission Boards of its faculties, will determine which applicants will be nominated for an Eric Bleumink Fellowship scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eric Bleumink Fund, established on 23 May 2000, provides financial support to Master’s students. The grant is awarded for 1-year or 2-year Master’s degree programmes starting in September only.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship covers the 2026–2027 academic year. Programs start in September only.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, European Union and Cooperation (MAEC) through the Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation (AECID)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Covers tuition, living costs, and health insurance. Provides a monthly stipend. Full coverage of tuition fees for the 9-month Master's program. The amount/award varies depending on the hosting institution/university.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 60 scholarships can be awarded throughout a 5-year program period, with the number varying by year. The number of awards available for a single year is not specified.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to citizens of Latin American, African, Asian, or Middle Eastern countries (non-EU). Applicants must not be Spanish citizens. Must hold a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. Must be enrolled in a Master or Doctorate programme. Must have been accepted to a Spanish university. Applicants must not have received a MAEC-AECID scholarship of 6 months or more during the previous three years.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate projects on Research and Development Cooperation, and a wide variety of academic and research fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 8.5/10 or higher (last 2 years of secondary school or equivalent)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree or equivalent (for Master's or Doctorate programs)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must not have received a MAEC-AECID scholarship of 6 months or more during the previous three years.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have been accepted to a Spanish university; demonstrated financial need.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Administered by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, European Union and Cooperation (MAEC) through the Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation (AECID). Duration of studies is 9 months. These scholarships are competitive and among Spain’s most prestigious for students from developing regions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application portal opens September 2025, with a deadline of early January 2026 for the 2025/2026 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Konrad Adenauer Stiftung / Konrad Adenauer Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Monthly scholarship of €934 for master/postgraduate students and €1,400 for PhD students. Some students may receive up to €649 per month plus €300 to cover study costs (potentially income-dependent or specific to Goethe University). Standard funding period is 2 years for Master's and 3 years for PhD, with a maximum duration of two years also mentioned in one source. Minimum 4 semesters.

timeline_info.application_deadline: July 15, 2025 (for 2025 KAS Germany Scholarship); September 26, 2025 (for 2026 KAS-SAIIA Scholarships); April 26th (for KAS Jordan Office)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Primarily aimed at international students and doctoral candidates from non-EU countries, but some sources mention EU students. Must be particularly gifted and committed young people. Applicants' status and/or country must be included in the KAS list. Guided by Christian-democratic values. Intend to complete postgraduate or master studies, doctoral studies or a research stay of at least four semesters at a university in Germany.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must have completed a first course of study (e.g., Bachelor's degree) to apply for Master's or doctoral programs. Eligible for Master's students, postgraduate students, doctoral students, and graduates with a university degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: B2 German

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants already living or studying in Germany can apply via the domestic selection program. If your status and/or country is not included in the KAS list, you cannot apply. Scholarship is informed by Christian-democratic values.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung awards scholarships to international master’s students and graduates to enable study and research at universities in Germany. It is one of the largest organizations in Germany for the promotion of talented young people, with 3,500 scholarship holders. The foundation has been awarding scholarships to international students from around the world since 1970.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Standard duration of 2 years for Master's degree programs and 3 years for PhD programs. Minimum 4 semesters. Programme Duration for KAS-SAIIA: 1 February – 30 November 2026.

basic_info.provider: Harvard University (administered by the Committee on General Scholarships)

funding_info.funding_details: Funding is guaranteed for up to two years of study at Harvard for students in degree programs requiring more than one year of study.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 27 (for the Fellowship, specific to 2025-2026); December 4 (for Harvard Kennedy School, specific to 2025-2026).
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for 2026-27 are now open for students from Canada, Australia, and the UK (as of Sep 10 for UK). Expected to open in February 2026 for 2026 applications (general).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies; typically up to 15 newly admitted students each year, though one source indicates 'Up to 5'.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to students from Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. Specific criteria vary by country: For New Zealand, applicants must be studying for a first or higher degree and graduating in the academic year 2025-26, OR have completed a first or higher degree no earlier than 2021, AND have spent at least two of the last four years at a New Zealand university. For the UK (2024-25), applicants must be British citizens normally resident in the UK, studying for a first or higher degree and graduating in 2023-2024, OR a UK-registered PhD student hoping for an additional year as a Visiting Fellow, OR have completed a first or higher degree no earlier than 2019. Students from Canada/New Zealand who are currently studying in or graduated from a university in another Knox-eligible country are also eligible. Applicants must apply for and gain admission to a full-time degree program (preference given to degree candidates) or non-degree status (Special Student/Visiting Fellow in Graduate School of Arts and Sciences only) at Harvard University. Students already studying at Harvard are not eligible. The fellowship can only be held at Harvard University. Special regard will be given to personal qualities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any field of graduate study at Harvard University, including but not limited to Natural Sciences, Engineering and Technology, Medical and Health Sciences, Agricultural Sciences, Social Sciences, and Humanities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants seeking admission to Harvard Law School should have completed their resident university education and hold a basic degree in Law before applying for an advanced degree program such as the Master of Laws (LLM). Candidates wishing to undertake the M.B.A. should normally have completed at least two years' full-time employment in industry, business, or public service.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 overall GPA
academic_requirements.required_degree: A first or higher degree. For LLM applicants, a basic degree in Law is required.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years' full-time employment (for MBA candidates)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Industry, business, or public service (for MBA candidates)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Special regard will be given to personal qualities.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: An Application for Admission directly to the Harvard graduate or professional school of choice.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: In-country competitions. Award is contingent upon gaining admission to Harvard University, with interviews typically in January.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Frank Knox Memorial Fellowship program provides funding for students from Australia, Canada, New Zealand and the United Kingdom to conduct graduate study at Harvard University.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Interviews for the award typically take place in January.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Financial coverage extends for the entire standard duration of the degree program. Provides monthly stipends, book allowances, and covers living costs. Higher allowances are provided for doctoral candidates. Tuition fees at private universities are not covered. No coverage for visa or residence permit fees, and travel costs to Germany are not included (though some sources mention travel expenses are sometimes included).
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend for Master's students: approximately €934

timeline_info.opening_date: Approximately 6 weeks before the application deadline
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 1,000-1,500 scholarships per year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are granted to graduates and doctoral students from outside Germany (international applicants). Undergraduate students are not eligible. Applicants must demonstrate very good academic records, social commitment, political interest, and provide convincing reasons for applying to the Heinrich Böll Foundation.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subjects (any field) for postgraduate and doctoral studies

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Very good school or college/university academic record
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s Degree or PhD Degree (postgraduate and doctoral studies)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of German Proficiency is required: Level B2 or DSH 2 (with certificate)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Personal reference on social commitment and an expert reference from a university lecturer (or schoolteacher for school leavers)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Social commitment and political interest; Convincing reasons for applying to the Heinrich Böll Foundation

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Transcripts, motivation letter, references, proof of German proficiency, updated resume. Specific forms (Info Sheet A1-1b, Application Form A1-2 (in German), Info Sheet A2-1b, Application Form A2-2 (in German)) are mentioned.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The selection procedure consists of three stages: 1. Submission of written application documents (assessed on academic record, political interest, social commitment, reason for applying, and quality of research project for doctoral students). 2. Interview with a liaison lecturer. (The third stage is not detailed in the provided content).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Heinrich Böll Foundation grants scholarships for postgraduate and doctoral studies in Germany for the 2026-27 academic year. It supports international students from outside Germany.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application portal opens approximately 6 weeks before the application deadline of March 1, 2026.

basic_info.study_country: Anywhere in the world (for taught Master's course), Low- or middle-income countries (for research project)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Nationals of low- and middle-income countries (excluding India and mainland China). Applicants must have an undergraduate degree in a health-relevant subject. The proposed research must focus on a health priority in a low- or middle-income country and be within Wellcome's science remit. The host organization for the research project must be based in a low- or middle-income country. The taught Master's course selected should be at a recognized centre of excellence and provide training that complements the research project.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Public Health, Tropical Medicine, health-related fields within Wellcome science remit
field_restrictions.restrictions: Research proposal must be within Wellcome science remit and focus on a health priority in a low- or middle-income country.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree in a health-relevant subject (to apply for the Master's degree).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: The fellowship duration is 30 months, comprising 12 months for a taught Master of Science (MSc) course (which can be undertaken anywhere in the world) and 18 months for a research project (to be undertaken at an eligible organization in a low- or middle-income country).

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This scheme offers nationals of low- and middle-income countries the opportunity to receive training at Master’s degree level. The duration of this scholarship program is for 30 months.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 30 months (12 months taught Master’s course and 18 months research project)

basic_info.provider: King Fahd University of Petroleum and Minerals (KFUPM) Deanship of Graduate Studies

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship

timeline_info.application_deadline: Thesis-Based MS & PhD: July 31, 2025; Project-Based MS: July 15, 2025
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified, but KFUPM admits hundreds of international students annually across graduate programs.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to both international and domestic students (including Saudi Arabian students). Applicants must be distinguished graduate applicants who demonstrate high potential for conducting original research. An undergraduate degree or 16 years of education is required. Strong academic performance and research potential are important selection factors.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering, Sciences, Business, and emerging fields like Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity, Robotics, and Business Analytics.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: A minimum GPA of 3.00 on a scale of 4.00 or equivalent in both B.S. and in the subject of the major field.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s (MS/Project-based) and PhD (Thesis-based) degrees

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Applicants should demonstrate interest or experience in their chosen field of study, including research or work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency certificate (TOEFL or IELTS). TOEFL scores must be sent directly to the Deanship of Graduate Studies (KFUPM code is 0868). Minimum TOEFL: Master's: 520 (PBT), 190 (CBT), 70 (IBT); PhD: 550 (PBT), 213 (CBT), 80 (IBT). Minimum IELTS: 6.0.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letters of Recommendation from professors or supervisors who can attest to academic and research abilities. More than one letter may be required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official transcripts, English language proficiency certificate (TOEFL or IELTS), Letters of Recommendation, Passport Copy.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on strong academic performance, research potential, and English language proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL). Academic performance and Arabic language skills may also be considered.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The King Fahd University Scholarship 2026-2027 is a fully funded scholarship for international and domestic students pursuing Master's and PhD studies at King Fahd University of Petroleum and Minerals (KFUPM). It provides comprehensive financial support.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open in March 2025 for the Fall 2026 intake. Deadlines are July 31, 2025 for Thesis-Based MS & PhD, and July 15, 2025 for Project-Based MS.

basic_info.provider: Association of Global Universities, Russian Government, Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation, Rossotrudnichestvo

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Over $52 million awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students. Winners of the intellectual competition have the opportunity to enter a program at leading Russian universities without entrance examinations. Participants of the undergraduate track must have documents confirming completion of secondary education. Participants in the graduate track must have a bachelor’s or specialist’s degree. Participants in the postdoc track must have a PhD or DSc degree as of the registration start date (September 16). Students usually need to pass an online exam or assessment in their field of study. If chosen as a winner by both Rossotrudnichestvo and Open Doors, applicants must choose between the two scholarships.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of subjects and degree levels, including Artificial Intelligence, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Political Science, Russian Language and Culture, Psychology, Economics, Neuroscience & Psychology, Economics & Econometrics. Comprehensive coverage across 14 subject areas.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Secondary education completion (for undergraduate), Bachelor’s or Specialist’s degree (for graduate), PhD or DSc degree (for postdoc)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation
additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor's Degree: 16-23 years old; Master's Degree: 20-33 years old

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Statement of purpose or motivational letter, Two letters of recommendation, Documents confirming completion of secondary education (for undergraduate track), Bachelor’s or specialist’s degree (for graduate track), PhD or DSc degree (for postdoc track)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process is fully online and takes place in several stages. Students usually need to pass an online exam or assessment in their field of study. Winners of the intellectual competition gain admission without university entrance examinations.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Organized by the Association of Global Universities with the support of the Russian Government. Allows students to study tuition-free at some of the best universities in Russia. More than 24 leading Russian universities are part of the project. The competition has been held annually since 2017.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline: 16th November 2025. Announcement of winners and runners-up for bachelor's and master's tracks: 30 December 2025. Announcement of winners for doctoral and post-doctoral tracks: 27 February 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded program. Recipients receive financial support to cover living expenses and study costs, a monthly living stipend, health insurance support, and access to a comprehensive seminar program. Universities in Germany usually have no tuition fees. Provides a monthly allowance of up to EUR 850 (Master's) or EUR 750 (Bachelor's, Diplom, Magister), health insurance coverage, and, if applicable, family and childcare allowances. Worry-free academic journey: stipend, insurance, and living expenses covered.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 30 November (for Winter semester, specifically 30 November 2025 for 2026 intake); 31 May (for Summer semester for Masters international students); October 31 (mentioned once without year).
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are currently open for the 2025/2026 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 40 students are awarded FES sponsorships each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants' academic achievement, social and political involvement, and personal attitudes play an important part in the selection process. Supports students from public or state-approved universities and from polytechnical colleges. Open to Germans, foreign students, and refugees. Applicants come from countries in the Global South (Asia, Africa, Latin America), post-Soviet states as well as eastern and south-eastern European (EU) countries. Foreign applicants who are already studying, or doing their postgraduate studies, in Germany at the time of application. Must have already enrolled in a German university or have a supervisor for their doctoral studies. Foreign students should be able to submit proof of their initial academic achievements/marks with the exception of those enrolled in Master or other postgraduate programmes. Essential to live in Germany and study at a German university. Must be admitted to or enrolled at a recognized higher education institution in Germany.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Disciplines Eligible

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No universal GPA requirement for the scholarship, but applicants must have above-average academic performance and strong potential for academic or professional success. A general minimum CGPA of 7 or 70% is mentioned for studying in Germany.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD, Diplom, Magister

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Test of German as a Foreign Language (TestDAF). German language proficiency is crucial even when the study programme itself (M/B) is carried out in English. Very good command of German.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reports from high school teachers or vocational school teachers; Reports from university professors.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 32 years for Master's students; Under 38 years (mentioned in one source, possibly for specific groups like Commonwealth nationals); No strict age limit, but applicants are expected to be in the early stages of their academic career.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Foreign applicants who are already studying, or doing their postgraduate studies, in Germany at the time of application. Must live in Germany and study at a German university.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Social and political involvement and personal attitudes; Applicants must be admitted to or enrolled at a recognized higher education institution in Germany.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Sample application form for basic funding for Germans, foreign students, and refugees; Sample application form for doctoral funding for Germans, foreign students, and refugees; Information sheet for applications Basic funding for first-year students; Reports from high school teachers or vocational school teachers; Information sheet for applications for basic funding; Reports from university professors; Proof of their initial academic achievements/marks (for foreign students, except Master/postgraduate).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on applicants' academic achievement, social and political involvement, and personal attitudes.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The promotion of young talent has been one of the founding principles of the FES. Recipients gain access to a comprehensive seminar program that develops leadership skills, social engagement, and academic competence.

basic_info.provider: Scottish Government, in collaboration with Scotland's higher education institutions

funding_info.funding_details: Up to 100 awards, each worth £4,000, towards the cost of tuition fees, awarded as a tuition fee reduction.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from around the world, specifically mentioned: Canada, China, India.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: science, technology, creative industries, healthcare and medical sciences, life sciences, financial services, renewable and clean energy

academic_requirements.required_degree: One-year full-time Undergraduate, Masters or PhD course at any of Scotland’s higher education institutions.

additional_requirements.age_limits: International students can apply irrespective of their age if they are eligible.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scottish Government may remove Saltire Scholars from the programme if they do not adhere to principles or cause embarrassment/damage to Scotland’s reputation.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious scholarship backed by the Scottish Government, designed to attract the brightest minds from around the world to study in Scotland’s world-class universities, promoting Scotland as a premier education destination.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Planning for the 2026-2027 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Scholarships for undergraduate and doctoral programs cover 60% of academic costs, while Master's scholarships cover 75%. Specific programs, such as the ESADE MBA, cover up to 30% of the program cost. The Iberdrola collaboration grants ten scholarships for Master’s in energy and environmental courses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: March 12, 2025 (for postgraduate and institutional studies for 2025-2026 academic year); February 20, 2025 (for ECV program for 2025-2026 academic year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 735 (for 2025-2026 academic year, covering postgraduate, doctorate, faculty and institutional studies); 10 (for Iberdrola collaboration for energy and environmental Master's courses)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Primarily aimed at students from Latin America and Ibero-American researchers/graduates. International students residing in Spain can also apply for some programs. Non-Spanish resident graduates from any member state of the Iberoamerican Community of Nations are eligible for specific collaborations. Some programs for Ibero-American applicants specifically exclude Spain.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate, doctorate, faculty, and institutional studies. All research fields related to the 2030 Agenda. Fields related to the 'triple transition' (digital, environmental, and social). Human rights. Energy and environmental courses. Music specialties.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some programs for Ibero-American applicants exclude Spain (e.g., Conservatori Liceu).

academic_requirements.required_degree: A Master's degree is required for doctoral fellowships. Scholarships are available for Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral programs, implying varying prior degree requirements based on the program level.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Specific requirements depend on the program of study and university.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Fundación Carolina is a leading institution for academic mobility and international scholarships in Spain, primarily for Ibero-American countries. Its purpose is to generate impact and social value, respond to challenges of the 'triple transition' (digital, environmental, social), reinforce Spanish cooperation, and promote gender equality and social equality. It supports higher education in Ibero-American countries and encourages internationalization in Spanish universities, with a focus on the 2030 Agenda and human rights.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application period for the 2025-2026 academic year generally runs from January to March. For postgraduate and institutional studies, it's January 14 to March 12, 2025. For the ECV program, it closes on February 20, 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers tuition and expenses and provides a monthly living stipend, funding for books and course materials. The 2025 Obama Foundation Scholarship will cover monthly stipends, furnished housing, tuition, travel expenses, and medical fees for selected candidates. Note: One source indicates the scholarship covers direct costs minus student aid index, but not enrollment deposit, books, health insurance, and exceeding standard housing/meal.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 12 Scholars at Columbia University and 18 Scholars at the University of Chicago are selected annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The program seeks emerging leaders from the United States and around the world who are focused on an issue of global importance, have a track record and commitment to advancing the public good, and want to accelerate their impact through an intensive program. Rising leaders who are already making a difference in their communities are encouraged to apply. Applicants must be available to participate in all Obama Scholars programming, including an on-campus summer program, the Obama Scholars Seminar, the Obama Scholars Speakers Series, and a spring reception. Scholars should be eager to develop their leadership skills, interested in refining their conception of the public good, excited to contribute to and participate in the Obama Scholars community, and passionate about making changes that will improve others’ lives. For the University of Chicago program, students must be in their final year of study in a Master’s program at one of three specific schools.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: For the University of Chicago program: Master’s programs at the Harris School of Public Policy; Crown Family School of Social Work, Policy, and Practice; and Booth School of Business. An older post also mentioned graduates in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Application is restricted to full-time programs only (from an older post).

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Columbia University: Bachelor's Degree with a minimum of Second-Class Honors (Upper). For the University of Chicago program: Students in their final year of study in a Master’s program.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Applicants should have a track record and commitment to advancing the public good and be already making a difference in their communities.
