test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate proficiency in the English language by submitting scores from one of four exams: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) (internet-based or paper-based); International English Language Testing System (IELTS); Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE Academic); or Duolingo English Test (DET).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendations should directly address the applicant's suitability for admission to the Obama Foundation Scholars program.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A one-page personal statement explaining your motivation for entering the public good, your future goals, and why you want to be part of the Obama Scholars Program is required.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A resume/curriculum vitae is required, which should be a chronological listing of employment and academic history, and other significant activities, including any awards, publications, or other achievements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: One-page personal statement, resume/curriculum vitae, English language proficiency scores (TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or DET), and recommendations.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Obama Foundation Scholars program is an intensive, year-long, rigorous, immersive program for emerging leaders from around the world. It offers a robust curriculum of leadership development, training, networking activities, and customized support, bringing together academic, skills-based, and experiential learning. The program aims to help Scholars gain real-world skills, tools, and experiences to expand the impact of their work. It is not a degree-granting program, but scholars receive a certificate of completion.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The program is a year-long, rigorous, immersive experience, including an on-campus summer program for some instances. Scholars engage in academic, skills-based, and experiential learning opportunities on their campuses. Applications for the 2025-2026 cohort at Columbia University and University of Chicago are closed. The application deadline for the 2026-2027 cohort at Columbia University is February 05, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Comprehensive funding, often described as fully funded, covering major expenses. No further payments will be made beyond the covered expenses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Resident citizens of member states of the African Union or African Commonwealth countries. Specific mentions for South African and Tanzanian citizens.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering, Actuarial Sciences, Finance, Accounting, Psychology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, HR, Cybersecurity, Biological Sciences, Geography, Civil & Environmental Engineering, Applied Chemistry, Tourism Science, and more. Available for Diploma, Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD programmes.

academic_requirements.required_degree: PhD: A first-class undergraduate degree or MPhil, meeting awarding body criteria. MPhil/PhD: An upper second-class.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience is favored where there is a demonstrable continuity between applicant's past study and career.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Most Mauritian universities do not require IELTS if educated in English. If the language of instruction in the qualifying examination was not English, a valid TOEFL or IELTS test is required.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Diploma applicants must be between 18 and 26 years old by January 1, 2026.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Application must be made solely through the nominating agency in the applicant’s country of citizenship. Applicants must have already applied for full-time on-campus studies at any public Higher Education Institution in Mauritius for the academic year starting in 2025/2026.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Mauritius-Africa Scholarship Application Form for Undergraduate Programmes, Mauritius-Africa Scholarship Application Form for Postgraduate Programmes, Certified copy of birth certificate, Certified copy of biodata page of passport (if available), Certified copies of relevant educational certificates and transcripts (with certified translation if not in English), Copy of letter of conditional offer or acknowledgement notice from a Mauritius public Higher Education Institution, Medical certificate (Section 6 of application form).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scheme for deserving students from African Union/Commonwealth countries to pursue diploma, bachelor’s, master's, and PhD programmes in public Higher Education Institutions in Mauritius.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic year starting between July and September 2025/2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering tuition fees, accommodation, monthly stipend, food, living expenses, books, medical allowance, and airfare. Includes Graduate Assistantship (GA) and GSRA awards.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For newly admitted graduate students applying from inside Qatar as well as from other countries (international students, potentially from developing countries). Applicants can apply as a personal applicant or be nominated by partner organizations.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's Degree or its equivalent

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Standardized test scores (e.g. GRE, GMAT) are necessary

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive basis; admitted by the President of Qatar University.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Qatar University offers Graduate Assistanship (GA) awards on a competitive basis to select newly admitted graduate students applying from inside Qatar as well as from other countries. GSRA supports outstanding graduate candidates by offering them competitive scholarships to undertake research-based studies.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for Fall 2025 intake. The application deadline is March 15, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Shanghai Municipal Government, Shanghai Municipal Education Commission

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is divided into two categories: Category A (Full Scholarship) and Category B (Partial Scholarship). Category A covers tuition fees, accommodation fees, living expenses, and comprehensive medical insurance fees. Category B covers tuition fees and comprehensive medical insurance fees. Monthly living expenses for Category A are up to CNY3500.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Generally from February to April every year. For Bachelor programs in Shanghai, application time is until August 15. Individual universities may have specific deadlines.
timeline_info.opening_date: Generally from February to April every year. For Bachelor programs in Shanghai, application time starts March 1.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified.
timeline_info.duration: Undergraduate study duration is 4 years (implies scholarship duration).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens and in good health. Good health and no criminal record. No country restrictions. Must have a certain academic level.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Philosophy, economics, law, engineering, business, medicine, language courses. All degree programs offered in Shanghai Normal University (SHNU). Science or Engineering programs (at Shanghai University).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0/4.0 or 80/100 (for high school diploma/undergraduate). For Master's: Bachelor's degree with a GPA of 2.5 or above.
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma (for Bachelor's), Bachelor's degree (for Master's), Master's degree (for Doctoral). Applicable to undergraduate, master's, doctoral, and undergraduate preparatory studies, as well as non-degree Chinese language studies.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK 4+ or IELTS 6.0 / TOEFL 80 or Attestation letter. Undergraduate applicants whose Chinese proficiency reaches HSK Level 3 but does not meet the requirements for major study can take 1 year pre-college program. Note: Some sources indicate 'NO IELTS REQUIRED'.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (for Master or Doctor degree program applicants only). Letters must include Signature, Email address, landline or mobile phone number, date.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for bachelor programs should be under 25. Applicants for master programs should be under 35. Applicants for Master's degree or above should not be older than 40 years of age.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form. Highest Degree certificate. Full transcript in bachelor period (for Master's applicants). Full transcript in bachelor and master periods (for PhD applicants). Abstract and content of master degree thesis (for PhD applicants). Valid HSK score report (if applicable). Admission Notice, Visa Application for Study in China (JW201/JW202), Foreigner Physical Examination Form, Scholarship Award Notice and valid passport (for visa application).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Apply online through the Shanghai Government Scholarship application system and the university's admission system. Universities may nominate outstanding students for the scholarship (e.g., East China Normal University). Some universities require an online application and application fee.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: 31 universities in Shanghai participate in the SGS scholarship program. The Shanghai Municipal Education Commission and universities organize various educational activities, such as 'Experience China' and 'Studying in Shanghai', for international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship application period is generally from February to April every year.

funding_info.funding_details: CHF 1,600 (around 1700 EUR) per month, up to 19,200 CHF annually. Described as a fully funded award.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around ten

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Competitive Master's grants for outstanding international students. Applicants must be foreign (non-Swiss) university graduates with outstanding academic results. They must not already be enrolled in a Master’s programme at UNIL or in a preparatory year there. Candidates must hold a foreign university degree and demonstrate academic results of a very high level.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s programs
field_restrictions.restrictions: Programmes excluded from the Master’s Grant include Medicine, Education, most Law specialisms, Sports Didactics, Health Sciences, and all MAS or PhD courses.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Foreign university bachelor's degree (non-Swiss)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency of at least C1 in either French or English is required based on the chosen master's.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: The application for the Master's scholarship also serves as an application for admission to the chosen Master's program at UNIL. Applicants must not already be enrolled in a Master’s programme at UNIL or in a preparatory year there. For applicants whose bachelor’s university is in a country that did not ratify the Lisbon Recognition Convention, certified (sealed) copies of diploma and transcripts must be sent by post in addition to PDF uploads.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicants must complete the “UNIL Master's Grant” form and submit their application by email to the Office for (incomplete). Applicants must apply online and upload their complete application file in PDF during the online application, referring to a "list of documents for an application". Certified (sealed) copies of diploma and transcripts are required, especially for applicants from countries not ratifying the Lisbon Recognition Convention.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive basis
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scholarships for excellence, designed to support global talent.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the academic year 2026/2027.

basic_info.official_name: University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded masters scholarship. Grant amounting to CHF 10,000 to CHF 15,000/year (no teaching duties). Annual stipend: up to CHF 15,000/year.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several Excellence Fellowships are awarded annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For outstanding and highly motivated international students. Open to both Swiss and international students, with no specific nationality restrictions. Candidates must meet the admission criteria and fulfill the standard Master’s admission requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master of Science degree in any of the disciplines covered by the Faculty of Science.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Courses may be chosen from a maximum of two different Faculties. Master's-level courses are restricted to postgraduate students and subject availability.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 (out of 4.0) grade point average (GPA)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master of Science degree (implies a bachelor's degree for postgraduate study)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Good command of French, which is the relevant language at the University of Geneva, even though English can be useful too.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Fellowship is awarded for one year and extended for the regular duration of the chosen Master's program (three or four semesters) provided the applicant is academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Motivation letter/two-page essay describing specific scientific interests, specifying the Master's program at the Faculty of Science, and motivating the intention to pursue a Master of Science programme at the University of Geneva. All required documents should be prepared and sent as a unique PDF file by e-mail to the Dean of the Faculty of Science: Excellence-Master-Sciences@unige.ch.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Program created by the Faculty of Science of the University of Geneva, in collaboration with several sponsors, to support outstanding and highly motivated candidates who wish to pursue a Master of Science degree in a discipline covered by the Faculty.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Awarded for one year and extended for the regular duration of the chosen Master's program (three or four semesters) provided the applicant is academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies.

funding_info.funding_details: Covers full tuition fees or offers tuition fee reduction. Provides living expenses, including a monthly allowance of 120,000 JPY.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 12 February 2025 (for MSc program); annual deadlines typically in late February for other programs.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: One (for PhD program); very small number available.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding applicants from developing countries who can demonstrate financial need. Must be accepted into the UNU-IAS PhD Program in Sustainability Science or MSc in Sustainability program (including MSc in Urban and Environmental Studies at Waseda/UTokyo). Applicants currently living in Japan under a working visa are NOT eligible. Applicants pursuing a second PhD at UNU-IAS are not eligible. Applicants already enrolled in other postgraduate degree programs are not eligible. Applicants must not be recipients of other scholarships concurrently. Age limit: Under 35 years old at the time of application (for PhD). Strong interest in sustainability studies and demonstrated commitment to global issues. Demonstrated ability to link coursework and activities to principles of sustainability. English language proficiency is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: PhD Program in Sustainability Science; MSc in Sustainability; MSc in Urban and Environmental Studies (at Waseda University/The University of Tokyo)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: A GPA of 2.8 or above on a 4.0 scale (equivalent to 70% on a 100% scale) for at least one of the Master’s degrees earned (for PhD applicants).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Completed Master’s degree (or equivalent) from a recognized university/institution. For PhD applicants, two Master’s degrees (at least one in sustainability-related disciplines) can substitute for work experience.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 2 years (full-time equivalent) of practical field experience acquired after obtaining a university degree (for PhD applicants).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Practical field experience related to UNU-IAS research themes (for PhD applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency required. Minimum TOEFL Paper-based score of 600. Original TOEFL or IELTS score reports (taken within the last two years) must be submitted.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three Letters of Reference (for PhD applicants).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years old at the time of application (for PhD applicants).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants currently living in Japan under a working visa are NOT eligible. Applicants pursuing a second PhD degree at UNU-IAS are not eligible. Applicants already enrolled in other postgraduate degree programs are not eligible. Applicants must not be recipients of other scholarships concurrently.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Recipients are required to write a short essay. Strong interest in sustainability studies; Demonstrated commitment to study and understand global issues; Demonstrated ability to link course work and activities to principles of sustainability.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Necessary information and documents for the scholarships when applying to the master’s/PhD degree program. For PhD applicants: Three Letters of Reference, Copy of Official Transcripts, Proof of English Language Proficiency, Proof of Awarded Degree with Date Received.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive and merit-based.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Japan Foundation for UNU (JFUNU) Scholarship is available for outstanding applicants from developing countries who can demonstrate financial need and are accepted into specific programs at the United Nations University Institute for the Advanced Study of Sustainability (UNU-IAS).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline: 12th February 2025 (for MSc program). Annual deadlines around late February. There is no separate application form for the scholarships; applicants must provide necessary information and documents when applying to the degree program.

basic_info.provider: African Development Bank (AfDB) and Government of Japan

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded master's scholarships
covered_expenses: Economy class air travel between home country and host university

timeline_info.application_deadline: For April 2026 enrollment: September 16, 2025. For September 2026 enrollment: November 12, 2025, and January 9, 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 300 scholarships are awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be from African Development Bank member countries (regional member countries of the African Development Bank / citizens of ADB's borrowing countries / citizen of an African country). Must have relevant professional experience and a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts. Must have at least 1 year of paid employment in their home country or in other African countries after receiving their Bachelor's (or equivalent university) degree within the past 3 years. Must not be an Executive Director, his/her alternate, and/or staff of all types of appointments of the African Development Bank Group or a close relative. JADS does not support applicants who are already enrolled in graduate degree programs. Must be 35 years old or less. Must demonstrate outstanding academic achievement and potential. Must be a healthy citizen of the AfDB member country.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Energy development and related disciplines, energy, agriculture, health, environmental sustainability, engineering, and areas central to Africa’s sustainable development.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent degree) for master's level studies.

experience_requirements.min_years: 1 year
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Paid employment in home country or other African countries; relevant professional experience and a history of supporting countries’ development efforts.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must demonstrate proficiency in English or the language of instruction at the host institution. Some institutions may require official tests like TOEFL iBT, TOEC.

additional_requirements.age_limits: 35 years old or less
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: JADS does not support applicants who are already enrolled in graduate degree programs.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must first apply to the host university (e.g., APU). Must have a track record of supporting their countries’ development efforts. Must be a healthy citizen.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must first apply to the host university (e.g., APU). The university reviews application documents and selects suitable candidates to recommend to the AfDB-JADS. The university sends a list of selected candidates to the African Development Bank, which then shares the list with the JADS Program Implementation Unit (PIU) to evaluate applications based on a set criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Japan Africa Dream Scholarship (JADS) is a prestigious capacity-building initiative jointly launched by the African Development Bank (AfDB) and the Government of Japan, initiated in 2017. It aspires to provide academic financial support to highly talented African students to undergo training in Japanese universities to contribute to sustainable development in Africa.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for both April and September 2026 enrollment. There are different deadlines for the JADS Program 2025-26, depending on the admission deadline of each university.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship offering comprehensive support and full financial support.
covered_expenses: Travel Allowance: One-way ticket at the start and a return ticket at the end

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to International Students, specifically citizens of Pakistan, Zambia, Liberia, Grenada, and St. Kitts & Nevis. Must be a citizen of the nominating country. Most scholarships require proficiency in Arabic or French. Many are specifically targeted toward students from African and Arab countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, graduate, vocational studies, Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD programs across all higher education fields. Specific fields mentioned for Zambian nationals include: Agronomy, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Economics, Chemical Engineering and Biomedical Sciences, Computer Science and Software Engineering, Commerce and Business Management, Life and Earth Sciences.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Hold at least second-class honours (for Master's degree applicants)
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master's degree applicants: hold at least second-class honours (implies Bachelor's degree). For Doctorate level: master's degree or equivalent in a related field. Must meet university admission criteria.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in Arabic or French

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter
additional_requirements.age_limits: Not more than 35 years old when applying for a master's degree. Not more than 45 years old (implied for PhD).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Strong research proposal (for PhD applicants).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Signed application, attested educational documents, CNIC (for Pakistani applicants), motivation letter, performance documents, recommendation letter, Passport bio-data page, copy of master's degree dissertation/thesis (for Doctorate level), strong research proposal (for PhD).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A fully funded study abroad scholarship in Morocco designed to attract the world’s top talent, valuing international cooperation and academic excellence, offering high-quality French- and Arabic-medium education.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year 2025-26 / 2025/2026

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded program, comprehensive, offering full or partial scholarships.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies significantly by program/field of study. Reported deadlines include: November 30, 2025; June 30, 2025; December 31, 2025; November 2, 2025; March 31, 2026 (MScIH general). Also, 15 January and 30 June of each year for second stage applications.
timeline_info.opening_date: Open for Spring 2026 intake (no specific date mentioned)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding students and researchers from developing, emerging, or transition countries in Africa, Asia, the Middle East, Latin America, and Eastern Europe (Global South). Applicants must be of Catholic denomination (Catholic Christians). Required to have above-average academic performance, social commitment, and leadership potential. A concrete study program at a German university must be identified, and for Master's, a confirmation letter of acceptance is needed. Applicants must plan to return permanently to their home country after studies, otherwise funding becomes a loan. Must have a first degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, PhD, post-doctoral studies, or research periods (2 to 6 months for researchers). No specific subject preference, but selection board often prefers certain courses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Studies that have already begun cannot be funded.

academic_requirements.required_degree: First degree (for postgraduate studies), Master's or PhD (for post-doctoral/research)

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years of work or professional experience (for general program); at least three years of work experience (for Adveniat-KAAD Programme).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work or professional experience

additional_requirements.career_plan: Plan to return permanently to home country after completion of scholarship.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must be Catholic Christians with a religious and social commitment, demonstrating social responsibility and leadership.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Identification of a concrete study program at a German university; confirmation letter of acceptance from a German university for the intended Master's program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Confirmation letter from a German university for the intended program (especially for Master's). Other required documents are mentioned but not listed.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic excellence, professional experience, motivation, and potential to contribute to home country's development.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The KAAD Scholarship (Catholic Academic Exchange Service) is a fully funded program for outstanding students from developing/emerging countries to pursue Master’s, PhD, or post-doctoral studies/research in Germany. It aims to build an international academic and intercultural community and assist home countries in improving education and quality of life. KAAD offers several programs: Scholarship Programme 1 (for applicants from home countries, including regional hubs), Scholarship Programme 2 (for those already in Germany, via Catholic university chaplaincies), and the Eastern European Program. There is also an Adveniat-KAAD Programme for Latin American and Caribbean applicants, especially Catholic social leaders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are awarded for the duration of the Master's or Doctorate program, up to three years.

funding_info.funding_details: The Pan African University (PAU) offers fully funded scholarships covering tuition, accommodation, living stipends, travel, research costs, and books. Medical insurance is also covered from disbursed stipends. Students are required not to engage in income-generating activities that interfere with their academic programs, unless approved by the PAU Rectorate.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 3,474 scholarships awarded historically (including over 1,000 women) from 51 AU member states.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to young, qualified, talented, and enterprising applicants from African countries and the African Diaspora. Applicants must be outstanding African students pursuing master's and doctoral degrees. Successful applicants are required to undertake to serve any African Union Member State for a period equal to at least the duration of the scholarship after successful completion of their studies.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Insurance, Actuarial Science, Engineering, Accounting, IT (AI), ESG, Medicinal Plant Research and Drug Development, Sports Management and Policy Development, Avian Medicine, Veterinary Vaccine Production & Quality Control.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's and Doctoral degrees

additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Enrolment of women is particularly encouraged.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must undertake to serve any African Union Member State for a period equal to at least the duration of the scholarship after the successful completion of their studies. Students are not to engage in any income-generating activities that will interfere with their academic programmes, unless approved by the PAU Rectorate.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, 1st degree certificate.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The PAU scholarship is highly competitive, offers world-class education in a multicultural academic environment with strong research focus, and leads to a joint degree award from the Pan African University.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the academic year 2026-2027 are accepted, with a call launch on 15 November and a deadline of 15 December 2025.

basic_info.provider: Government of Malaysia, Ministry of Higher Education (MOHE) Malaysia

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded program covering tuition fees, monthly living allowance, and other expenses.
covered_expenses: Air tickets from recipient’s capital city to Malaysia
Annual grant for books and internal travel
Thesis allowance (for PhD and Post-Doctoral only, paid at beginning of research after proposal defense and balance upon thesis submission)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding international students from selected developing countries, possessing excellent academic achievements, leadership qualities, and a strong commitment to contribute to their home country. Must have professional work experience. Scholars must fulfill study program requirements and abide by Malaysian laws and university rules, regulations, and codes of conduct.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields are open, with priority for areas such as Science and Engineering, Agriculture and Fisheries, Economics and Islamic Finance, Social Sciences, Journalism, and Information. STEM, business, or strategic fields are also prioritized.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some awards prioritize specific fields (STEM, business, strategic fields), implying potential restrictions or lower priority for other fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Master’s applicants: Bachelor’s CGPA ≥ 3.0 or 2nd Class Upper. PhD applicants: Master’s CGPA ≥ 3.5 or very good result in a similar field of intended PhD study.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Full-time postgraduate studies (Master’s, PhD, or Post-doctoral levels).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language proficiency certificate (TOEFL or IELTS) is required. Official translation in English is required if academic transcripts are in another language.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two (2) compulsory letters of recommendation from referees, to be uploaded via the MIS online application system (scanned PDF format).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Master’s applicants: Under 40 years old. PhD applicants: Under 45 years old.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Research and study must be carried out in Malaysia. Scholars are not allowed to take any paid employment in Malaysia during their tenure unless with written approval from the host university. Evidence of leadership and community impact may be expected.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Contact Information: SCHOLARSHIP DIVISION, Ministry of Higher Education, Level 2, No 2, Tower 2, Jalan P5/6, Precinct 5, 62200 Putrajaya. Phone: +603-8888 1616 (Hotline) / +603-8870 6368 (8.30 am – 4.30 pm Malaysia time / Monday - Friday). E-mail: international@mohe.gov.my (for enquiries and technical assistance).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Printed application form, applicant’s academic transcript (official English translation required if in other language), Curriculum Vitae, Medical Report Form, Admission Letter from a Malaysian university (if applicable), Research Plan (required for Master’s by Research and PhD applicants), English Language proficiency certificate (TOEFL or IELTS), Two Letters of Recommendation, Endorsement Form. All documents must be in English or officially translated.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This prestigious scholarship, funded by the Ministry of Higher Education (MOHE) Malaysia, is designed to attract top talents from around the world to study at leading Malaysian universities. It is offered by the Government of Malaysia to outstanding international students to pursue full-time postgraduate studies (Master’s, PhD, or Post-doctoral) at selected public and private universities in Malaysia. The program supports studies at any of the 20 public and 4 selected private universities across Malaysia. Students can apply directly to the scholarship before securing university admission, making it more accessible. It aims to foster international relations and cultural exchange.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the academic session 2025/2026.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International Students, including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Applicants must be pursuing each education level (Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD) for the first time. No strict age limit, but applicants must meet academic eligibility.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Broad range of academic disciplines / various areas of professional activity
field_restrictions.restrictions: No

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 out of 4.0 or equivalent (for Bachelor's and Master's degree applicants)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree for Master's applicants; Master's degree for PhD applicants

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: International certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.) required for Master and Doctoral applicants. Minimum scores are specified but not provided in the content.

additional_requirements.age_limits: No strict age limit
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) for Bachelor's Degree Applicants; PhD applicants must provide a research proposal in the language of instruction.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Copy of passport/identity document; Bachelor's degree diploma and transcript with notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English; Master's degree diploma and transcript with notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English; International certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.); Research proposal (for PhD applicants); Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) for Bachelor's Degree Applicants; Previous Educational Certificates.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Initial review by selection committee to ensure eligibility; Shortlisted applicants will be interviewed online by representatives of Kazakhstan’s Ministry of Science and Higher Education, the Operator, and universities.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A fully funded opportunity for international students to pursue higher education (Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD degrees) in top Kazakhstani universities across various fields, offered by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open from 30 March to 31 May 2025. Announcement of Results: July 31, 2025.

basic_info.provider: Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology (Skoltech)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. No application fee.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to local and international students. Applicants must have a Bachelor's, Specialist, or equivalent degree in a relevant STEM field for MSc programs. English proficiency is required. Candidates must successfully pass the admission process and be enrolled at Skoltech.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: STEM fields, including Data Science, Advanced Computational Science, Applied Computational Mechanics, Materials Science, Advanced Manufacturing Technologies (Simulation based Engineering Sciences track), Internet of Things and Wireless Technologies, Engineering Systems, Photonics and Quantum Materials, Mathematical and Theoretical Physics.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA required.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Specialist, or equivalent degree in a relevant STEM field for MSc programs.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Internships, volunteering, or official work experience are accepted, but not strictly required.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency required. Accepted tests and minimum scores: TOEFL iBT: 80, TOEFL ITP: 450, IELTS: 6.0. Scores must be valid for two years. General GRE score is not a requirement.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology (Skoltech) offers fully funded Master’s and PhD scholarships for local and international students in Russia, emphasizing innovation and research excellence in STEM fields.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application deadline for the 2025-26 academic year is July 7, 2025. Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are expected to open in December 2025. The application period for current MSc programs is closed.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. The monthly basic scholarship consists of 850€, along with a lump sum of 20€ for Master's. For international PhD students, a grant of 1400 EUR each month.

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 1, 2025 (for grants beginning in the summer semester of the following year, starting April 1)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 60 scholarships for the 2025/26 academic year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Highly-qualified undergraduate and doctoral students from Germany and abroad who evidence high levels of social and political engagement. Foreign students (Master only) and PhD students must be temporarily residing in Germany for study or research purposes. Applicants must meet §8 BAföG regulations (e.g., German passport, immigrants with long-term residence prospects). Women, those in social need, people with disabilities, students of non-academic and migrant backgrounds are given preference in cases of comparable achievements and commitment. For Bachelor's degree programs, applicants must have half the standard period of study left before the start of funding. Eligibility is also dependent on the applicant's status and country, as not all are included.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, Diplom, Magister, or Staatsexamen programs. Proof of a completed bachelor's degree or completed undergraduate studies is required for some programs.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: High levels of social and political engagement. Work experience or voluntary experience related to their field of study.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Preference given to students of non-academic and migrant backgrounds, the socially needy, and people with disabilities to counteract social, political, and gender discrimination.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Proof of acceptance at a German university required for dissertation/research stay. For Bachelor's degree, half the standard period of study must be left. Must be temporarily resident in Germany for study/research (for foreign Master's/PhD).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application forms. Proof of acceptance at a German university (for dissertation/research stay).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship supports students and doctoral candidates distinguished by high academic achievements and current, pronounced social and societal commitment. It offers a wide range of support including political education events, summer schools, workshops, symposia, and educational trips. The foundation aims to compensate for social, political, or gender disadvantages. The 'Lux like Studium' program supports school students from non-academic backgrounds in gaining university admission and completing a degree.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship Start Date: Summer semester (April 1, 2026). Maximum duration of 3 years for PhD scholarships.

funding_info.funding_details: The fellowship is fully funded, covering all expenses including full tuition fees for the duration of the degree program, a monthly stipend of ₩1,000,000 KRW (approximately $750 USD), and a research grant. It offers comprehensive financial support for Master's and PhD degrees in South Korea.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be Asian students (holding Asian citizenship, all Asian countries except Turkey are eligible) who wish to pursue Master’s and PhD degrees at South Korean universities. They must plan to enroll in a Master’s or Doctoral program in STEM fields at one of the nine designated Korean universities. Applicants must have been admitted to a Master's or Doctoral program at a Korean graduate school and must be recommended by their admitting institution.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) fields
field_restrictions.restrictions: The fellowship is strictly for STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.7 on a 4.0 scale (or equivalent, e.g., 2.87 out of 4.3, 3.0 out of 4.5)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s and PhD degrees (Master’s or Doctoral program)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Certificate of Valid English Proficiency Test (TOEFL, TOEIC, TEPS, IELTS ONLY) and Certificate of Valid TOPIK (Korean Language Proficiency Test) are required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter (Max. 2 letters)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must apply to an eligible partner university listed by the fellowship. Firstly, applicants have to apply for the POSCO Asia Fellowship Program and wait for the results. A Statement of Purpose is required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Statement of Purpose, Recommendation letter (Max. 2 letters), Certificate of Valid English Proficiency Test (TOEFL, TOEIC, TEPS, IELTS), Certificate of Valid TOPIK.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants will be contacted for an interview if shortlisted.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The POSCO Asia Fellowship aims to strengthen mutual understanding and cooperation among Asian countries by supporting talent exchange and academic collaboration. It supports talented Asian students pursuing Master’s or PhD degrees in STEM fields at top South Korean universities.

basic_info.provider: Government of the Czech Republic, Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports of the Czech Republic

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships. Monthly stipend for Master's students is CZK 14,000. Monthly stipend for PhD students is CZK 15,000 (approximately EUR 585).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: over 700 scholarships dispensed annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to students from selected developing countries as part of Foreign Development Cooperation. Eligible countries include: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Ukraine, Belarus (democratic forces), Ethiopia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Zambia, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Guatemala, Jordan. Only students from these listed developing countries can apply for follow-up Master's or Doctoral degree programs. No students from EU countries can apply. Applicants must be officially nominated by relevant authorities in their eligible home countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Study or research areas relevant to current or previous academic focus. Master's programs at Charles University in Prague are available for talented economists and data analysts.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s or PhD. Applicants for a Master's program must hold a completed Bachelor's degree. Applicants for a PhD program must hold a Master's degree. Bachelor's degree studies are not available for Master's graduates.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience (academic staff may apply and are required to submit a letter with their application).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Programs are available in Czech or English. Some programs include a 1-year Czech language preparation if studying in Czech. Some sources indicate 'Scholarships without IELTS'.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies. Medical confirmation about the applicant’s health no more than two months old with a certified translation into English or Czech.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form, Valid passport or ID, Academic degree certificates and official transcripts, CV, Legalised copy of birth certificate with a certified translation into Czech, Medical confirmation (no more than two months old) with certified translation into English or Czech, Legalised copy of foreign diploma (or similar document proving completion of Follow-up Master’s Study program) with certified translation into Czech, Legalised copy of Diploma Supplement or list of completed subjects/examinations with grades and certified translation into Czech, Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships, Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services, Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarships are granted to candidates officially recommended by appropriate authorities in eligible countries, who collect applications, set closing dates, and organize selection procedures. Host universities autonomously stipulate admission terms and language requirements, making independent decisions on applicant acceptance within the MEYS scholarship program.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Government of Czechia scholarships for Master’s and PhD, offered as part of the Czech Republic’s Foreign Development Cooperation to support education for students from select developing countries. Governed by the Strategy for Granting Governmental Scholarships for Students from Developing Countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the Academic Year 2026/2027 open on August 4th and close on September 30th, 2025.

basic_info.provider: National Agency for Academic Exchange (NAWA), Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Education and Science (or Minister of Science and Higher Education)

funding_info.funding_details: Total budget for one call is approximately PLN 9.9 million. Monthly scholarship amounts to PLN 1,500 (or PLN 32,400 worth of stipends for the duration of studies). Free studies at public and many private universities.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by call; recent deadlines include June 25, 2024 (or June 27, 2024 at 3 pm) and May 19, 2025.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for the 2025/2026 call are now open.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by year: 443 scholarships awarded from 3587 applications; 240 scholarships awarded from 942 applications; 260 scholarships awarded from approximately 2000 applications.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Young people from developing countries; citizens of developing countries. Must not have previously received a NAWA scholarship under this programme.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering and technical sciences, agricultural sciences, exact sciences, and life sciences.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent for second-cycle (Master's) studies.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in Polish or English (depending on the chosen program path).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Not have previously received a NAWA scholarship under this programme.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Confirmation of university application/admission in Poland (not required for those choosing the full Polish path with a preparatory course). Applications must be submitted electronically via the NAWA system.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The objective of the Programme is to promote socio-economic progress of developing countries by raising the level of knowledge and education of their citizens through scholarships for second-degree (Master's) studies in Polish or English at Polish universities. It is a joint initiative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and NAWA, implemented under Polish Aid.

basic_info.study_country: Any university in an OAS Member State, with the exception of the applicant's sponsoring country. Specific examples include United States, Spain, Antigua & Barbuda, Barbados, Jamaica, Trinidad and Tobago.

funding_info.funding_details: Partial Funding, up to $10,000 USD per year or per academic year. OAS scholarships do not fully fund all study-related costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by program and university. Examples for 2025 include: April 20, 2025 (PAEC OAS-UNI Graduate), Rolling Deadline (PAEC OAS-UNI Certificate/CIEP), July 15, 2025 (OAS – Colorado State University Bachelor’s priority), September 1, 2025 (OAS-Universidad Europea Maestrías), June 30, 2025 (OAS – UWI). The application period for 2025 is open.
timeline_info.opening_date: March 15, 2025 (for PAEC OAS-UNI Announcement Publication). The 2025 Call for Application of the Academic Scholarship Program has opened.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Unlimited scholarships for Certificate Programs (PAEC OAS-UNI), Ten (10) Scholarships for Graduate Programs (PAEC OAS-UNI), Twenty (20) scholarships for CIEP English Program (PAEC OAS-UNI). One (1) Graduate scholarship shall be offered to each OAS member state.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to citizens of the Organization of American States (OAS) member states. For undergraduate studies, awarded to citizens/residents of an OAS Member States of the English-speaking Caribbean and Suriname. Recipients must agree to return and remain in the sponsoring country for a period of no less than twenty-four (24) months after completing the program of study. This also applies to recipients pursuing online studies. OAS scholarships do not cover dependent expenses.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate or graduate studies and/or graduate research that lead to a degree. Master’s or PhD level. Applied Environmental and Sustainability Studies is mentioned for specific universities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Studies must be undertaken in an OAS Member State, with the exception of the applicant's sponsoring country (e.g., except within Canada for Canadian nominees).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: GPA above the minimum standard required by the university.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For graduate studies: Must have obtained a first university (Bachelor's) degree by the time of application. For undergraduate studies: Must be enrolled in the program of study and be eligible to graduate within 2 academic years starting between January 1 and December 31, 2022, or have an admission letter to a university for the last two years of an undergraduate program that leads to a bachelor’s degree.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional background/work experience, if any. Scholarships may require applicants to have relevant prior experience or certain level of diploma in their field of study.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency is required, with programs like CIEP English Program available. Language of instruction for some programs is English.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least two (2) reference letters (academic, professional or personal). Recommendation letters must be written and signed by the recommenders and cannot come from relatives of the applicant.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Essay 1: Describe how the program of study will directly impact your career, improve your professional skills for your current job or future work.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be in good physical and mental health to complete the program successfully. Completed essays are required (minimum 800 characters, maximum 2900 characters for two essays). An I-20 form may be used to show the schedule of study. Online programs of study shall be prioritized at the time of scholarship selection.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online scholarship application through the OAS Fellowship Management System, supporting documents as requested, online 2025 OAS Graduate Academic Scholarships Application, completed essays, at least two (2) reference letters, I-20 form (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Preselected applications will be nominated to the OAS Secretariat. Final selection of scholarship recipients will be made by the Academic and Technical Studies Scholarship Selection Committee appointed by the Secretary General of the OAS. The National Liaison Office (ONE) in each member state conducts an in-country pre-selection of candidates. Professional background/work experience is considered (1 point).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: OAS Academic Scholarships are awarded for full-time studies at any university in an OAS Member State (excluding the applicant's sponsoring country) for undergraduate, graduate, or graduate research leading to a degree. Modality can be onsite. Duration varies: Certificate programs (1 semester), Graduate programs (2 years on average), CIEP English (8 weeks).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For PAEC OAS-UNI: Announcement Publication: March 15, 2025; Application Deadline: April 20, 2025 (Graduate), Rolling Deadline (Certificate/CIEP); Publication of Results: May 10, 2025; Start of Study Programs: August 25, 2025.

basic_info.provider: Latvian government, administered by State Education Development Agency (VIAA)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded or full/partial tuition fee coverage. Monthly stipend: €500 for Bachelor's and 2nd-level professional higher education students (for up to 10 months); €600 for Master's students (for up to 10 months); €700 for PhD students (for up to 11 months).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are offered to foreign students, researchers, and teaching staff for studies, research, and participation in summer schools in Latvian higher education institutions (HEIs). Applicants must be citizens of 39 eligible countries (or over 30 partnering countries) that have bilateral agreements on co-operation in education and science with Latvia, or countries that offer scholarships for Latvian students, researchers, and teaching staff without formal agreements. For Bachelor's and First level of professional higher education studies, applicants must have successfully completed at least one academic year of studies (at their home HEI or a Latvian HEI). Students wishing to continue studies for another year must re-apply. Only academic and scientific staff of foreign higher education and research institutions are eligible for research fellowships.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A variety of academic disciplines

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, First-level professional higher education, Master's, PhD, Research, Teaching staff

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Academic and scientific staff of foreign higher education and research institutions (for research fellowships)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Confirmation letter from a Latvian HEI; Curriculum Vitae (CV); Letter of Motivation/Personal Statement; Application form; All necessary application documents translated into Latvian or English.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, necessary files, confirmation letter by the HEI, Curriculum Vitae (CV), Letter of Motivation. All documents must be translated into Latvian or English.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Successful candidates are notified of the scholarship award by e-mail in June.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Administered by the State Education Development Agency (VIAA) under bilateral agreements on co-operation in education and science. Scholarships are for studies, research, and summer schools in Latvian HEIs. Instruction is available in both English and Latvian. A list of partner universities is available.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The call for applications is open from 1 February to 1 April. Applicants submit the application by the deadline. Scholarship decisions are communicated by e-mail in June.

basic_info.official_name: Chulabhorn Graduate Institute Scholarship 2026 (Post-Graduate Scholarship Program)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded, government-funded scholarship.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 15 fully-funded Master’s scholarships (some sources mention 10 for non-ASEAN applicants)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must meet specific academic, age, and experience requirements as detailed below, and be international students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Applied sciences and research, including applied biological sciences, environmental health, chemical sciences, Chemistry, Biology, Biological Sciences, Molecular Sciences, and general Science/Technology fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Bachelor's Degree with a cumulative GPA of at least 2.75 (some sources indicate 3.00 for specific programs/applicants).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's Degree (to apply for Master's or PhD programs)

experience_requirements.min_years: At least five years of field experience (specifically for mid-career conservation practitioners); some sources mention general experience in scientific fields.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Mid-career conservation practitioners (for specific programs/requirements)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Excellent proficiency in the English language, preferably demonstrated by recognized tests like TOEFL or IELTS.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 30 years of age (no exemption mentioned in some sources).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship is for international students. Some application forms are specifically for NON-ASEAN applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Lab experience, experience in scientific field.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form (Post-Graduate Scholarship Program application form for international applicants/NON-ASEAN), Medical History Report, CV, and other supporting documents.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Complete the application form and all supporting documents, then submit scanned files via email to cgi_academic@cgi.ac.th. (Note: An online application portal via HEC Pakistan was mentioned, but this is specific to Pakistani applicants and not the general method.)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A golden opportunity for talented international students to pursue Master’s or PhD degrees in applied sciences and research, offered by a highly reputed postgraduate institution in Bangkok.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Program Start: Mid-2026 (negotiable, Spring or Summer 2026 preferred). Priority application deadline for Spring term is December 1.

basic_info.official_name: Confucius Institute Scholarship (International Chinese Language Teachers Scholarship)
basic_info.provider: China Center for Language Education and Cooperation/Confucius Institute Headquarters Scholarship Division (CLEC)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering tuition, accommodation, living allowance/stipend, and comprehensive medical insurance. Partial funding may be offered, covering all expenses except the monthly allowance for personal expenses, especially if academic results are not above average.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by program start date: October 31 (for March intake, e.g., March 2026), May 31 (for September 2025 entry), April–May (for July or September intakes), September–November (for December or March intakes), or early May (general).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies; 10 scholarships mentioned for some programs, others not specified.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding students, scholars, and currently-employed Chinese language teachers are eligible to study International Chinese Language Education or related majors in Chinese universities. Scholarship renewal is contingent on maintaining above-average academic results.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Doctoral studies, research stays, participation in international conferences, Chinese language and culture courses, International Chinese Language Education, related majors, Chinese Language Study, Chinese language and literature, Chinese history, Chinese philosophy, Taiji Culture, Chinese Language plus Home-Stay in a Chinese Family program, Master’s Degree in International Chinese Language Education.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not all universities offer all the modalities mentioned.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (for some programs); Master’s degree studies in China (for MTCSOL).

experience_requirements.min_years: More than 2 years of work experience in Chinese language teaching (specifically for HSK Level 6, HSKK Advanced applicants).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Job as Chinese Language professors, currently-employed Chinese language teachers, in-service Chinese language teachers. Professional Experience Certificate required.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK Level 3: minimum 210 (Chinese Language Study); minimum 270 (International Chinese Language Education); minimum 180 (International Chinese Language Education, Chinese language and literature, Chinese history, or Chinese philosophy programs). HSK Level 4: minimum 180 (Chinese language and literature). HSK Level 5: minimum 210 (for 2 academic years sponsorship). HSK Level 6: minimum 200 (with 2+ years work experience). HSKK: required for International Chinese Language Education, Chinese language and literature, Chinese history, or Chinese philosophy programs; Intermediate Level 60 for Chinese language and literature; Advanced Level 60 with HSK 6; priority given for Chinese Language Study.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: 2 reference letters from professors or associate professors (required for MTCSOL applicants).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Application essay/study plan (200–800 Chinese characters) explaining Chinese learning background, study objectives, and post-study plans.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Up to 45 years old for current Chinese language teachers; not over 25 years old for graduate scholarship applicants.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants with International Chinese Language Teachers Scholarship Certificates from Chinese Bridge competitions submit documents directly with certificates. Priority given to applicants with HSKK test scores and those demonstrating a job as Chinese Language professors after completing a master’s degree. Scholarship renewal depends on academic performance.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Registration for a personal account on the Confucius Institute Scholarship website (http://cis.chinese.cn) is required to complete and submit the online application form. Information is available in Chinese and English.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Confucius Institute Scholarship Application Form, Application Guidelines, List of Application Materials, scholarship certificates (if applicable from Chinese Bridge competitions), Professional Experience Certificate (if applicable), Application essay/study plan, 2 reference letters (for MTCSOL).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Recommending Institutions (Confucius Institutes, independent Confucius Classrooms, HSK test centers, foreign educational institutions, Chinese language teacher training programs/Chinese departments at foreign universities, professional associations for Chinese language teaching, Chinese embassies/consulates abroad) recommend outstanding students and in-service Chinese language teachers.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Sponsors foreign students, scholars, and Chinese language teachers. Scholarship duration is typically a maximum of two academic years, with some programs offering 2 academic years plus 2 years of internship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Programs commence in March, July, September, or December. Application deadlines vary accordingly, typically October 31 for March intake, May 31 for September intake, and April-May for July/September intake. Applications are submitted online via the official scholarship website.

basic_info.provider: Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), provided by Royal Thai Government (RTG)

funding_info.funding_details: Covers tuition, registration fees, accommodation, and a bursary for living expenses. Offers full or partial tuition fee waiver.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 15 King's Scholarships and 15 Queen's Scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to Asian students, including those from Bhutan, Timor-Leste, ASEAN countries, and other Asian countries. Applicants must have an outstanding education record from an accredited institution and high proficiency in English as required by AIT. Applicants in Thailand can also apply. The application process is competitive.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields for HM King's Scholarship. For Master's degrees, any academic program offered at the School of Engineering and Technology (SET) and the School of Management (SOM). For Doctoral programs, any academic program offered at the School of Engineering and Technology (SET) and the School of Environment, Resources, and Development (SERD).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Environmental related fields for HM Queen's Scholarship.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For Bachelor’s degree: > 2.75 (or equivalent) from universities in QS 1,000 World University Ranking or QS Top 350 Asian Universities Ranking, or > 3.0 (or equivalent) from other universities. For Master’s degree: > 3.5 (or equivalent). Overall, recipients must have a GPA over 3.5 or equivalence.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's and Doctoral degrees. Applicants for Master's must have an outstanding education record in a 4-year undergraduate program. Applicants for Doctoral must have excellent undergraduate and graduate (Master's) achievements.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of two (2) years of full-time professional working experience (acquired after a university degree) for King's Scholarships. Minimum of one-year's relevant work experience for MBA programs.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time professional working experience; relevant work experience for MBA programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: High proficiency in English as required by AIT. Applicants can also take the AIT English Test administered by the AIT Language Center.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Research proposal; An application fee is required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Application Portal, Two recommendation letters, Research proposal.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process is competitive.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Non-binding scholarships for outstanding students from Thailand and other Asian nations.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The general deadline for HM King's and Queen's scholarships is 28 February. For the January 2026 intake, the final date to apply is 20 December 2025. For the 2026-28 cohort, the application deadline is early January 2026, with studies starting October 2026.

basic_info.provider: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students, covering full tuition fees (8 semesters for undergraduates).
covered_expenses: Monthly Stipend (KRW300,000 - KRW350,000 for undergraduates, general monthly allowance for graduates)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Early Admission: October 23, 2025 (Undergraduate); Regular Admission: January 6, 2026 (Undergraduate, Fall 2026); March 31, 2026 (Graduate)
timeline_info.opening_date: Early Admission: September 19, 2025; Regular Admission: November 6, 2025

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from any country. For masters, applicants must hold or expect to hold a bachelor’s degree before enrollment. For doctoral, applicants must hold or expect to hold a bachelor’s and master’s degree before enrollment. For undergraduate, applicants must have completed or will graduate from high school by February 2026 (Spring 2026 intake) or August 2026 (Fall 2026 intake). Applicants who hold Korean Citizenship (including dual citizenship) are NOT eligible to apply as international students. Applicants of Korean origin who completed their entire education (elementary, junior high, and high school) outside of Korea should submit the Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit issued by the Korean Immigration Office.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Computer Science, Materials Science & Engineering, Physics, Mathematical Sciences, Chemistry, Biological Sciences, Graduate School of Medical Science and Engineering, School of Transdisciplinary Studies, College of Natural Sciences, College of Life Science & Bioengineering, College of Engineering, College of Business, KAIST MBA, Finance MBA, science, technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship-related fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Maintain a minimum CGPA of 2.7/4.3 to keep the scholarship (for undergraduates).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma for undergraduate; Bachelor's degree for Master's; Bachelor's and Master's degrees for Doctoral.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English (TOEFL, IELTS, or proof of English-medium education).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants admitted to the university will be automatically considered for the KAIST scholarship. Applicants should check the KAIST scholarship on the Statement of Financial Resources online admissions application.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submit an online application using the KAIST application platform.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application, Application Fee, Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit (for Korean origin applicants who studied abroad).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants admitted to the university will be automatically considered for the KAIST scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The KAIST International Student Scholarship is a highly competitive, fully funded opportunity for undergraduate and graduate international students at the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for Spring and Fall semesters 2026, with study starting March 2, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Skoll Centre for Social Entrepreneurship at Oxford / Saïd Business School, University of Oxford

funding_info.funding_details: Full funding for MBA course fees, tuition, and college fees, plus partial living expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to four scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to social entrepreneurs interested in undertaking an Oxford MBA. Must demonstrate a strong commitment to creating and leading social ventures that tackle deep-seated social and environmental issues. Must be committed to a career in social innovation and impact and be ready to utilize the Oxford MBA and Skoll Centre community to enhance and expand social impact. Must articulate how being part of the University of Oxford, the Saïd Business School MBA programme, and the Skoll Centre community would advance their professional growth and their ability to create systemic social or environmental impact.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: MBA at Saïd Business School, University of Oxford

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 3.7 out of 4 (most successful candidates achieve higher)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Experience as a social entrepreneur, creating and leading social ventures, or a career in social innovation and impact.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Commitment to a career in social innovation and impact. Must articulate how the Oxford MBA and Skoll Centre community would advance professional growth and ability to create systemic social or environmental impact.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submission of responses to Skoll Scholarship essay questions as part of the MBA application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Responses to Skoll Scholarship essay questions (as part of MBA application).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: MBA application is first reviewed. If accepted into the MBA program, the application automatically proceeds to the Skoll Scholarship Selection Committee. Final shortlisted applicants will have first-stage online interviews with the Skoll Scholarship Selection Committee.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious opportunity providing funding for social entrepreneurs to undertake an Oxford MBA. It aims to enhance and broaden their skills for more effective social change and recognizes the financial strain an MBA may pose for those committed to social innovation and impact.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2026-2027 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: Travel costs (including flights to and from study destination)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Supports exceptional students from Zambia, Zimbabwe, and Malawi who are domiciled in these countries. Strictly for postgraduate (Master's-level) study. Applicants cannot have already begun a course. Applicants must apply to one or more of the partner universities. For South African universities, candidates may apply for the scholarship before receiving an offer, but must list their intended programmes and institutions. Preference is given to applicants with a Distinction or Merit (Upper Second Class) in their undergraduate degree.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Preference is given to applicants with a Distinction or Merit (Upper Second Class) in their undergraduate degree.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s-level study

experience_requirements.min_years: The Selection Board will look with greatest interest on applicants who have undertaken at least one year's work experience before applying.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, experience aligned with their proposed field of study

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Positive employer reference, Academic Reference Form
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants to South African universities must provide a SAQA Certificate of Evaluation, verifying equivalence to NQF Level 8 (required for Master’s study). Applicants must apply to one or more of the partner universities. Applicants should demonstrate the ability to study/work in a foreign environment.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic Reference Form, Scholarship Main application form, SAQA Certificate of Evaluation (for South African universities)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The Selection Board looks with greatest interest on applicants who have undertaken at least one year's work experience before applying.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Beit Trust and the University of Edinburgh Scholarships jointly fund postgraduate students from Malawi, Zambia and Zimbabwe to undertake a Masters programme in 2026-2027. In 2023 and 2025, the Trust awarded 21 Scholarships at British and South African universities through generous academic partnerships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year: 2026/27

basic_info.official_name: Open Society Foundations Civil Society Leadership Awards
basic_info.study_country: Europe, the US, and some parts of Asia

funding_info.funding_details: fully-funded scholarships for master’s degree study

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Individuals who clearly demonstrate academic and professional excellence and a deep commitment to leading positive social change in their communities. Competition is open and merit-based.
