Academic excellence, professional aptitude, leadership potential in the field of specialization, proven commitment to open society values, and appropriate language proficiency are all important factors in evaluation. Awards are available to citizens of countries including Azerbaijan, Belarus, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, and generally from 17 countries across Africa, Eurasia, South-East Asia and the Middle East. Applicants must demonstrate maturity, intellectual curiosity, flexibility, and civil society leadership potential; a clear commitment to their home country or region in supporting open society development; ability to receive and maintain a visa or study permit as required by the host country; and ability to participate in an intensive pre-academic summer school (July or August) and start their Master’s degree program (August or September).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Communications, Journalism & Media, Culture, History & Society, Development Studies, Economics, Education Management & Leadership, Environment & Natural Resource Management, Gender Studies, Human Rights, Law (including Human Rights law), Politics & International Studies, Public Health Policy & Health Management, Public Policy & Administration, Social Work & Social Policy

academic_requirements.required_degree: Earned bachelor's degree with an excellent academic record

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional excellence and aptitude; deep commitment to leading positive social change in their communities

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in the language of instruction (English, French or German) at a level required for admission by host universities

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate maturity, intellectual curiosity, flexibility, and civil society leadership potential; demonstrate a clear commitment to their home country or region in supporting open society development; be able to receive and maintain a visa or study permit as required by the host country; be able to participate in an intensive pre-academic summer school in July or August and start their Master’s degree program in August or September.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed by CSLA staff and international experts to assess eligibility, competitive potential, and fit. Evaluation factors include academic excellence, professional aptitude, leadership potential in the field of specialization, proven commitment to open society values, and appropriate language proficiency.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Civil Society Leadership Awards (CSLA) provide fully-funded scholarships for master’s degree study to individuals who clearly demonstrate academic and professional excellence and a deep commitment to leading positive social change in their communities. It is one of OSF’s priority areas for post-graduate scholarship funding.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 12 months for a one-year Master's programme.

basic_info.official_name: Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: Up to US$21,000 per year for a maximum of two years. Some sources indicate up to US$10,000 per year.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 6-12 scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of developing countries (specifically those identified for OECD official development aid in the DAC List of ODA Recipients). They must be full-time master's level students. Students already receiving full funding for their studies are not eligible; those receiving scholarships covering their tuition fees may not be eligible for the full ESED scholarship amount. Applicants should demonstrate excellent grades, typically in the top 20% of their class.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s-level studies in fields related to sustainable energy development, including but not limited to: zero-carbon energy, smart grids, electric transportation, energy storage, advanced electricity technologies, public policy, economics, law, political science, and other relevant fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's level studies (or Post-Doctoral level, as mentioned by one source)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience (if applicable)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: The scholarship is not retroactive.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Passport (photo page) or birth certificate, Curriculum Vitae (detailing education, work experience, honors, volunteer/extracurricular activities), Admission letter from institute (or acknowledgement of application if admission letter is not yet received).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The ESED scholarship program aims to inspire and support outstanding students pursuing advanced master’s-level studies in sustainable energy development, encouraging meaningful contributions to the collective body of knowledge and fostering the next generation of innovators for a sustainable future.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2023 edition: from January 9, 2023 to April 7, 2023.

basic_info.official_name: Invest Your Talent in Italy Scholarship
basic_info.provider: Italian government; Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation - Directorate General for Public and Cultural Diplomacy, Ministry of University and Research, ITA – Italian Trade Agency, and Uni-Italia

funding_info.funding_details: Full scholarship packages including subsistence allowance, fee-waiver and dedicated student support services.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 39 new scholarships (for 9th Edition, A.Y. 2024-2025)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from eligible countries. Eligible countries for 9th Edition (A.Y. 2024-2025) include: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Brazil, Colombia, Egypt, Ethiopia, Ghana, India, Indonesia, Iran, Kazakhstan, Mexico, Republic of Korea, People’s Republic of China (PRC), Tunisia, Turkey, Vietnam. Applicants must first complete a pre-application process at their chosen university, following each university’s admission procedures, before submitting an IYT scholarship application.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Economics, Management, Engineering, High Technology, Information Technologies, Architecture, Design, Business Management
field_restrictions.restrictions: Master's degree programmes only (Laurea Magistrale or Master universitario), completely taught in English. The program's commitment (CFU achievement, compulsory Italian language course attendance, internship) does not allow participation in other international training courses offered by Universities.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree or equivalent (three or four-year Bachelor's degree), provided it was not awarded by an Italian institution.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English certificate; language certificates

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must first complete a pre-application process at their chosen university, following each university’s admission procedures, before submitting an IYT scholarship application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Reference letters, language certificates. For renewal: University Transcript of exams (with CFUs), Certificate of Attendance of the Italian Language Course.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A collaborative initiative of various countries, universities, and companies with Italy. Aims to promote the internationalization of the Italian university system as a center of excellence, offering foreign students opportunities for educational paths and future careers. The program offers full scholarship packages including subsistence allowance, fee-waiver and dedicated student support services. It includes a compulsory 3-month internship for winners.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period for A.Y. 2025-2026: January 23, 2025 – February 24, 2025. Scholarship renewal application deadline: July 20th, 2026 (for A.Y. 2025-2026 renewal).

basic_info.provider: ESMT Berlin in cooperation with the Kofi Annan Business Schools Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Full tuition scholarship from ESMT (€25,000 for MIM students and €43,500 for MBA students) plus fair compensation for travel and accommodation costs and program related fees. Value of the fellowship is € 58,000 (from one source).

timeline_info.application_deadline: September 30, annually (for MBA program); June 30, 2018 (for MIM program, historical)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to three fellowships are available each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Emerging leader from a developing country; Resident of Nigeria (specific mention); Excellent academic credentials; Significant professional achievements; Demonstrable leadership skills; Academically distinguished students from developing countries who do not have the financial means to study in Europe; High-potential professional must meet ESMT's full-time MBA application criteria and prove financial need; Willingness to apply skills back home.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s in Management (MIM), one-year full-time MBA

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree of any kind

experience_requirements.min_years: 3 years

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS: 7; TOEFL: 95 minimum (Code 8707); PTE: 64 minimum; GMAT or GRE score (GMAT: 640); Fluency in written and spoken English/English proficiency.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required: letter of recommendation describing
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Demonstrate financial need; Willingness to apply skills back home.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Complete a scholarship essay as part of the ESMT online application explaining how they qualify for this scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship essay, letter of recommendation
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A fellowship grant for an emerging leader from a developing country for a two-year Master’s in Management (MIM) or a one-year full-time MBA education at ESMT Berlin. Provided by ESMT European School of Management and Technology, Germany in cooperation with the Kofi Annan Business Schools Foundation in The Hague, Netherlands.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The MBA program begins in January of each year.

basic_info.provider: Swiss Confederation, State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation (SERI), Federal Commission for Scholarships for Foreign Students (FCS)

funding_info.funding_details: Comprehensive support including a monthly stipend, mandatory Swiss health insurance (for non-EU/EFTA awardees), partial tuition exemptions, and practical benefits. Stipend for PhD and Research scholarships is CHF 1920/month. A professor hosting an FCS scholarship holder at a USI institute may decide to top up the scholarship with a part-time job appointment.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aimed at young researchers from abroad who have completed a master’s degree or PhD, and at foreign artists holding a bachelor’s degree. Post-graduate researchers in any discipline (holding a master’s degree as a minimum) who are planning to pursue research or further studies at doctoral or post-doctoral level in Switzerland. Applicants who have already benefited from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to apply for a second scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any discipline for researchers; research work in fields where Swiss universities are particularly active; Schools of music and arts for artists.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree or PhD (for researchers); Bachelor’s degree (for artists)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants who have already benefited from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to apply for a second scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must secure a willing academic supervisor at a host institution in Switzerland before applying. The application for a PhD scholarship (including letter of support from a host supervisor) and the application for admission to a doctoral programme are two separate procedures. A 2.5 GPA is mentioned for visiting students (specific to Caltech context).

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection process by the Federal Commission for Scholarships (FCS). Decisions on new awardees for the 2025–2026 academic year are announced by the end of May 2026 at the latest.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Each year the Swiss Confederation awards Government Excellence Scholarships to encourage international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. Scholarships are for research or study at Swiss cantonal universities, universities of applied sciences, federal institutes of technology, and research institutes, or Schools of music and arts. Some research scholarships are valid for 12 months and non-renewable for full-time research in Switzerland; some are valid only for full-time postdoctoral research.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period opens around September 15 and closes around November 30 (varies by country). Scholarship start date is 1 September, with entry not before 1 August. Selection decisions are announced by the end of May.

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Tempus Public Foundation (co-ordinator)

funding_info.funding_details: The programme provides tuition-free education, monthly stipend, accommodation contribution, and medical insurance. For doctoral level, the monthly stipend is HUF 140,000 (cca EUR 365/390) for the first 4 semesters and HUF 180,000 (cca EUR 470/500) for the second 4 semesters, for 12 months a year. For BA/BSc, MA/MSc programmes, the monthly stipend is HUF 43,700. In all study levels, the scholarship provides free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000/month to accommodation costs for the whole duration.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 15, 2026 (various times depending on region, e.g., 12 noon, 2 p.m. Central European Time/ 9 a.m. Atlantic Standard time)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: nearly 4,500 scholarships were awarded (in 2024)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students. Eligibility is based on bilateral educational agreements between Hungary and the governments of the sending partners. Applicants are eligible to apply only for those scholarship types and study fields determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific sending partner. Applicants must conform to the application and entrance exam criteria of the Hungarian higher education institution and officially enroll at the Hungarian higher education institution.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: For full degree master studies: Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance. For partial studies – master level: Agricultural Science, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Political Science and Public Governance, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts and Art Education. Specific study programmes and Host Institutions are accessible on the online application system's website.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible to apply only for those scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific sending partner.

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Bachelor's (Undergraduate) and One-Tier program: HSSC/Intermediate or equivalent. For Master's (Postgraduate Program): 16 years Bachelor's degree or equivalent (copy of BA/BSc certificate with notarized English/Hungarian translation). For PhD program: 17/18 years Degree/or equivalent (Undergraduate diploma, Master’s diploma optional).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: For PhD (Brazil specific): Scientific or technological research production (published articles, book chapters, book authorship, publications in annals of events), coordination of a research or extension project certified by the institution.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency test results are required, including TOEFL IBT (Internet-Based Testing), TOEFL ITP (Institutional Testing Program), IELTS (International English Language Test), or Cambridge Certificate. Specific language proficiency requirements are outlined in the Call for Applications.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letters of Recommendation from a former or current academic tutor/supervisor (with scientific degree and insight into applicant's professional work), written in the language of the selected study programme or in Hungarian. A Statement of the Supervisor from the proposed Host Institution (if required by the Doctoral School) undertaking to supervise the student's work, to be submitted by March 15.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students at Risk Subprogramme is available.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must ensure the selected programme is eligible under the agreement between Hungary and their home country’s sending partner. Scholarship holders must comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements. New scholarship recipients at Liszt Academy are required to take a compulsory Hungarian as a foreign language and culture course during the first two semesters. The minimum point required to achieve an “acceptable” or “conditionally acceptable” status is 56 points (on a 100 points scale). The consideration of the application based on the submission of a transcript of the Bachelor’s degree may depend on the specific requirements of the chosen study program and the Sending Partner.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Call for Applications for BA/MA/OTM programmes (2026/27), Call for Applications for doctoral programmes (2026/27), Application Guide (2025/26), Copy of BA/BSc certificate (for MA/MSc applicants) with notarized English/Hungarian translation, Updated curriculum vitae (e.g., from Lattes Platform for Brazil PhD), Undergraduate diploma, Master’s diploma (optional for PhD), Proficiency test results, Video recordings (for Liszt Academy applicants), Letters of Recommendation, Statement of the Supervisor (if required), Transcript of Records and its translations, Copy of Identification Document (passport or national ID card).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed jointly by the sending partner (in the applicant’s home country) and the Hungarian host institution. Applicants are informed about their results by the ministry of education of their country or by the national scholarship office/agency. Host institutions (e.g., University of Debrecen) conduct formal checks of application documents and inform students about entrance exam/interview details. Scholarships are awarded by the Minister responsible for education in Hungary based upon the nomination of the Hungarian Scholarship Board.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship programme was launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013 to promote the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education and attract top international students. Nearly 12,000 Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders are currently studying in Hungary. In the 2023/2024 academic year, 28 Hungarian higher education institutions, including Semmelweis University, Eötvös Loránd University, and the University of Debrecen, offered programmes.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period: January – February 2026 for the 2026/2027 academic year. Final degree and transcript submission (for 2025/2026 academic year) before August 01, 2025.

basic_info.provider: French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Master's level recipients receive a monthly allowance of €1,181. Doctoral level recipients receive a monthly allowance of €2,100. PhD funding duration is 12 to 36 months, depending on the graduate program, or 12 to 18 months depending on the year of enrollment (max 12 months for 2nd/3rd year doctorate, max 18 months for 1st/2nd year doctorate).
covered_expenses: Travel and transportation expenses (international airfare, domestic travel support)
Housing (assistance in locating housing, housing search costs)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 433 (370 at master's level and 63 at doctoral level awarded for 2025 academic year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The scholarship is for top foreign/international students to enroll in Master's and PhD programs at French higher education institutions. Applications are submitted exclusively by French higher education institutions on behalf of the student. Students must be nominated by a French higher education institution and accepted into a program. Applicants should not benefit from another French government scholarship at the time of application. Applicants must apply to the Eiffel Scholarship program for the first time. Dual nationals (including French) are not eligible. For PhD applications, the program funds stays as part of a cotutelle or joint supervision agreement (a cotutelle agreement must be signed). Candidates already enrolled in a doctoral program are eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science and techniques (Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital, Science and engineering); Human and social sciences (French history, language and civilization, Law and political sciences, Economics and management).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate levels are not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Not specified, but a high academic ranking (top 3-5%) can be a decisive factor.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's or PhD programs

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Detailed description of academic/professional performance from references. For PhD, a reasoned opinion on the scientific quality of the thesis subject drafted by an expert (university professor/research supervisor) from outside the applicant's university, along with the expert's CV.
additional_requirements.age_limits: For Master's programs: under the age of 27, or born after March 31st, 1998. For Doctorate programs: under the age of 32, or born after March 31st, 1993.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must apply for the first time to the Eiffel Scholarship program. Must not benefit from another French government scholarship. Dual nationals (including French) are not eligible. For PhD, a cotutelle or joint supervision agreement must be signed.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Description of the course requested and its schedule; Copies of the last diploma(s) obtained with ranking; Any other document certifying the applicant's level of excellence or performance; Certificate of enrolment for the current academic year (if currently a student); For PhD: reasoned opinion on the scientific quality of the thesis subject drafted by an expert and the expert's CV; Motivation essay (1-2 pages, max 1500 words, in French or English, addressed to the Eiffel Scholarship committee).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are submitted exclusively by French higher education institutions. The European and International Affairs office (or equivalent) at the institution centralizes applications and sends files directly to Campus France. Applicants must contact the head of the program or doctoral school they are interested in to secure a favorable recommendation (e.g., before November 24, 2025, for primary selection). The head of the program/doctoral school will provide access to an online application.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eiffel Excellence Scholarship Program was established by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs to enable French higher education institutions to attract top foreign students to enroll in their Master's and PhD programs. The management of the program is entrusted to Campus France.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application for the 2026-2027 academic year. Application launch is in October 2025, with an official program deadline of January 8, 2026. Internal university recommendation deadlines may be earlier (e.g., November 24, 2025).

basic_info.provider: Estonian Ministry of Education and Research, in partnership with the Education and Youth Board

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarships are often fully funded, covering tuition, living expenses, and travel support, depending on the program type. Living stipends vary, with amounts such as €400 per month, €350 per month for Bachelor's and Master's studies, €288 per month for Master's language programs, €385 per month for doctoral language programs, and €287 per month (4500 Estonian kroons). Some programs offer a €7,920 living stipend with no tuition fees.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to international students, researchers, and academic staff interested in studying or conducting research in Estonia. Specific scholarships may target students of Estonian ancestry studying full-time in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program at an accredited academic institution in the USA, Estonia, or elsewhere. Another specific program is for young diplomats and civil servants.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: International Relations and Diplomacy (for a specific certificate program)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Limited funding for Bachelor's studies specifically in Estonian language and culture.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, or certificate programs. Also available for exchange studies, short courses (summer/winter schools), and research.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students of Estonian ancestry (for a specific scholarship program).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Copy of the academic record from the institution of higher education attended most recently (with unofficial English translation if necessary) for the ESD program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form (Word format), copy of passport or ID card, Estonian higher education institution confirmation letter (detailing student status, level, curriculum, start/end dates of study). Academic record from most recently attended higher education institution (with unofficial English translation if necessary) for the ESD program.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A comprehensive program offering various scholarships for international students, researchers, and academic staff. Categories include scholarships for degree studies (Bachelor's, Master's, PhD), exchange studies, short courses (summer/winter schools), research grants (including Estonia-specific research like Estophilus), and a certificate program in International Relations and Diplomacy for young diplomats and civil servants. Some specific scholarships exist for students of Estonian ancestry.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2025/2026 and 2026/2027 academic years, depending on the specific scholarship program. Decisions for some programs (e.g., Estonian ancestry scholarship) are given by the end of November.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering course fees (tuition and college fees) and providing a generous grant for living expenses. The annual grant for living expenses is at least the UKRI minimum doctoral stipend rate for full-time scholars, normally sufficient to cover living costs for a single student in Oxford. Funding is typically for the period of fee liability, with some discretion for additional study periods.

timeline_info.application_deadline: December or January deadline, whichever is relevant for the applicant's chosen graduate course.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 230+ new scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be applying for a new Master's or DPhil course at the University of Oxford. Open to all nationalities, ordinary residence, and subject areas. Current students continuing the same degree are not eligible. Awarded based on outstanding academic merit and potential, exceptional academic performance, leadership potential, and for DPhil applicants, research potential. Must meet English language proficiency requirements if applicable.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subject areas and all full-time and part-time DPhil and Master's courses are eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.7 out of 4.0 (for US degrees or equivalent 1st class degree), with most successful candidates achieving higher.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate degree (Master's or DPhil/PhD).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL) if required by the course. For MSc in Computer Science, IELTS 7.5 overall with minimum 7.0 in sections.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required as part of the graduate course application.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate leadership potential; for Ph.D. applicants, show research potential; future academic potential and aptitude for the proposed course of study; evidence of high academic achievement (e.g., transcripts, prizes, awards, cohort position, publications).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: No separate Clarendon application or documents are required. Applicants are automatically considered when applying for their chosen graduate course via Oxford's official portal. Required documents for the graduate course application may include proof of English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL), writing sample/portfolio (for some courses), and research proposals (for DPhil).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded based on academic excellence and potential. Selection criteria vary by subject area and degree type (taught/research). Consideration is given to future academic potential and aptitude for the proposed course of study. Successful applicants are contacted by the Clarendon Fund Administrator with an offer letter after shortlisting.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Aims to provide academically-able students with a life-changing opportunity to study at Oxford, form lasting social, academic, and professional networks, and join an active, internationally diverse, and multidisciplinary community.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship is for the 2026-2027 academic year, with applications currently open. Some sources also mention 2025.

basic_info.provider: International Cooperation and Development Fund (Taiwan ICDF)

funding_info.funding_details: Full Funding

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be a citizen of a country on the List of Countries Eligible for TaiwanICDF Scholarship, satisfy any specific criteria, and be exclusively for students attending partner schools and programs within TICA.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, Master's, and Ph.D. programs across fields like agriculture, public health, engineering. The scholarship partners with 18-19 Taiwanese universities to offer 29 English-taught programs (27 Master's, 2 PhD).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 or equivalent (minimum); 3.5 (recommended)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's, and Ph.D. programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: None (The TaiwanICDF has no requirements regarding English proficiency tests, but individual partner universities may have their own, e.g., TOEFL minimum score above 80(IBT)/213(CBT)/550(PBT) or IELTS 6.5 for some programs).

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 50
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Be in good mental and physical health. Applicants must complete an online application, accomplish the online application portal, print out the form, and upload all required documents accurately.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed Application Form (online application portal: https://web.icdf.org.tw). Other required documents must be uploaded but are not specified in detail.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The TaiwanICDF provides scholarships for higher education in cooperation with renowned partner universities in Taiwan. It collaborates with a number of prestigious Taiwanese universities (18-19) to offer various programs, including 29 English-taught programs (27 Master's, 2 PhD). The scholarship is exclusively for students attending partner schools and programs within TICA.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2026 TaiwanICDF Scholarship will be open for applications from December 1, 2025 to March 15, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Up to three years of financial support to pursue graduate studies at Stanford. The program covers the full cost of the first three years of a graduate program.
covered_expenses: stipend for living and academic expenses (such as room and board, books, academic supplies)
travel stipend for one annual trip to and from Stanford

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 8, 2025 (1:00 p.m. PST) for the 2026 cohort
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 100 scholars annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to citizens of all countries. Applicants must have earned their first undergraduate degree within the last seven years. Applicants must apply to enroll in a full-time graduate degree program at Stanford. The first bachelor's degree must be completed before enrollment. Even if a graduate degree has already been earned, eligibility remains as long as the undergraduate degree timeframe is met. Competitive candidates for the Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program are, at a minimum, competitive candidates for their selected graduate program at Stanford. Applicants must simultaneously apply for graduate admissions to their selected department or school at Stanford.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Stanford graduate degree programs (MA, PhD, MD, MBA, JD, MS, and others) across all seven schools at the university.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Must be a full-time graduate degree program at Stanford.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: There is no minimum GPA requirement for Knight-Hennessy, but applicants must meet any GPA requirements for their specific Stanford degree programs. To be competitive, applicants should have at least a 3.7 GPA, and for many Stanford graduate programs, a 3.9+ GPA.
academic_requirements.required_degree: First undergraduate degree / bachelor's degree

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated leadership and civic commitment; independence of thought, purposeful leadership, and civic mindset; visionary, courageous, and collaborative leaders who address complex challenges facing the world.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Non-native English speakers must provide proof of English proficiency through TOEFL or IELTS scores. All Stanford graduate degree programs accept the TOEFL, and the MBA Program also accepts the IELTS and PTE.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants are asked to reflect on how they will pursue their life's calling and how their Stanford education and Knight-Hennessy Scholars experience will support this.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must record a two-minute video within the application in response to the prompt, “Teach something to your cohort of fellow Knight-Hennessy Scholars.” Essays include questions about connecting the dots, past experiences, and future plans. Selection criteria include: 1. Seeks out new knowledge, perspectives, and experiences. 2. Courageous leaders who are ethical, decisive, resilient, driven to achieve meaningful results, and motivated to inspire others to effect positive change at scale.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application, video statement, essays.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Evaluation is based on the application, video statement, and Finalist Experience. The Finalist Experience involves behavioral questions based on the three primary evaluation criteria. No institutional nomination or endorsement is required.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A multidisciplinary, multicultural community of graduate students united by independence of thought, purposeful leadership, and civic mindset, dedicated to finding creative solutions to the world’s greatest challenges. Scholars are prepared to be visionary, courageous, and collaborative leaders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The KHS application to join the 2026 cohort is now closed. The KHS application to join the 2027 cohort will open in summer 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded, all-expenses-paid scholarship for a one-year Master's program.

timeline_info.application_deadline: For applicants with Chinese passports (including Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macao): May 19 or 20, 2025 (11:59 PM Beijing/China Standard Time). For US/Global applicants (Class of 2026-2027): September 10 at 3:00 p.m. EDT.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now officially open for the 2026–2027 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 200 Scholars chosen annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aspiring global leaders from across the world. Applicants must have an undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university or its equivalent, and be on track to successfully complete all degree requirements before August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year (or end of July). Candidates must be at least 18 but not yet 29 years of age as of August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year. Strong English skills are required, as all teaching is conducted in English. No restrictions on citizenship or nationality.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: One-year Master's degree in Global Affairs, Public Policy, Economics and Business, or International Relations.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No requirements for a specific field of undergraduate study; all fields are welcome. However, applicants must articulate how participating in Schwarzman Scholars will help develop their leadership potential within their field.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA, but the median GPA of successful applicants has been 3.8, with only a few scholarship winners under 3.7.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must have an undergraduate degree or first degree from an accredited college or university or its equivalent. The scholarship funds a one-year Master's degree.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experiences and leadership qualities are required. Applicants should demonstrate leadership potential, entrepreneurial spirit, and ability to anticipate and act on emerging trends and opportunities.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Official English proficiency test scores must be submitted if the applicant's native language is not English. This requirement is waived for applicants who studied at an undergraduate institution where the primary language of instruction was English for at least two years of their academic program.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three letters of recommendation are required. For current undergraduates: 2 from professors (academic abilities), 1 addressing leadership abilities (from employer, supervisor, mentor, faculty, advisor, or other). For graduate students or young professionals: At least 1 academic letter from a professor, 1 letter addressing leadership abilities, and 1 additional letter that best reflects the applicant’s current profile (from an additional employer, mentor, or faculty).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants must articulate how participating in Schwarzman Scholars will help develop their leadership potential within their field. Essays should demonstrate leadership, goals, and global vision.
additional_requirements.age_limits: At least 18 but not yet 29 years of age as of August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Different application deadlines apply based on the applicant's passport (Chinese passports vs. US/Global applicants).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Two essays and two short answer responses are required. Applicants must confirm and certify that all information provided in the application is complete and accurate, all submitted essays are their own work, and all factual representations are true and correct. Exemplary character and a desire to understand other cultures, perspectives, and positions are also sought.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application, transcripts (most updated if still completing degree), official English proficiency test scores (if applicable), two essays, two short answer responses, three letters of recommendation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly selective program. The selection committee evaluates applicants based on academic aptitude and intellectual ability, leadership potential, entrepreneurial spirit, ability to anticipate and act on emerging trends and opportunities, exemplary character, and desire to understand other cultures, perspectives, and positions.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Schwarzman Scholars Program is a prestigious one-year Master's program in Global Affairs at Tsinghua University in Beijing, China. It offers unparalleled academic, cultural, and professional experiences to build leadership capacity across sectors and borders. Scholars live and study together on the campus of Schwarzman College, a newly built, state-of-the-art facility where all classes are taught in English.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are currently open. Deadlines vary by applicant's passport, with Chinese passport holders typically having an earlier deadline (May 2025) compared to US/Global applicants (September 2025 for the 2026-2027 class).

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded master's scholarship.
covered_expenses: One round-trip travel fare / Travel stipend
Field study costs (support for travel / research trips)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 120 international students

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to candidates from all over the world. Strong interest in interdisciplinary study of China. Demonstrated leadership potential. Outstanding academic record. Broad curiosity. Not required to have Chinese language experience but should have a strong interest in China. Chinese nationals are not eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any field
field_restrictions.restrictions: None

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA specified, but 3.7+ the norm for successful applicants.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in any field by August 31st of the award year, or currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program and on track to graduate.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English requirements and minimum scores apply (for non-native English speakers).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Statement of Purpose in English, including a study plan.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No strict age cut-off for applicants, but, excluding recipients of the Zhuoyue Scholarship, no person over the age of 29 has been admitted. Some sources suggest applicants be 25 years of age or younger at the start of the program.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Zhuoyue Scholarship recipients are an exception to the age trend and require three or more consecutive years of employment experience in government, senior management, higher education, or international organizations. Campus-specific deadlines may apply (e.g., November 24, 2025 for Berkeley). WashU endorsement required for WashU applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Resume/CV (two pages maximum). Research proposal (1 page maximum). Three-minute English self-introduction video. Application form. Statement of Purpose word limit: maximum of 1,500 words, excluding citations.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, Resume/CV (two pages maximum), Research proposal (1 page maximum), Statement of Purpose in English (including a study plan, maximum 1,500 words excluding citations), Three-minute English self-introduction video, Two letters of recommendation.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An interdisciplinary graduate scholarship program at the Yenching Academy of Peking University (PKU) in Beijing, China. It is a residential program for a Master's degree. The program is for the 2026-2027 cohort.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application opens August 15, 2025, with a deadline of December 1, 2025, for the 2026-2027 cohort.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering almost all expenses a student might incur while studying abroad.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend for living expenses (CZK 16,000 for Master's students, CZK 17,000 for PhD students)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 700 scholarships dispensed annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to students from selected developing countries. Eligible countries include Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Ukraine, Belarus (democratic forces), Ethiopia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Zambia, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Guatemala, Jordan. Applicants must be officially nominated by relevant authorities in their home countries and choose study or research areas relevant to their current or previous academic focus. Open to university students, graduates, and PhD candidates.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time Master's or PhD degree programs in Czech or English at public universities. Bachelor's degrees are also mentioned in some sources. Specific Master's programs at Charles University include Economics and Finance (MEF) and Finance and Data Analytics (MFDA). Scholarships also support study or research visits.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants must choose study or research areas relevant to their current or previous academic focus.

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master's programs, a Bachelor's degree is required. For Doctoral programs, a Master's degree is required. Legalized copies of diplomas and transcripts with certified Czech translations are necessary.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Academic staff are eligible in certain cases for study or research visits.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Fluency in Czech is required for programs taught in Czech, as applicants must pass entrance exams. English-taught programs are available, implying English proficiency, but no specific tests (like IELTS/TOEFL) are explicitly mentioned.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Special consideration for Belarus (democratic forces).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Academic excellence. Applicants must sign an Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies. Charles University offers pre-evaluation for MEF applicants to enhance their chances.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form, CV, passport photocopy, Declaration about Acceptance of Terms and Conditions (Annex No. 1), Declaration about Acceptance of Health Services Terms (Annex No. 2), Affirmation on Return to Country of Origin (Annex No. 3), legalized birth certificate with Czech translation, medical confirmation (no more than two months old) with English/Czech translation, legalized copy of foreign diploma/Master's degree with Czech translation (for Doctoral), legalized copy of Diploma Supplement/transcripts with Czech translation. Guidelines and FAQ's should be reviewed. Application is via an online form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates must be officially nominated by relevant authorities in their home countries. Host universities autonomously stipulate admission terms and language requirements, making independent decisions on applicant acceptance. Charles University offers pre-evaluation for MEF applicants to enhance their chances.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Part of the Czech Republic’s Foreign Development Cooperation. Over 20,000 foreign students have completed studies with this scholarship since the 1950s. The scholarship supports world-class education at prestigious Czech public universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For Academic Year 2026/2027.

basic_info.official_name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic
basic_info.provider: Government of Slovakia; Ministry of Education, Science, Research, and Sport of the Slovak Republic; administrated by SAIA, n. o.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded; offers financial support to cover living costs during the stay and travel allowances/grants.
covered_expenses: travel grants (flat rate to cover travel costs)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The National Scholarship Programme supports mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists for scholarship stays at Slovak universities and Slovak research organisations. Eligible nationality: All Nationalities. Applicants must be studying or working outside Slovakia and be accepted by a Slovak host institution for mobility stays. University Students must be enrolled in a university outside Slovakia, pursuing a second-level higher education (Master’s) or having completed at least 2.5 years of undergraduate studies in the same program by the application deadline. Not supported: international students and PhD students accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies) in Slovakia, or those already studying in Slovakia (full degree higher education) who would like to fund their studies in Slovakia by the NSP; university teachers, researchers and artists without PhD degree (or its equivalent) and at the same time with more than 4 years of work experience as a university teacher/researcher/artist (PhD studies are considered as work experience) on the indicated application deadline; international applicants who within the period of 36 months prior to the application deadline have spent in the territory of the Slovak Republic 15 or more months (in total); international applicants who are accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia in the framework of other scholarship programmes funded from public resources (e.g. International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements, etc.).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: study, research, teaching, artistic stays
field_restrictions.restrictions: Supports short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays; does not support full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s (second-level higher education) or completed at least 2.5 years of undergraduate studies for university students; PhD students; PhD degree (or its equivalent) for university teachers/researchers/artists (with exceptions for experience).

experience_requirements.min_years: For university teachers, researchers, and artists without a PhD degree (or its equivalent), they must have 4 years or less of work experience in these roles.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: university teachers, researchers, artists

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of References
additional_requirements.career_plan: Detailed teaching and/or research/artistic programme
additional_requirements.age_limits: 18 – 26 years for a bachelor's and master's degree; 23 – 35 years for PhD students (implied)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: International applicants must not have spent 15 or more months in Slovakia within the 36 months prior to the application deadline.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV, Motivation Letter, Two letters of References, Detailed study/teaching/research/artistic programme, List of publications/artistic activities (for PhD students), Online application form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A Committee awards the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2005, the National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic supports mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists for short-term study, research, teaching, or artistic stays at Slovak universities and research organizations. It fosters academic excellence, cultural exchange, and global collaboration.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call for applications for study, research, teaching and artistic stays during the summer semester of the academic year 2026/2027. For PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists for the 2025-2026 call: earliest start date is September 1, 2025; latest start date is August 31, 2026; latest completion date is November 30, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Government of Brunei Darussalam, Ministry of Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: Economy class air-tickets (to and from Brunei Darussalam)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign/international students; Applicants must not hold Brunei Darussalam citizenship; Applicants must meet the admission requirements for the programs offered by the chosen institution; Scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship; Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect; Conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines / different fields of study

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No GPA requirement
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master's Degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English test required (specific tests not listed); Other language tests not required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required
additional_requirements.age_limits: Must not exceed 25 years old for Undergraduate and Diploma programs
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants interested in Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must additionally complete an online application through UBD's admission portal; Applicants may be required to attend an interview and/or sit for a written test in English, Malay, or Arabic, depending on program requirements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed Application Forms, Reference Letters
background_and_logistics.selection_process: May include an interview and/or a written test in English, Malay, or Arabic
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Offered annually under a special scholarship award scheme. Normally tenable for the minimum period required to obtain the specific degree, e.g., four (4) years for a First Degree.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year 2025/2026 (Applications for this session are now closed)

basic_info.official_name: Obama Foundation Scholars Program at Columbia University

funding_info.funding_details: Full Funding, Stipend, and Living Expenses (Fully Paid)

timeline_info.application_deadline: December 16 at 5 PM EST (for 2025-2026 academic year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 11 (for Columbia University cohort)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Emerging leaders from the United States and around the world who are focused on an issue of global importance, have a track record and commitment to advancing the public good, and want to accelerate their impact through an intensive program. Rising leaders from around the world who have demonstrated a commitment to finding solutions to challenges in their communities, countries and regions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Not broadly defined, but focused on finding solutions to challenges in communities, countries, and regions; advancing the public good; and issues of global importance. One mention of 'particularly in the context of radio astronomy' was found, but this appears to be an outlier or specific example.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Conflicting information found: minimum GPA of 2.7 or at least an 87% average (GPA) or above a 3.40 GPA as a college student.
academic_requirements.required_degree: None (non-degree immersive program)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Track record and commitment to advancing the public good; demonstrated commitment to finding solutions to challenges in their communities, countries and regions.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate proficiency in English by submitting scores from TOEFL (IBT: 100, PBT: 600), IELTS (7), PTE Academic (68), or Duolingo English Test (DET: 120). Exams must have been taken in the last five years.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendations should directly address the applicant's suitability for admission to the program.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Resume/curriculum vitae (chronological listing of employment, academic history, significant activities, awards, publications, achievements).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Resume/curriculum vitae, English language proficiency test scores (TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or DET), Recommendations.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A year-long (nine-month, August to May) rigorous, immersive program at Columbia University that brings together academic, skills-based, and experiential learning, designed by Columbia University in consultation with the Obama Foundation. Scholars also engage in robust programming offered by The Obama Foundation with their counterpart Scholars cohort. The program is for the 2025-2026 academic year. Note: Official sources state applications for 2025-2026 are now closed.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Nine-month immersive program from August 2025 until May 2026 for the 2025-2026 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: The McCall MacBain Scholarship funds a fully funded master's at McGill, covering tuition, a $2000 monthly stipend, and a relocation grant. It enables students to pursue a fully funded master’s or professional degree at McGill University while connecting with mentors and participating in an intensive leadership development program. It covers tuition and fees for an eligible master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate program at McGill and provides a living stipend of $2,300 per month during academic terms. It also includes summer funding options and an enrichment program.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 13, 2026 at 4pm ET (for 2026 McCall MacBain International Fellowships)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 30 McCall MacBain Scholars (20 Canadians, 10 international students)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be planning to apply for admission to a full-time master’s or professional degree at McGill University. The scholarship is open to students and graduates of universities in Canada and the United States, as well as Canadians abroad. It is now open to people from around the world. Applicants must be seniors, alumni under age 30, or students who earned a first bachelor’s degree in the last five years (January 2020 or later). There is also a mention of those who earned their first bachelor's degree more than five years ago, implying another path.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s or professional degree studies, second-entry professional undergraduate program. Includes 150+ programs, including MBA and Master of Management.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not intended for PhD programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 3.0 out of a possible 4.0, or a Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.2 out of 4.0 in the last two years of full-time study. Some programs may require a 3.3 CGPA or a higher GPA.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (first bachelor’s degree)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Leadership-based scholarship program, significant leadership experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL: IBT (Internet-Based Test): 86 overall, no less than 20 in each of the four components. IELTS: A band score of 6.5 or greater.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference forms completed before the application deadline: One academic reference from someone who knows your academic work well; One community work reference.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under age 30 (for alumni).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Current students and recent alumni (those who have graduated within the past two years) seek campus nomination. UNC alumni who graduated more than 2 years ago do not need institutional endorsement and should submit an application directly.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants need to apply separately to eligible programs at McGill University.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Application Form, Two letters of recommendation (one academic, one community work), Four short essays, Unofficial transcripts, Personal statement, Short essays reflecting on your community and goals, a significant leadership experience.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: After a careful evaluation of submitted applications, regional interviews are conducted.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Canada's first comprehensive, leadership-driven scholarships for master’s and professional degree studies. It is Canada's largest leadership-based scholarship program. It provides students with mentorship, interdisciplinary learning, and a global community to accelerate their impact on the world.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026 cohort are generally closed. Applications for the 2026 McCall MacBain International Fellowships open October 15, 2025, with a deadline of January 13, 2026. Applications for Summer / Fall 2027 admission will open on June 1, 2026.

basic_info.official_name: The Graduate Scholarship Programme for ASEAN or Non -ASEAN Countries

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Covers tuition fees, a monthly stipend, living and housing expenses, return flights, and health insurance.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from ASEAN and non-ASEAN countries (excluding Thai nationals). Applicants must have an excellent academic record and fulfill academic requirements. Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Subjects / All disciplines

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's and Doctoral degrees

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Strong command of English demonstrated by a certificate of English proficiency from prior university or results on standardized tests like TOEFL or IELTS.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries, who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester, are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be screened and recruited by the Faculty/Programme of their choice before their names are forwarded to the Office of Academic Affairs, Chulalongkorn University.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form and relevant documents (specific list not provided).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must be screened and recruited by the Faculty/Programme of their choice before their names are forwarded to the Office of Academic Affairs, Chulalongkorn University.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chulalongkorn University, Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious institution, offers this Graduate Scholarship Program for international Master’s and Doctoral students from ASEAN and non-ASEAN countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship duration: 2 years for Master's, 3 years for PhD. The term of the scholarships cannot be extended.

basic_info.official_name: University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships
basic_info.provider: Faculty of Science, University of Geneva

funding_info.funding_details: The Excellence Fellowship consists of a grant amounting to CHF 10'000 to CHF 15’000/year (no teaching duties); it is awarded for one year and extended for the regular duration of the chosen Master's program (three or four semesters) provided the applicant is academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several Excellence Fellowships are awarded annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding and highly motivated international students who wish to pursue a Master of Science degree in one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty. Students who have already started a Master programme at the Faculty of Science can no longer apply for the Excellence Master Fellowship. Open to all nationals.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master of Science degree in one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty (e.g., Earth Sciences, Cs. Físicas y Matemáticas, Biochemistry). A complete list of Master programs is available on the Faculty of Science website.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only for Master of Science programs within the Faculty of Science. Not open to students who have already started a Master programme at the Faculty of Science.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.5 or equivalent (some sources mention minimum 3.0 GPA).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Optional but a nice bonus to provide GRE, TOEFL, or other language test scores. For general UNIGE requirements (from a specific faculty page), accepted tests include Cambridge English Advanced (CAE): 180–199, Cambridge English First (FCE): 180–190, C1 Business Higher, IELTS: 6.5–7.5, TOEFL iBT: 95–120, TOEIC Listening &.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letters of Reference are preferred to be sent directly to the institution by emailing them to Excellence-Master-Sciences@unige.ch.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A motivation letter or a two-page essay describing specific scientific interests, specifying the Master's program at the Faculty of Science to pursue, and motivating the intention to pursue a Master of Science programme at the University of Geneva.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Motivation letter/two-page essay, Letters of Reference. Applications should be sent as a UNIQUE pdf file by e-mail to the Dean of the Faculty of Science: Excellence-Master-Sciences@unige.ch.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships program was established by the Faculty of Science, with the support of external partners, to encourage outstanding and highly motivated international students to pursue a Master of Science degree in one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Awarded for one year and extended for the regular duration of the chosen Master's program (three or four semesters) provided the applicant is academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies.

basic_info.official_name: The Aga Khan Foundation’s International Scholarship Programme
basic_info.study_country: Canada, USA, France, or Portugal. Open for study in any highly reputable university except universities in UK, Germany, Sweden, Austria, Denmark, Netherlands, Italy, Norway, and Ireland.

funding_info.funding_details: Awards are structured as half grant and half loan, where 50 percent of the award amount needs to be repaid. Some sources state the loan is interest-free, while others mention an interest rate based on prevailing market conditions, potentially with a 0.25% discount for automatic recurring payments.

timeline_info.application_deadline: March 31, 2025 (general deadline, with internal deadlines potentially earlier in some countries). One source mentions June 8, 2025.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2025/2026 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number of scholarships each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding scholars from selected developing countries who have no other means of financing their studies. Eligible nationals include Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Egypt, India, Kenya, Kyrgyz Republic, Madagascar, Mozambique, Pakistan, Syria, Tajikistan, Tanzania, or Uganda. Applicants must be residing in one of the countries where there are local AKF, AKES, or AKEB offices that process applications and interview candidates.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate studies (Master's and PhD degrees).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not open for study at universities in UK, Germany, Sweden, Austria, Denmark, Netherlands, Italy, Norway, and Ireland.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Generally a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Some sources mention a minimum required GPA of 2.7/4.0 or 3.0/4.0.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Implied for PhD applicants, who need to be highly recommended by their professors.
additional_requirements.career_plan: To develop effective scholars and leaders and to prepare them for employment, primarily within the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN). PhD applicants need a PhD for the fulfillment of their career objectives (academic or research oriented).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Preference is given to students under 30 years of age. However, some sources state there are no age limits to apply.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must have no other means of financing their studies and demonstrate ongoing financial need.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must demonstrate good academic standing. For PhD students, scholarships are awarded for the first two years, after which funding from alternative sources is expected. Master's scholarships are for the entire duration of the degree.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive application process, includes interviews. Successful candidates are notified of their selection.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scholarships for Master’s studies are granted for the entire duration of the degree course. For PhD students, scholarships are awarded for the first two years, after which applicants are expected to find funding from alternative sources. To maintain the award, good academic standing and ongoing financial need must be demonstrated.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Awards are made once a year in June or July.

basic_info.provider: Asian Development Bank (ADB) with financing from the Government of Japan
basic_info.study_country: Asia and the Pacific (including Japan, University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa, Thailand) at 25 selected educational institutions across Asia and the Pacific, including 15 in Japan, and institutions in 9 countries within the Asia-Pacific region. Specific institutions mentioned include University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa (UHM), East-West Center (EWC), University of Tokyo, KAIST, National Graduate Institute for Policy Studies (GRIPS), Keio University, Nagoya University, Institute of Science Tokyo, Kyushu University, AIT.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covers full tuition fees, subsistence (including housing allowance), book allowance, medical insurance, travel, and research subsidies.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 135-140 graduate scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Nationals of an ADB borrowing member country (applicants from countries that are no longer borrowing from ADB are not eligible); Citizen of a Japanese Official Development Assistance scholarship eligible country; Must agree to return to and work in home country for at least 2 years after completion of studies to contribute to its development; Not eligible to work at ADB for two years after completion of academic programs; Not eligible if living or working in a country other than home country; Executive directors, alternate directors, management and staff of ADB, consultants, and close relatives are not eligible; Staff of ADB–JSP partner institutions are not eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Economics, business and management, science and technology, and other development-related fields; ADB-JSP approved fields of study.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only programs at participating academic institutions in the Asian and Pacific Regions are eligible for ADB–JSP funding.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No GPA requirement
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree study; Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) earned at least three years before the application deadline.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of full-time professional working experience (acquired after a university degree) at the time of application.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time professional working experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS (no minimum score); English proficiency test score report required.

additional_requirements.career_plan: One-page research proposal (institution-specific requirement for some universities).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Must not exceed 35 years old at the time of application.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants from countries that are no longer borrowing from ADB are not eligible; Applicants living or working in a country other than their home country are not eligible.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No separate application to ADB is required—applications go directly through the academic institution; Must first find an academic supervisor (for Institute of Science Tokyo); Separate application to the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa for admission is required in addition to the ADB-JSP application to East-West Center.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: ADB-JSP Application Form; Certified Copy of Bachelor’s Degree Official Academic Transcripts (signed and sealed by the university); Applicant’s Certificate of Employment and Compensation/Income (with specific details and signatory requirements); ADB-JSP Information Sheet; Income Certificate; One-page research proposal; English proficiency test score report.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Academic institution screens and ranks applicants and submits recommendations to ADB. First screening results released shortly after 10 December 2025; Interview Period: November–December 2025; Initial Result Announcement: Mid- (unspecified month); Result Announcement: Late February 2026 (Scholarship); Final ADB-JSP selection results announced May 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in April 1988 with financing from the Government of Japan to encourage and strengthen human resource development. Offers opportunity for well-qualified citizens of ADB's developing member countries to undertake graduate studies. Maximum duration of the scholarship award is two (2) years for master's program. Enrolls about 250-300 students annually across academic institutions in 9 countries within the Asia-Pacific region.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2026–2027 opened on 1 November 2025. Application for fall 2026 will be updated in July 2026. Specific deadlines include: 17:00 JST, 30th June 2025 (University of Tokyo); 31 March 2025 (AIT); 19 December 2025 (Kyushu University); November 30, 2025 (general/specific institution); 10 December (general). First screening results released shortly after 10 December 2025. Interview Period: November–December 2025. Result Announcement: Late February 2026 (Scholarship). Final ADB-JSP selection results announced May 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Comprehensive scholarships that cover educational expenses and may provide an opportunity for graduate students to earn a monthly stipend. Covers all study expenses for international students.
covered_expenses: Monthly living stipend (reported as 40,000 AED ($10,890) by one source, 20,000 AED by another, and 8,000 AED for Master / 10,000 AED for PhD for the GRTA Scholarship)
Medical insurance coverage for full-time international students sponsored by Khalifa University

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 8, 2025, to April 14, 2025, at 11:59 PM (UAE time). Another source indicates May 10, 2025.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all qualified international students enrolled in graduate programs on a full-time basis. Open to UAE and World Students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All majors of general graduate schools. No academic field restriction, including business, IT, Arts, and Engineering. Specific fields mentioned for GRTA Scholarship: Chemical Engineering; Computing.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No academic field restriction for the general graduate scholarship.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Maintain GPA about a 3.2 (for scholarship duration)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's, PhD Degrees, Pre-Medicine and Doctor of Medicine Programs (Postgraduate programs)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters (Recommendation Letter (two))
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must maintain GPA about a 3.2 for the scholarship to last the whole duration of study.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: All required documents, supporting materials in the correct format, two reference letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Submit online application, upload documents, wait for initial review, Admission Interview.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship lasts for the whole duration of your study provided you maintain your GPA about a 3.2.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year 2025-2026

basic_info.provider: King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Covers all expenses. Includes full free tuition support, annual living allowance up to $30,000, on-campus housing, a 75K USD annual stipend, and an independent annual research project budget.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to people of all nationalities.
