funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded master's scholarship for international students and professionals. The program aims to empower professionals committed to returning to their home countries to drive economic and social development.
covered_expenses: Economy class air travel (round-trip from home city to study country)
Scholarship covers the duration of the graduate program or two years, whichever is less

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 29, 2024 (Application Window #1); May 24, 2024 (Application Window #2). Note: University-specific academic and scholarship nomination deadlines vary, e.g., March 1, 2025 (ISS academic), May 15, 2025 (ISS scholarship for nominated students), February 28, 2025 (IHS academic), March 7, 2025 (IHE Delft academic), November 1, 2024 (Columbia University). Applications for YNU PPT under Window 2 are between late March and late May 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 130 awards (annual, based on one source); over 7,000 scholarships awarded historically.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must: Be a national of an eligible developing country (World Bank member developing country); Not hold dual citizenship of a developed country; Hold a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) earned at least 3 years prior to the application deadline date; Have 3 years or more of paid professional experience in a development-related area after earning a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent), acquired within the past six years from the date of the Application Deadline; Be accepted unconditionally to enroll in the upcoming academic year in one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs by the application deadline date; Not be a World Bank Group staff member (which includes consultants) or relative of a WBG staff member. Professionals with relevant experience seeking a master’s degree in the development field, with a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts. Japanese mid-career professionals dedicated to the alleviation of poverty and enhanced shared prosperity in developing countries, currently enrolled in a master’s or PhD graduate degree program outside of Japan and in development-related fields, are also eligible. Applicants should have outstanding academic records and proficiency in English. Preference is given to applicants working in government agencies, research institutions, or international development organizations.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Development-related fields, including: Global Sustainability Policy and Management, Global Health Policy and Management, Public Policy, Master of Public Health, Economic Policy, Finance and Development (EPFD stream), Public Management and International Relations (PMIR stream), Economic and Public Policy, Urban Management and Development, Development Studies, Water and Sustainable Development (Water, Food and Energy Track; Water and Health Track; Water Resources and Ecosystem Health Track), Infrastructure Management Program (IMP), Public Policy and Taxation, MPA in Economic Policy Management, MPA in Global Leadership. Key areas of sustainable development such as economic policy management, tax policy, infrastructure management, and public planning. Training future leaders in economics, health, education, environment, and infrastructure.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants can only apply for one master’s programme when applying for the JJ/WBGSP scholarship.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) earned at least 3 years prior to application deadline date. For Japanese nationals, enrollment in a Master’s or PhD graduate degree program outside of Japan is mentioned.

experience_requirements.min_years: 3 years or more of paid professional experience (after earning a bachelor’s degree), acquired within the past six years from the date of the Application Deadline.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Paid professional experience in a development-related area/work. Preference is given to applicants working in government agencies, research institutions, or international development organizations.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English is a fundamental requirement.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two professional references / two strong professional letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A compelling Statement of Purpose (SOP) clearly articulating how the scholarship will enable the applicant to uplift their community or country.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Japanese mid-career professionals dedicated to the alleviation of poverty and enhanced shared prosperity in developing countries, currently enrolled in a master’s or PhD graduate degree program outside of Japan and in development-related fields.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Unconditional admission to one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs is required by the scholarship application deadline. Applicants must have outstanding academic records.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: JJ/WBGSP scholarship online application form, two professional references, unconditional offer from the program they intend to study, official academic transcripts, updated CV, compelling Statement of Purpose (SOP). An IHE Delft application form for nomination for a JJWBGSP scholarship is also mentioned.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must first be accepted into their preferred academic program. Universities (e.g., ISS, IHS, IHE Delft, IPADS) pre-screen applicants based on submitted information and JJ/WBGSP eligibility criteria. Shortlisted applicants are then invited or provided instructions by the university admissions office to complete and submit the JJ/WBGSP scholarship online application form to the World Bank. The JJ/WBGSP uses specific processes to review eligible scholarship applications. Final notification is provided after review.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program (JJ/WBGSP) offers scholarships to professionals with relevant experience seeking a master’s degree in the development field. It enables mid-career professionals from 160 developing countries and Japan to complete graduate degrees in development-related fields at leading universities across the world. The program aims to empower professionals committed to returning to their home countries to apply their knowledge to drive economic and social development, training future leaders in economics, health, education, environment, and infrastructure. Scholars gain access to global policymakers, experts, and development programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The JJ/WBGSP typically operates with two application windows annually. For 2024, Window #1 was from January 15 to February 29, and Window #2 from March 25 to May 24. Some participating programs have their own academic admission deadlines that precede the scholarship application windows, and may nominate students for the scholarship in specific windows (e.g., IPADS MSc applicants must apply in Window #2; YNU PPT applicants in Window 2 between late March and late May 2026).

Scholarships are offered in any of three categories, including to students who have demonstrated commitment to careers related to the environment. Eligibility may vary by status and country; applicants should check the official website for specific requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subject areas/disciplines.
field_restrictions.restrictions: For international applicants (non-German educated), an application for a scholarship for an undergraduate degree is not possible. Only German students or international students who have completed their secondary education in Germany (so-called Bildungsinländer) can apply for funding for a Bachelor's degree programme. Not supported are second degree courses, study visits outside Germany, or final degree phases.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Very good school or college/university academic record.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For international students (non-German educated): Master’s Degree or PhD Degree. For German/Bildungsinländer students: Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD Degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Written proof of German language proficiency is necessary (Minimum requirement: „Deutsche Sprachprüfung für den Hochschulzugang“ Level DSH 2 or „TestDaF“ Level B2). International applicants have to prove their proficiency in German.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Requires a personal reference on your social commitment and an expert reference from a university lecturer or, in the case of school leavers, a schoolteacher.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Social commitment and political interest. Convincing reasons for applying to the Heinrich Böll Foundation. Active interest in the basic values of the foundation: ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination and justice.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Written application documents, including a personal reference and an expert reference. Info Sheet A1-1b (PDF), Application Form A1-2 (in German, PDF), Info Sheet A2-1b (PDF), Application Form A2-2 (in German, PDF).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Consists of three stages: 1. Submission of written application documents (assessed based on very good academic record, social commitment/political interest, convincing reasons for applying). 2. Interview with a liaison lecturer (a report by the liaison lecturer is added to the application).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Supports university and PhD students. The foundation has regional offices in Germany's 16 states and operates 32 international offices. The Heinrich Böll Foundation also has a research archive with a focus on new social movements, Green politics, and a special section for political activist Petra Kelly.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026/2027 academic year.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic merit, and eligibility is determined by the merit achieved in the qualification.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded (for some Masters and PhD scholarships); Up to $60,000 (Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships); $5,000 to $10,000 (International Scholarship); 20% tuition fee waiver (Sydney International Student Award); $41,753 per year (University of Sydney International Scholarship)

timeline_info.application_deadline: No fixed deadline. Applications are open year-round and aligned with the University of Sydney admissions timeline. (Note: Research Training Program (RTP) scholarships have a deadline of Nov 7, 2025)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 20 (for some undergraduate scholarships); 50 (Sydney International Student Award); Multiple (University of Sydney International Scholarship)

Some scholarships are for commencing international students enrolled in an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework full degree. Some are for outstanding commencing and enrolled higher-degree by research (HDR) students (both domestic and international for RTP). Students from all countries are eligible.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Masters and PhD (for some fully funded scholarships); Undergraduate or postgraduate coursework full degree; Higher-degree by research (HDR); Completed grade twelve/Year 12 or equivalent qualification (for undergraduate admission); Completed a degree at the University of Sydney (for some international scholarships)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Enrolled in Experience in Industry BWIL2150 or BWIL6150 (for Experience in Industry Scholarship)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS 6.5 required; TOEFL or other required scores. English language proficiency can also be met by: at least one year of full-time tertiary study in an English-speaking country within 5 years; a three-year undergraduate degree in English within 5 years; or a two-year postgraduate degree in English within 3 years.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Awarded on the basis of academic merit; for exceptional/high-achieving/outstanding students; must hold an Unconditional offer for a course (for some scholarships).

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic merit as assessed from a student’s application for admission to an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree.

covered_expenses: living costs (up to 649 euros per month depending on income)

It supports graduate study at the University of Hawai‘i (UH) in fields relevant to the goals and objectives of the East-West Center (EWC), while participating in educational and cultural activities.

Examples of eligible countries include Anguilla, Bangladesh, Barbados, Cayman Islands, Djibouti, Egypt, Jamaica, St Helena, Sierra Leone, South Africa.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Supports Master's degree studies.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is a fully funded program. Recipients receive financial support to cover living expenses and study costs. It provides a monthly living stipend, health insurance support, and covers study costs. Universities in Germany usually have no tuition fees. The scholarship offers a monthly base amount of 934 EUR (approximately €934 for international students), with a specific mention of EUR 750 for Bachelor's, Diploma, Magister, or State degrees.

timeline_info.application_deadline: For Masters degree scholarships for international students: 30 November for the Winter semester and 31 May for the Summer semester. A specific deadline of 10 Dec, 2025 is mentioned for 'Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarship For International Students 2025'. The deadline to apply for the Friedrich Ebert Stiftung Scholarship 2025 varies.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for the Friedrich Ebert Stiftung Scholarship are currently open, including for the 2025/2026 Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarships.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 40 scholarships are awarded to students from Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe admitted to German universities.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be Germans, foreign students, or refugees. The scholarship supports students at almost every level of higher education in Germany, including Bachelor's Degree / Diploma / State Examination, Master’s, or PhD degrees. Applicants are typically from countries in the Global South (Asia, Africa, Latin America), post-Soviet states, as well as eastern and south-eastern European (EU) countries. Key selection criteria include academic achievement, social and political involvement, and personal attitudes. Applicants must be students from public or state-approved universities and from polytechnical colleges. Foreign applicants must already be studying or doing their postgraduate studies in Germany at the time of application, or be already enrolled in a German university or have a supervisor for their doctoral studies. They should be able to submit proof of their initial academic achievements/marks (with the exception of those enrolled in Master or other postgraduate programmes). German language proficiency is crucial, even if the study program itself is carried out in English, due to an extensive social and political side program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines, including artistic degrees.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: There is no universal GPA requirement to be awarded a scholarship in Germany.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degrees.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Social and political involvement is a key selection criterion. The scholarship also provides practical work experience, implying it's not necessarily a prerequisite for application.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: German language proficiency is crucial.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reports from high school teachers or vocational school teachers (for first-year students); Reports from university professors (for basic funding, not first-year students or nationals/foreigners after the 1st semester).
additional_requirements.career_plan: A motivation letter highlighting academic goals, career plans, and social engagement is required. Applicants should also write an essay outlining their academic and career goals and reasons for choosing the specific program.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No fixed age cap applies; the scholarship foundation states that anyone may apply and decisions are made based on other criteria. (Note: One source mentioned 'under the age of 32 for Master's students or under the age of 35 for PhD students' as additional information, but the foundation's statement takes precedence).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Refugees are explicitly mentioned as eligible applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal attitudes and social engagement play an important part in the selection process.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Sample application form (for basic funding for Germans, foreign students, and refugees; for doctoral funding for Germans, foreign students, and refugees); Information sheet for applications; Reports from high school teachers or vocational school teachers; Reports from university professors; Completed online application form; Curriculum Vitae (CV); Motivation letter; Essay; Proof of initial academic achievements/marks (for foreign students, except Master's/postgraduate programs).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The selection process considers applicants' academic achievement, social and political involvement, and personal attitudes.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The promotion of young talent has been one of the founding principles of the FES. The scholarship provides a comprehensive seminar program that develops leadership skills, social engagement, and academic competence.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers tuition, living expenses, travel, health insurance, room and board, and other fees. For undergraduate and doctoral programs, 60% of academic costs are covered, while for Master's scholarships, 75% of academic costs are covered.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 12 March 2025 (for postgraduate and institutional scholarships); 20 February 2025 (for ECV program); 3 April 2025 (for all other modalities)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 735 (227 postgraduate/Master's, 255 institutional studies, others for doctorate, faculty, mobility)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Students from Latin America or the Ibero-American Community of Nations (excluding Spain). This includes graduates, researchers, and musicians. Applicants must be non-Spanish residents.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Energy and environmental courses, music, all research fields related to the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, Tropical Parasitic Diseases, human rights.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's (postgraduate), PhD (doctoral), Post-doc, faculty, institutional studies, continuing education, specialization.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Specific requirements depend on the program of study and university.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship aims to improve higher education in Iberoamerican countries, encourage internationalization in Spanish universities, and contribute to inclusive, equitable, quality education. It seeks to promote lifelong learning, reinforce music training, and support human rights, peace, responsible citizenship, gender equality, and sustainable development. The 'SDG Scholarships that change lives' call focuses on generating impact and social value, responding to digital, environmental, and social transitions, and reinforcing Spanish cooperation with training, gender equality, and social equality. A new program for 2025-2026 is committed to supporting and defending human rights and training human rights promoters and defenders in Latin America.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 2025-2026 academic year

funding_info.funding_details: Provides for one year of tuition and expenses for postgraduate study and research in the natural sciences, engineering, or mathematics at Churchill College, Cambridge. It supports MPhil (Master of Philosophy) or MASt (Master of Advanced Study) programs. Kanders Churchill Scholars pursue a Master’s in Public Policy.

timeline_info.application_deadline: National Application Deadline: November 3, 2025 (or early November)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 18 scholarships per year (16 Churchill Scholarships in science, mathematics, and engineering; 2 Kanders Churchill Scholarships)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be a citizen of the United States (native-born or naturalized), enrolled in or graduated within the past 12 months from one of the Participating Institutions, and receive an endorsement from an approved U.S. undergraduate institution. Applicants must apply to graduate programs at Cambridge University that are approved for Churchill Scholarship support, specifically at Churchill College as their first choice. They must also apply separately to the University of Cambridge.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Natural sciences, engineering, or mathematics. Kanders Churchill Scholars pursue a Master’s in Public Policy.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarship is only tenable at Churchill College, Cambridge. Programs must be MPhil (Master of Philosophy) or MASt (Master of Advanced Study).

academic_requirements.required_degree: bachelor’s degree

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Extensive laboratory experience, internships, or other related work (especially for science and engineering applicants)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Four Academic Letters of Recommendation, submitted directly through the Churchill Scholarship application portal.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A copy of correspondence (email is acceptable) with a faculty mentor or laboratory supervisor at Cambridge indicating a willingness to accept the applicant into their research environment, pending a successful application. Applicants must also submit a list of Scholarships, Prizes, Awards, and Other Distinctions (limit 800 words).

application_documents: Correspondence with Cambridge faculty mentor/laboratory supervisor
List of Scholarships, Prizes, Awards, and Other Distinctions (limit 800 words)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants require endorsement from an approved U.S. undergraduate institution. Applications from nominated individuals are reviewed by a screening committee composed of previous Churchill Scholars (mainly academic scientists). Shortlisted candidates undergo phone interviews in December/January.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Churchill Scholarship funds one year of postgraduate study at Churchill College, Cambridge, for an MPhil or MASt degree, offering an an opportunity to experience life in Britain and forge friendships with British and international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Campus nomination deadlines vary (e.g., September 15, 2025 for Georgetown; October 3, 2025 for Brown; September 21, 2025 for UMich). National application deadline is November 3, 2025 (or early November). Applicants must apply separately to the University of Cambridge by mid-October. Phone interviews for shortlisted candidates occur in December/January.

funding_info.funding_details: The Rhodes Scholarship is a fully-funded postgraduate award. The total value averages about $75,000 per year and can reach up to $250,000 for scholars who remain at Oxford for four years in certain departments.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Global Scholarships 2026: 31 July 2025 (11:59 PM, GMT). Rwanda/West Africa 2026: 28 August 2025. U.S. application deadlines are decentralized and vary by campus/year.
timeline_info.opening_date: Spring 2025 for 2026 entry. June 2026 for 2027 entry.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 32 U.S. Scholars annually. Over 100 scholarship recipients from more than 70 countries globally (selected from 64 countries).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The scholarship is for talented young people from around the world who are committed to being of service, impatient with the way things are, and have the courage to act. Candidates should have outstanding records in academics, leadership, and community service, with sustained and energetic participation. Applicants should have a desire to study at the University of Oxford and a clear sense of what the University would gain from their presence. U.S. applicants must be a U.S. citizen or a lawful permanent resident of the United States continuously for the five years prior to the application deadline. Candidates must have satisfactorily completed two years of full-time undergraduate study and received a bachelor’s degree, or will have in the year following the Rhodes Scholarship application.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Most full-time postgraduate courses in almost any field offered by Oxford University, including graduate degrees across the breadth of the social sciences, humanities, and biological and physical sciences.
field_restrictions.restrictions: A few exceptions (not specified).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.7, but successful applicants for U-M institutional endorsement typically have a 3.8 or higher GPA.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate award, requiring a bachelor's degree or completion in the year following application.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language proficiency test results (IELTS Academic or TOEFL IBT) are required. Applicants must meet the University of Oxford's English language proficiency requirements at the higher level by the application deadline.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: A total of at least five, but not more than eight, referees are required. At least four (or three for some constituencies) must be from individuals with whom the applicant has done college-level academic work.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants must detail their motivations, study plans, career plans/future ambitions, and reasons for choosing these, demonstrating a strong commitment to their goals and clarity on how Oxford and the Rhodes Scholarship will help achieve them. A clear statement of what the applicant wishes to study at Oxford and why is crucial.
additional_requirements.age_limits: U.S. applicants must be 19-27 years old as of the application deadline.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants with a strong connection to two or more Rhodes constituencies but who do not meet their nationality or citizenship criteria may be able to apply via Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration rather than the Global Scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should have a clear sense of what the University of Oxford would gain from their presence. It is highly recommended for candidates to get in touch with degree programs or faculty within the proposed program of study at the University of Oxford to demonstrate commitment.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Contact information, evidence of eligibility, education history including university transcripts, proposed course(s) of study at Oxford, CV/resumé, Academic Statement, Personal Statement/essay, minimum 4-5 to 8 referees, certified English copy of high school marks/graduation certificate, English Language proficiency test results, photograph (not visible to selectors until after short-listing).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The process often involves campus endorsement (e.g., requiring advising appointments and pre-applications). U.S. Scholars are elected by 16 independent committees around the country meeting simultaneously.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Rhodes Scholarship is a life-changing, fully-funded postgraduate award enabling talented young people from around the world to study full-time at the University of Oxford for two or more years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Rhodes Scholars typically begin their studies at the University of Oxford in October.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professionals from eligible countries.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language test scores are not required for initial application, but shortlisted candidates must provide them. English language training is not supported for prospective PhD candidates.

basic_info.provider: French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Eiffel scholarship recipients receive a monthly allowance of €2,100 in addition to certain direct services. Master level Eiffel scholarship recipients for 2025 received a monthly allowance of €1,181.
covered_expenses: Registration fees (in case of engineering degree)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 433 France Excellence Eiffel scholarships awarded for the 2025 academic year (370 at master's level and 63 at doctoral level)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to top international students from all nationalities (except France). Candidates must be foreign nationals with no French citizenship. Applicants should not be currently studying in France for Master's level. Should not benefit from another French government scholarship. Only candidates applying for the first time at the Master's or PhD level and from one educational institution are eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science and technology (Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital sciences, Engineering); Humanities and social sciences (Law and political science, Economics and management, French history, language and civilization)

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree programs (or equivalent accredited by the French government) and PhD programs. For PhD, research stays for 12, 18 or 36 months in France. The 36-month scholarship is conditional on enrolment in the 1st year of PhD and for newcomers students only, and cannot be used to sign a cotutelle agreement.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of language proficiency matching the program's requirements (C1 level for Master's applications; applications with B2 level may be considered on a case-by-case basis).

additional_requirements.age_limits: Master's applicants: no more than 29 years old on the date of the selection committee (born after March 31, 1996, according to TSM; born after March 31, 1998, according to Paris-Saclay, or 27 years or younger according to scholarships.af). PhD applicants: born after March 31, 1993 (according to Paris-Saclay, implies 32 years old).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be top international students demonstrating educational excellence. Required documents include diplomas and ranking, and any other document certifying the applicant's level of excellence or performance. Certificate of enrolment for the current academic year 2025-2026 (if currently a student). For PhD, a reasoned opinion on the scientific quality of the thesis subject drafted by an expert (university professor/research supervisor) of the research domain concerned (not from the University of Rennes) as well as this expert's CV.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Copy of the last diploma(s) obtained with ranking, documents certifying applicant's level of excellence/performance, certificate of enrolment for current academic year (if student), proof of language proficiency (C1/B2 for Master's). For PhD: reasoned opinion on scientific quality of thesis subject by an expert (university professor/research supervisor) and expert's CV.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The scholarship program is exclusively for French higher education institutions to attract international students. Applications are submitted by French higher education institutions on behalf of the student. Students must contact the French institution of their choice and apply for admission first. After institutional admission, students may submit their application for the Eiffel Scholarship through the institution (e.g., on Full Fabric for GEM). Complete applications are submitted online via the dedicated Campus France platform by the nominating institution. Final results are announced by Campus France (e.g., from March 30, 2026, for pre-selected students by Université Paris Cité).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eiffel Excellence Scholarship Program is France’s flagship initiative established by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs. It aims to attract outstanding international students to pursue Master’s and PhD studies in French higher education institutions, fostering long-term collaboration between France and global academic, industrial, and diplomatic communities. It is considered one of the most prestigious opportunities for international students aspiring to pursue postgraduate studies in France, empowering students to build meaningful academic and professional futures while contributing to shared global progress.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The call for applications for the 2026-2027 academic year opened in November 2025. The overall application deadline is January 8, 2026. Institutional nomination deadlines may be earlier (e.g., Grenoble EM: November 20, 2025). Final results are announced by Campus France from March 30, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: fully-funded

timeline_info.application_deadline: Applications for 2026-2027 Chevening Scholarships are now closed. Applications for 2026/2027 Chevening Türkiye awards will close on 7 October 2025 at 12:00 UTC/ GMT (midday UK time).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: around 1400+ Chevening Scholars annually funded by the UK’s FCDO across the UK

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding emerging leaders from over 160 countries and territories worldwide. Applicants must have completed an undergraduate degree that enables entry onto a postgraduate programme at a UK university. Applicants can apply if they already have a master's degree. Must apply to three eligible UK university courses and receive an unconditional offer from at least one by the deadline for references and educational documents. Not eligible if an employee, former employee, or relative of an employee of His Majesty’s Government, British Council, a sponsoring UK university, or a staff member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities within the last two years from the opening of Chevening applications. Eligibility varies by country, and applicants are encouraged to use the Chevening eligibility quiz.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Subjects in almost any field; any full-time, one-year taught master’s program at any accredited university in the UK.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Limited to one-year master’s degrees. Chevening Fellowships have separate eligibility criteria.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree that enables entry onto a postgraduate programme at a UK university. Applicants can apply if they already have a master's degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of two years' work experience (equivalent to 2800 hours).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time paid fellowship experience qualifies. Other eligible types exist but are not specified in the provided content.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English is required, but specific tests or scores are not detailed.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References are required by a specified deadline, but the number or specific type is not detailed.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Includes Standard Chevening Scholarships, Chevening SIDS Scholarships, Chevening ASEAN Scholarships, and Chevening Partner Awards.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholars are required to return to their country of origin for two years after completing their studies and are ineligible to apply for a Graduate visa or other visa categories that would allow them to remain in the UK. Applicants must apply to three eligible UK university courses. Secure at least one unconditional offer from one of the three chosen UK university courses by the deadline for references and educational documents. It is not a requirement to apply to your course choices before submitting your Chevening application, but it is recommended to apply for chosen courses before or at the same time as applying for Chevening.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: References, educational documents, personal data, essays, course choices, and work experience details are part of the application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A competitive and challenging process. Successful applicants for 2026-2027 will be announced in June 2026. The scholarship receives a record-breaking number of applications (e.g., 108,959 applications in one year).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The UK Government's prestigious international scholarships programme, funded by the FCDO, enabling outstanding emerging leaders from all over the world to pursue one-year master’s degrees in the UK. It has over 40 years of history aimed at developing global leaders and allows international students from over 160 countries to study a one-year master’s program at any UK university.

basic_info.study_country: Europe (multiple countries, including EU Member States and associated countries)

funding_info.funding_details: The student grant covers participation costs, a monthly allowance for living costs, and a contribution to travel and installation costs. Scholarships can cover tuition, travel insurance, and a monthly allowance of EUR 1,400, with a maximum grant of EUR 33,600. This amount is intended to cover all costs incurred by students' participation in the Master programme (accommodation, travel costs, subsistence costs).
