eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must have obtained a first level higher education degree. Open to International Students from any country, including both partner and programme countries. Must meet programme-specific requirements, which may include language proficiency, motivation letter, and previous work experience. Students must apply directly to their chosen programme. Some EMJM consortiums may accept applications from other backgrounds.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s level study programmes across various fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only for Master's level programs, not Bachelor's or PhD.

academic_requirements.required_degree: First level higher education degree (e.g., Bachelor's degree)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience (may be required by specific programs).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency certificate (specific tests not named, but required).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation letter (may be required by specific programs).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents must be uploaded, may include language proficiency certificate, motivation letter, and relevant work experience details.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are competitive. Selection processes typically occur in January-February, with eligibility checks in late February. Applicants can still apply as self-funded students after scholarship deadlines.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters are prestigious international master's programs, jointly designed and delivered by a group of higher education institutions. A new batch of selected EMJMs is added to the list each year. Each master's website provides details on courses, participating universities, entry requirements, and application steps (with and without scholarship). The Erasmus Mundus Association offers resources for applicants. Erasmus+ also provides grants to HEIs to run EMJM programs. Note: For the academic year 2026-2027, no Erasmus Mundus scholarships are available for the Euroculture Master program, but funding is being sought for 2027-2028.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application generally starts in Autumn (October-November) or as early as October 1st, with deadlines typically in January-February, or as late as March for some programs. Specific program deadlines vary, for example, December 31st for EMJMDSTEPS, December 15, 2025 for NOHA, and January 29, 2026 for EPOG. Selection processes often occur in January-February, with eligibility checks in late February.

basic_info.provider: Australian Government, Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)

funding_info.funding_details: Prestigious, transformational scholarships, fellowships and short courses offered to emerging leaders from developing countries for study, research and professional development in Australia and the region so they can return home and contribute to their nations’ development, prosperity and resilience. They aim to contribute to the development needs of Australia's partner countries in line with bilateral and regional agreements. The study and research opportunities provided develop the skills and knowledge of individuals to drive change and contribute to development in their own countries. Scholarships are offered for the minimum period necessary for the individual to complete the academic program specified by the Australian education institution, including any preparatory training.
covered_expenses: Fieldwork (for research awards and Masters by coursework which have a research component where fieldwork is compulsory) may be available for eligible research students for one return economy class airfare via the most direct route to their country of citizenship or within Australia

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students and emerging leaders from developing countries. They must meet all eligibility requirements detailed in the Australia Awards Scholarships Policy Handbook. A limited number of scholarships may be offered to public servants from specific agencies for Intake 2026. Recipients are expected to return home and contribute to their nations’ development.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study (at RMIT); priority areas of study for specific countries (e.g., Vietnam)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Priority areas of study are listed for specific countries (e.g., Vietnam), implying focus areas or restrictions for those regions.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 across university transcript or equivalent (e.g. 12 out of 20, Francophone) for Master's level. A minimum GPA of 65-85% in previous qualification is commonly required, with some top scholarships expecting even higher scores.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Relevant undergraduate degree (for Master's level applicants)

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 3 years' experience in the health sector (specific to Fiji health sector applicants)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Public servants (for a limited number of scholarships in PNG)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Masters by Research or PhD applicants should provide two academic referee reports. Masters by Coursework should provide one academic referee report. References should come from employers, senior colleagues or academics familiar with the applicant's academic, professional skills and achievements. A template is available.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants should demonstrate a comprehensive education plan related to their interests and career goals, and mention their ties and commitment to serving their nation.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Commitment to serving the nation (not planning to stay in Australia). Applicants are recommended to use the Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS) for course selection.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application forms (e.g., Preview Form_AAI_Application Form PhD and Master Intake 2026.pdf) and Application Guides (e.g., Application Guide_AAS-Intake-2026.pdf) are available.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Australia Awards are long-term awards administered by the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade. They are prestigious, transformational scholarships, fellowships and short courses offered to emerging leaders from developing countries for study, research and professional development in Australia and the region. The Australian Government has supported the education of emerging leaders for over 70 years. The Australia Awards Scholarships Policy Handbook provides essential information for managing or participating in the scholarships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026 Australia Awards Scholarships round opened on 1 February 2025 and are scheduled to close on 4 May 2025 (11:59 PM AEST). Note that applications for the 2026 intake for Australia Awards Africa are already closed, with the 2027 intake opening date to be communicated in early 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP) – ETH Zurich

funding_info.funding_details: The Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP) supports students with a scholarship, mentorship and a network of the ETH Foundation. The scholarship covers the full study and living costs during the Master’s degree course. The Excellence Scholarship/ESOP consists of a scholarship covering living and study expenses (CHF 12'000 per semester) as well as a tuition fee waiver. The full scholarship is 24’000 CHF/year.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 60 masters scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The ESOP scholarship is awarded to outstanding international and domestic students who wish to pursue a Master’s degree at ETH Zurich. Applicants must be highly talented and motivated students with excellent Master's students potential. Candidates must have a very good result in their Bachelor’s degree programme (top 10% of Bachelor’s degree programme = grade A). Candidates who are already enrolled in a Master’s program at ETH Zurich, or who already hold a Master’s degree, are not eligible for ESOP. Only ETH Bachelor students are eligible to begin the ESOP on leave. Open to students applying for a master's program at ETH Zurich.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Master's programmes offered at ETH Zurich are eligible. ESOP applies only to Master's degree programmes at ETH Zurich.
field_restrictions.restrictions: no MAS (Master of Advanced Studies)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: top 10% of Bachelor’s degree programme = grade A
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree programme

experience_requirements.min_years: at least two years' professional experience (mentioned in a Facebook group post, not an official ETH source for ESOP specifically)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: professional experience, research experience, work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Requirements: Depending on the chosen study program; applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language (usually through IELTS/TOEFL/C1/C2 etc)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters (mentioned as a topic discussed by ESOP scholars)
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Male and Female can take part. Gender is considered in the ranking.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: RIS countries citizenship is considered in the ranking.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must apply for admission to a qualifying Master’s programme at ETH Zurich and indicate their interest in ESOP during the online application process. Academic grades are considered in the ranking. Preproposal topic and follow-through are part of the application/selection process.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, copy of transcript of records. Applicants may download ETH application documents.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The final decision for awarding scholarships rests with the Rector of ETH Zurich. Scholarships are awarded to a sub-set of students based on a ranking that considers academic grades, gender, and RIS countries citizenship. An interview is part of the selection process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP) is a prestigious, highly competitive, and fully funded scholarship opportunity for international Master’s students at ETH Zurich, one of the world’s leading science and technology universities. It is designed to support highly talented and motivated students financially and academically, offering world-class education, full financial support, and a powerful academic network.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application for the ESOP scholarship is only possible during the first application window (1 - 30 November).

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation - Directorate General for Public and Cultural Diplomacy, the Ministry of University and Research, ITA – Italian Trade Agency, and Uni-Italia

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, offering full scholarship packages including subsistence allowance, fee-waiver, and dedicated student support services.
covered_expenses: exemption from the payment of enrollment and tuition fees

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 200 scholarships for international applicants each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Targeted at talented international students wishing to enroll in English-taught Master's degree programmes (Laurea Magistrale or Master universitario) at top-ranked Italian universities that are part of the program. Applicants must be from countries involved in the collaborative initiative. A pre-application process at the chosen university is required before submitting the IYT scholarship application.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Economics, Management, Engineering (including Aerospace Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Technologies), High Technology, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Architecture, Design, Business Management, Advanced Technologies.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarships are for Master's degree programmes completely taught in English. The high degree of commitment required by the IYT program does not allow participation in other international training courses offered by Universities.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (Laurea Magistrale or Master universitario) or postgraduate programs

experience_requirements.accepted_types: A full-time, three-month internship in an Italian company that is part of the Program is compulsory for scholarship winners.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Renewal requirements: To receive the scholarship for the following academic year, students must complete a minimum of 30 credits (CFUs), provide proof of regular attendance of Italian language classes, provide proof of regular attendance of academic courses, and provide the Italian company’s internship declaration/confirmation.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Invest Your Talent in Italy (IYT) Scholarship is a collaborative initiative of various countries, universities, and companies with Italy. It aims at promoting the internationalization of the Italian university system as a center of excellence by giving foreign students opportunities for a fulfilling educational path and successful future careers. The program is currently in its 10th edition for A.Y. 2025-2026.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period for A.Y. 2025-2026: January 23, 2025 – February 24, 2025. Scholarship renewal application deadline: July 20th, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded one-year master's level programme, covers all expenses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Enables early career professionals. Applicants must be a national and resident of Cambodia, Laos, or Vietnam.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Agriculture, health, education, human (humanities/social sciences implied)

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's level programme

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Early career professionals, Graduates and professionals

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Proficiency (details not specified)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must explain why they wish to be considered for a Fellowship in Ireland.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Supporting documents as outlined in the Applicant Guidance Note (Documentation required)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Ireland Fellows Programme enables early career professionals to undertake a fully funded one-year master's level programme at a higher education institution (HEI) in Ireland for the academic year 2026-2027.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic year 2026-2027

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded, full scholarship, comprehensive scholarship, all-expenses-paid scholarship.
covered_expenses: Travel to and from Beijing at the beginning and end of the academic year (international airfare)

timeline_info.application_deadline: September 10, 2025, by 3 p.m. EDT (for global applicants for the 2026-2027 academic year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 150 Scholars annually (up to 200)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aspiring global leaders with demonstrated academic achievements, professional experiences, and leadership qualities. Leadership is a primary focus and distinguishing factor for successful candidates. Applicants must plan to study in one of the Schwarzman Scholars focus areas. Must hold an undergraduate degree or first degree from an accredited college or university or its equivalent, and be on track to successfully complete all degree requirements before August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year. Candidates must be at least 18 but not yet 29 years of age as of August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year. The scholarship does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national or ethnic origin.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s program in Global Affairs, Public Policy, Economics and Business, or International Relations.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No requirements for a specific field of undergraduate study; all fields are welcome, but applicants must articulate how participating in Schwarzman Scholars will help develop their leadership potential within their field.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA required; however, the median GPA of successful applicants has been 3.8, with only a few scholarship winners under 3.7. Applicants are expected to have demonstrated excellence in their academic studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree or first degree from an accredited college or university or its equivalent, to be completed before August 1 of the Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experiences, leadership experiences.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No test scores required if applicants have graduated from an undergraduate institution where the primary language of instruction was English for at least two years of the program. This requirement is waived under these circumstances.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three (3) outstanding letters of recommendation are required. At least one letter must speak about the applicant's leadership experience. For current undergraduates: 2 letters from professors (academic abilities) and 1 letter (leadership abilities). For graduate students or young professionals: At least 1 academic letter from a professor, 1 letter (leadership abilities), and 1 additional letter (reflecting current profile, e.g., from employer, mentor, or faculty).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants must articulate how participating in Schwarzman Scholars will help develop their leadership potential within their field.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Candidates must be at least 18 but not yet 29 years of age as of August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year (i.e., 18-28 years old).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national or ethnic origin.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Detailed and reflective online application, resume highlighting leadership experiences, and essays (critical component for leadership abilities/potential, writing, and analytical skills). Applicants must list their legal name, nationality, gender, place of birth, and date of birth exactly as they appear (or will appear) on their passport.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application, current resume highlighting leadership experiences, essays, three (3) outstanding letters of recommendation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection Process: October–November 2025. Applicants will be reviewed holistically; academic excellence and demonstrated leadership skills are key criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious one-year, fully funded master’s program in global affairs at Tsinghua University in Beijing, China. Designed to build a global community of future leaders, offering an immersive learning experience dedicated to leadership development. The program is anchored in a rigorous Master of Global Affairs degree and aims to prepare future leaders to address 21st-century challenges, serving as a bridge between China and the rest of the world.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Program Start: August 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: A fully-funded postgraduate award. The total value averages about $75,000 per year and can reach up to $250,000 for scholars remaining at Oxford for four years.
covered_expenses: all expenses for two or more years of study

timeline_info.application_deadline: Global Rhodes Scholarship application deadline: July 31, 2025 (11:59 PM, GMT). U.S. Rhodes applications national deadline: October 1, 2025. Canadian Rhodes application deadline: September 23, 2025. Campus deadlines vary, e.g., June 18, 2025 (Brown), June 30, 2025 (Penn Global), July 1, 2025 (Stanford), August 1, 2025 (Penn, Cornell).
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for 2026 are now open. National applications for Rhodes will be available in June.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 32 for the U.S. annually. Over 100 scholarship recipients from more than 70 other countries globally.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to talented young people from around the world to study full-time at the University of Oxford. Candidates must have satisfactorily completed two years of full-time study and received a bachelor’s degree, or will have in the year following the Rhodes Scholarship application. Applicants are expected to demonstrate outstanding scholarly achievements (typically 3.9-4.0 GPA), strong character, commitment to others and the common good, and potential for leadership. Energy to use one's talents to the full (e.g., mastery in sports, music, debate, dance, theatre, artistic pursuits, particularly where teamwork is involved) is also a criterion. U.S. applicants must be U.S. citizens or lawful permanent residents continuously for five years prior to the application deadline; DACA students are also eligible. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration is available for those with strong connections to multiple constituencies but not meeting nationality/citizenship criteria for any single one.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Most full-time postgraduate courses in almost any field offered by Oxford University, including graduate degrees across the social sciences, humanities, and biological and physical sciences.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excludes professional degree programs such as law and medicine. Part-time courses (e.g., Software Engineering) are normally not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.7 GPA; successful applicants for institutional endorsement typically have a 3.8 or higher GPA, with many successful scholars having 3.9-4.0 GPA.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree completed or to be completed in the year following the application.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated excellence and leadership in various areas, including sustained commitment to serving others, initiative, and extracurricular interests (e.g., sports, music, debate, dance, theatre, artistic pursuits, especially where teamwork is involved). Examples include being a team captain or leading scorer.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must meet the language requirements by the Global Rhodes Scholarship application deadline of July 31, 2025.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Five to eight letters of recommendation are required, with at least four from individuals who have overseen college-level academic work.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Must be 19-27 years old as of the application deadline.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Permanent residents of the US and DACA students are eligible for the US Rhodes. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration is available for applicants with strong connections to two or more Rhodes constituencies but not meeting nationality/citizenship criteria for any single one. Global, multi-jurisdictional, and inter-jurisdictional applicants have specific application processes.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should have a desire to study at Oxford and a clear sense of what they would contribute to the University. Commitment to service, impatience with the status quo, and courage to act are valued. A university interview and endorsement letter are typically required for institutional nomination. The personal statement must be certified as wholly truthful and the applicant's own work, without assistance.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Personal Statement, Original official transcript(s) of all college work, 5-8 letters of recommendation (at least 4 academic).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Rigorous selection criteria. U.S. scholars are elected by 16 independent committees. Campus interviews for endorsement are typically held in early September. A university interview and endorsement letter are part of the process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Rhodes Scholarship is a life-changing postgraduate opportunity, considered one of the oldest and most celebrated international fellowship awards. Scholars are chosen for outstanding scholarly achievements, character, commitment to the common good, and leadership potential.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: National applications become available in June. Campus interviews for endorsement are held in the first two weeks of September. Scholars begin their studies at Oxford in October (e.g., October 2024 for 2024 scholars, Fall 2026 for 2026 scholars).

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Tempus Public Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Students from more than 90 partner countries are eligible to apply. Applicants must ensure that the programme they select is eligible under the agreement between Hungary and their home country’s sending partner. Applicants cannot apply for a program or scholarship type not available to their country through the Sending Partner. Applicants currently studying in Hungary at the same level of education they are applying for are only eligible if they are self-financed students and are recommended by their current institution. Existing Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders can apply for a new study programme for the academic year 2026/2027.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s, Master’s, Doctorate, Non-Degree or Partial Studies in a wide range of programs and fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner. Study fields are country-specific and can be checked on the SH website or in the DreamApply system.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum point of 56 on a 100-point scale required to achieve an “acceptable” or “conditionally acceptable” status.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s, Master’s, Doctorate, Non-Degree or Partial Studies

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Most studies are taught in English. For programs taught in Hungarian, language proficiency is not mandatory as the scholarship includes a preparatory Hungarian language year.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students at Risk Subprogramme is available.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship holders are required to comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements. Applicants and current students are encouraged to review the Rights and Obligations and Scholarship Agreement documents regularly. Scholarship holders must complete any remaining formalities, such as submitting a medical certificate and attending preparatory programs, if applicable. Contact email for questions: stipendiumhungaricum@tpf.hu

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Call for Applications for BA/MA/OTM and PhD programmes (PDF links provided). Online application submission through Tempus Public Foundation portal. Required documents include scanned copy of original student status certificate and translations for partial/exchange study programmes if not in program language or Hungarian. All documents not in program language or Hungarian must be translated. Medical certificate required for scholarship holders.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed jointly by the sending partner (in the applicant’s home country) and the Hungarian host institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by the Hungarian Government in 2013 to promote the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education and attract top foreign students. Currently, 30 Hungarian higher education institutions are engaged. The program is based on bilateral educational agreements. It has seen increasing popularity and record application numbers in recent years (e.g., 2020/2021 awarded 4900+ students).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: January – February 2026: Submit your completed online application and required documents through the Tempus Public Foundation portal.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity, covering tuition fees and providing a monthly stipend.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (¥143,000 for non-degree students, ¥144,000 for master's and professional-degree students, ¥145,000 for doctoral students)

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for 2026 are now OPEN (as of a Facebook post); applications are generally posted on the MEXT Scholarship website in April.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Small number of recipients selected each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international research students at Japanese universities. Open to college graduates and graduate students from countries with diplomatic relations with Japan. Exclusions include: those planning to receive other Japanese government scholarships, those unable to meet academic background conditions by the deadline, dual nationals unable to give up Japanese nationality by arrival, those planning long-term research/leave outside Japan, and those with no intention to obtain a degree. Previous grantees of certain programs (Japanese Studies Students, Japan-Korea Joint Government Scholarship, Young Leaders’ Program) or those with prior scholarship experience exceeding three years may also be ineligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any field of research. Applicants should apply for the field of study they majored in at their university.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.30 out of 3.00 (or above), as calculated using MEXT's official grade conversion chart.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Research Students: Master's, Doctorate, and Professional Degree Programs (graduate level). Applicants are typically college graduates or graduate students.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of educational or work experience (for some applicants).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Educational or work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: A Japanese language exam is required in-person for research applicants, especially if their field requires it.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A Field of Study and Research Program Plan (research proposal) is required, demonstrating experience, goals, and justification for studying in Japan.
additional_requirements.age_limits: The age limit for the Master's level scholarship is 35.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Research must be done at a Japanese university. A Japanese university in Japan recommends a student for the scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must submit required documents, including a health certificate.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Embassy of Japan websites (e.g., Netherlands, Chicago, Atlanta), Study in Japan website, foreignscholarships.mohe.gov.lk (for online application in Sri Lanka).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, required documents (specifics not fully detailed), health certificates, recommendation letters, research proposals.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One of seven types of scholarships offered by the Japanese Government (Monbukagakusho), specifically for graduate school level research.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period, eligibility, and benefits are updated annually (e.g., as of November 2024 for Kyoto University). Applications generally open in April for the following year's intake (e.g., 2026 applications open in 2025).

basic_info.provider: Asian Development Bank, Government of Japan
basic_info.study_country: Across Asia and the Pacific, including Japan. Specific institutions mentioned include University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa (UHM), University of Tsukuba, Kyoto University, University of Tokyo, National Graduate Institute, Kyushu University, Institute of Science Tokyo.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded graduate scholarships. This fully funded opportunity covers tuition, living expenses, airfare, and more. The maximum duration of the scholarship award is two (2) years for master's program.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Deadlines vary by institution. Latest mentioned: 30 December 2025 (for Faculty of Agriculture, Kyushu University). Other deadlines include 17:00 JST, 30th June 2025 (University of Tokyo); Aug.19-Sep.6, 2024 (Kyoto University for 2025 intake); 15 November 2025 (University of Tsukuba); 21 November 2025 (National Graduate Institute); 19 December 2025 (Graduate School of Law, Kyushu University).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 135 graduate scholarships a year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a citizen of an ADB borrowing member country and Japanese Official Development Assistance scholarship-eligible country; Must not hold dual citizenship of any developed country; Must agree to return and work in his/her home country for at least two (2) years after completion of studies; Executive directors, Alternate directors, management and staff of ADB, consultants, and close relatives of the aforementioned are not eligible; Staff of ADB–JSP partner institutions are not eligible; Applicants living or working in a country other than his or her home country are not eligible; Must be a certified full-time student; Must be able to maintain a minimum CGPA of 3.0 on a 5.0 scale (or 2.5 on a 4.0 scale) in every academic period; Must hold a bachelor's degree or equivalent with excellent academic record; Must not be already enrolled in graduate degree programs.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Economics, management, science and technology, business and management, and other development-related fields. Specific fields include Accounting, Business Administration/Management, Commerce, E-Business, Entrepreneurship, Economics, Finance, International Cooperation, Social Sciences, Development Studies Asia Paciﬁc Studies, Development Management, Development Studies International Business Law, International Environmental Law, Policy Studies, Political Science, Public Administration, Public Policy.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only programs at the participating academic institutions in the Asian and Pacific Regions are eligible for ADB–JSP funding. Scholarship supports ADB-JSP approved fields of study.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 on a 5.0 scale (or 2.5 on a 4.0 scale)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree or equivalent (required to apply); Scholarship supports Master's degree study.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of full-time professional working experience (acquired after a university degree)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional working experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency test score report

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants for ADB-JSP must also first find an academic supervisor (for Institute of Science Tokyo).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents mentioned along with the application for International MBA Program (for Kyoto University); Application Guide PDF file; Checklist Microsoft; ADB-JSP Information Sheet, Income Certificate, a one-page research proposal and English proficiency test score report in addition to the required IGP(C) application documents (for Institute of Science Tokyo).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The academic institution screens and ranks applicants and submits recommendations to ADB. No separate application to ADB is required—applications go directly through the academic institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Asian Development Bank–Japan Scholarship Program (ADB–JSP) was established in April 1988 with financing from the Government of Japan. It aims to provide an opportunity for well-qualified citizens of ADB's developing member countries to undertake graduate studies.

funding_info.funding_details: Knight-Hennessy Scholars receive up to three years of financial support to pursue graduate studies at Stanford. The Stanford education of Knight-Hennessy Scholars is fully funded. The program funds up to three years of graduate or professional study at Stanford University. Full funding includes tuition, stipend, and graduate program and related academic expenses. It also includes a living stipend and a travel stipend. Other funding may be available for longer programs.
covered_expenses: Graduate program and related academic expenses

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 100 per year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must pursue graduate studies at Stanford University and be accepted by their Stanford graduate program to receive the award. Applicants must apply within 6 years of receiving their undergraduate degree. An undergraduate degree is required. Graduates from every nationality, ethnicity, gender, or age can apply; there are no citizenship requirements. Applicants who have already received admission to one of Stanford's graduate programs and deferred enrollment may also apply. Priority is given to applicants who apply for programs lasting more than one year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any graduate degree program at Stanford University, including JD, MA, MBA, MD, MFA, MS, and PhD, across all seven schools.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Priority is given to applicants who apply for programs lasting more than one year.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA requirement, as long as applicants are accepted into their graduate program at Stanford.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (applicants must apply within 6 years of receiving it).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Wide array of diverse academic and professional experiences.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: If the Stanford graduate degree program requires English proficiency test results, they must be submitted to KHS. All Stanford graduate degree programs accept TOEFL. The MBA Program is the only Stanford graduate program that also accepts PTE. Minimum TOEFL score for admission consideration is 90, and minimum IELTS score is 7 for most graduate degree programs at Stanford. No minimum scores on other standardized admissions tests (GMAT, GRE, LSAT, MCAT, etc.) are specified by KHS itself, but may be required by the graduate program.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are required. Recommenders should tailor letters for each application (KHS and Stanford graduate program). Letters can be submitted after the applicant's main application, but it is recommended they are submitted 1-2 days before the deadline.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Essays help the review committee understand the applicant's career goals.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age limit.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants who have already received admission to one of Stanford's graduate programs and deferred enrollment to a future year (e.g., 2026 or later) may apply.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholars are expected to be visionary, courageous, and collaborative leaders who address complex challenges. Key qualities sought include independence of thought, purposeful leadership, and a civic mindset, with a commitment to the greater good. Applicants must be competitive candidates for their selected graduate program at Stanford. The application requires essays and a video statement.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application, transcripts, test scores (English proficiency if required by graduate program), recommendation letters, essays, video statement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: All Knight-Hennessy scholars apply and are selected for admission to both KHS and a Stanford graduate program. Finalists are selected based on the KHS application, video statement, and verification of competitiveness for admission to a Stanford graduate degree program. The KHS application evaluation processes include invitation-only components.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Knight-Hennessy Scholars (KHS) was founded in 2016 by Phil Knight (co-founder of Nike Inc.) and John Hennessy (Stanford University’s 10th president). The goal is to select and support a multicultural and multidisciplinary cohort of scholars, preparing them for leadership roles in academia, industry, government, nonprofits, and the community at large. Scholars form a multidisciplinary, multicultural community united by independence of thought, purposeful leadership, and civic mindset. Scholars represent 80 countries. The 2025 cohort included 82 scholars from 23 countries and 56 institutions. Approximately 1/3 of scholars are U.S. students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The KHS application to join the 2026 cohort is now closed. The KHS application to join the 2027 cohort will open in summer 2026. Applicants must submit separate, concurrent applications for Knight-Hennessy Scholars and their chosen Stanford graduate program. The KHS application deadline typically precedes the graduate program application deadline (e.g., KHS Oct 9, 2024, vs. graduate program Dec 1, 2024 for the 2025 cohort).

funding_info.funding_details: Prestigious fully-funded scholarship initiative. Covers tuition fee, accommodation fee, and provides a living allowance/monthly stipend. Specific stipend amounts vary (e.g., RMB 3,500 monthly for Master's at UCAS).

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by country/agency. Examples: November 30, 2025 (Ghana), February 8, 2026 (Gothenburg Consulate), February 25, 2026 (Ireland).
timeline_info.opening_date: As early as May 2025, with many announcements in October-November 2025 for the 2026/2027 academic year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens worldwide (specific country requirements may apply, e.g., US citizens, South African students, Ghanaian students). Applicants must be in good physical and mental health, with excellent subject background, professional competence, and development potential. Some country-specific programs may require applicants to sign a contract and return to their home country upon completing studies.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic disciplines; a variety of study fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 60% average for National Senior Certificate (for South African undergraduate applicants).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate (Bachelor's), Postgraduate (Master's or PhD), Non-degree Chinese language studies, General Scholar, Senior Scholar programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Valid HSK score report for Chinese-taught programs. IELTS or TOEFL score reports or other relevant language proficiency certificates for programs taught in other languages, as required by the designated university.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (required for graduate programs or senior scholar programs).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study Plan or Research Proposal (minimum 200 words for undergraduate, 800 words for Master's/PhD) in English or Chinese.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Pre-admission document (admission letter, pre-admission letter, or invitation letter from a prospect supervisor) from a Chinese university (serves as a priority for postgraduate/scholar programs). CSCA Test required for all bachelor’s degree applicants. Notarized Degree and Transcript. Foreigner Physical Examination Form. Successful applicants may be required to publish research achievements acknowledging the scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship, Degree certificates, Transcripts (notarized), Study Plan or Research Proposal, Pre-admission document from a Chinese university, HSK score report (for Chinese-taught programs), IELTS/TOEFL or other language proficiency certificates (for other language programs), Two Letters of Recommendation from professors/associate professors, Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are submitted online via the Chinese Government Scholarship Information System (CGSIS/Campus China). Pre-admission documents from target universities serve as a priority for scholarship granting. Some countries/agencies may require additional submission of documents to their local offices.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CSC) is a prestigious fully-funded scholarship administered by the China Scholarship Council (CSC) for international students to pursue higher education in China. It offers various program types, including Type A (applied through embassies/agencies) and Type B (applied through universities), and covers undergraduate, postgraduate (Master's/PhD), non-degree Chinese language, general scholar, and senior scholar programs at over 270 designated Chinese universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is for the 2026/2027 academic year. Duration varies by study program, with some programs potentially requiring additional funding from the host university if studies extend beyond the scholarship period.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship comprises a monthly allowance of 1000 euros, paid for 1 or 2 years depending on admission level (M1 or M2). The total amount is 10,000€ per year for master's students.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aimed at international students admitted to a Master’s programme offered by Université Paris-Saclay and delivered by one of the following institutions: AgroParisTech, CentraleSupélec, Ecole Normale Supérieure Paris-Saclay (ENS Paris-Saclay), INSTN-CEA, Institut d’Optique Graduate School (IOGS), Université Évry Paris-Saclay, Université Paris-Saclay (UPSaclay), Université de Versailles-Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines (UVSQ). Must be enrolled in eligible Master's programs at Université Paris-Saclay or partner institutions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Master's programmes accredited by Université Paris-Saclay
field_restrictions.restrictions: Vocational training programs are not eligible.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's programme

additional_requirements.age_limits: 30 or less
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Subject to completion of the required number of credits to go through to the following year of study. Students must first be admitted to a Master's Programme offered at Université Paris-Saclay.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic achievements
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established with the IDEX funding of the 3rd Programme Investissements d’Avenir. Université Paris-Saclay is ranked as France’s top university and is one of the leading European and world universities, covering the sectors of Science.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Awarded for 1 or 2 years, depending on admission level (M1 or M2).

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded opportunity designed to provide students with everything they need for success. It is a full comprehensive scholarship that covers 100 % of the tuition fee for the programme and helps to cover living costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 12, 2025, at 1:00 PM CET (for scholarship application)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students applying for master's programs. The scholarship can be applied for each year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programs in Innovation through Business, Engineering and Design or Forestry for Green

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's Degree Programs

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The IKEA and Södra Scholarship is a part of The Bridge initiative at Linnaeus University. It is a full comprehensive scholarship designed to provide students with everything they need for success, covering 100% of tuition fees and helping with living costs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship can be applied for each year. For the 2025 intake, the master's program application deadline is January 15, 2025. The scholarship application form opens on February 5, 2025, with a deadline of February 12, 2025, at 1:00 PM CET. The next application round will open on February 5, 2026, for studies commencing in autumn 2026.

basic_info.provider: A.S. Hornby Educational Trust and University of Exeter

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, including full tuition fees and a generous stipend of at least £15500 for accommodation and living expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 10

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must first submit a Postgraduate application to the University of Exeter for the MEd TESOL programme to receive an Exeter student number. Scholarship awards are conditional on prior application to the University of Exeter for the MEd TESOL programme. Applicants should be academically talented and experienced, and be nationals of and work in countries defined as Least Developed, Low Income, Lower Middle Income, or Upper Middle Income according to the OECD DAC list. They should be teachers and related professionals with relevant experience and evidenced potential to impact and enhance the field of English language teaching and learning in their home country. Applicants must meet the University of Exeter’s admission’s criteria for the MEd TESOL Programme.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: MEd TESOL programme

academic_requirements.required_degree: First degree (Bachelor's) required for post-degree experience; scholarship is for a Master's degree (MEd TESOL).

experience_requirements.min_years: minimum of three years' full time
experience_requirements.accepted_types: TESOL teaching or related professional experience after your first degree; working in the ELT sector.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: By applying for this Scholarship, applicants agree to their personal details and related data being shared with representatives from the University of Exeter, the Hornby Trust and Final Selection Panel members.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: University of Exeter application form for admission to the MEd TESOL programme; Hornby Scholarship application form (requires an Exeter student number).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: All applicants will be jointly considered by the University of Exeter and the Hornby Trust, involving a Final Selection Panel.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The A.S. Hornby Educational Trust prioritises capacity building for English language teaching and learning. It awards Master’s degree scholarships to teachers and related professionals with relevant experience and evidenced potential to impact and enhance the field of English language teaching and learning in their home country.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2025/2026 academic year, with September 2025 entry.

basic_info.official_name: Swedish Institute Pioneering Women in STEM Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering full tuition, a monthly stipend, and a travel grant.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Master's Programme Application: 15 January 2026; Scholarship Application: 25 February 2026
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 51 (for the 2025/2026 academic year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a female citizen from one of the 10 eligible countries in Africa and Asia. Applicants must be admitted to an eligible master’s programme in the first admissions round in March to be considered for the scholarship. Must not have previously received an SI scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) - specific eligible master’s programmes are listed in a PDF document.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants must apply to one of the eligible master’s programmes in time.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's studies

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years' work experience (contradictory information also states at least 3,000 hours of documented work experience).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Documented work experience, non-remunerated experience is also recognised, leadership experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: High level of English required, usually demonstrated by IELTS or TOEFL scores. (Contradictory information: 'No IELTS required' also stated).

additional_requirements.age_limits: ~18 (vague, from social media, likely refers to minimum age for general eligibility, not specific to this scholarship's typical applicant profile)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Must not have previously received an SI scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Have the support of their employer (written support implied); Demonstrate leadership experience.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents must be submitted to University Admissions on time (specific documents not listed).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: After admissions results are announced by University Admissions (26 March 2026), SI evaluates applications from those admitted to eligible master’s programmes in the first admissions round.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is open for applications once every year for master's studies beginning in the autumn semester. It was launched as a new initiative for the 2025/2026 academic year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026 scholarship. Master's programme application deadline is 15 January 2026. Scholarship application window is 9-25 February 2026. Admissions results by 26 March 2026, followed by SI evaluation.

basic_info.official_name: Brunel University – British Council Women in STEM Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded
covered_expenses: Return economy-class travel/flights to the UK
Visa, Insurance / NHS, and health surcharge
