field_restrictions.eligible_fields: STEM

academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate (Master/MSc)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS is not required at the time of application. University requires a score between 6.0 for IELTS, 77 for TOEFL, 169 for Cambridge, 458 for KAPLAN, and 59 for PTE. Must have taken a Language Testing (SELT) list test.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application (via UCAS or Brunel online application portal)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: In partnership with the British Council, for eligible Brunel MSc courses.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-27 academic year will open in January 2026. The application deadline for the 2025/26 academic year was extended to 22 April 2025.

basic_info.official_name: MacSon Entrance Scholarship for International Students (University of Guelph)

funding_info.funding_details: 2 awards of CAN $17,500 payable over 3 semesters.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students entering a full-time Bachelor's program. Academic Requirements: Minimum GPA 2.8+ needed. Students must have a complete admission file by the final document deadline of March 1, 2026 (this deadline is for general International Entrance Scholarships).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Natural Resource Management studies; All disciplines are encouraged to apply.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Application fee waiver may be available.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: complete admission file
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Guelph is inviting applications for MacSon Entrance Scholarship Program. Past application deadlines mentioned include 15 August 2023 and June 30th. Eligible intake: Jan - 2026.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Eligible intake: Jan - 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Swedish Institute (SI) Scholarship for Global Professionals (SISGP)

funding_info.funding_details: A prestigious, fully funded master’s scholarship program offering comprehensive support. It covers tuition fees, a monthly stipend of SEK 12,000 for living expenses, a one-time travel grant of SEK 10,000, and memberships in the SI Network for Future Global Professionals (NFGP) and the SI Alumni Network.
covered_expenses: Membership in the SI Network for Future Global Professionals (NFGP)
Lifelong membership of the SI Alumni Network

timeline_info.opening_date: Mid-November 2025 (for application documents and eligible master programmes publication)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of one of the 33 eligible countries (e.g., Armenia, Azerbaijan, Iraq, Jordan, Kenya, Liberia, Ecuador, Egypt, Ethiopia) and be required to pay international tuition fees. They must be admitted to an eligible one- or two-year master’s programme in Sweden, delivered in English. The scholarship targets highly motivated individuals dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries. Work experience is required. SI welcomes applicants regardless of age or religious beliefs and aims for diversity and gender equality among scholarship holders. Only applicants admitted to an eligible master’s programme by March 26, 2026, will be considered.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A wide range of study fields, covering over 700 of the approximately 1000 English-taught master’s programmes in Sweden. Master’s programmes must be eligible for the SI scholarship.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No quotas for specific countries, fields of study, or Swedish universities.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two different letters of reference are required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age limits mentioned; applicants welcomed regardless of age.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Aims for diversity and gender equality; no specific gender requirement.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries. Applicants must be required to pay international tuition fees. Only one scholarship application should be submitted regardless of the number of master’s programmes applied for at University Admissions or other institutions. Failure to submit required documents to University Admissions on time may lead to disqualification.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Two different letters of reference are required. Other required documents for the scholarship application and for university admissions are published mid-November 2025.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process follows five key stages. Selection is highly competitive, based on the quality of applications. Only applicants admitted to an eligible master's programme by March 26, 2026, will be considered. There are no quotas for specific countries, fields of study, or universities. Grades and test scores falling in the top 30% are a factor in selection.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious, fully funded master’s scholarship program for future leaders dedicated to sustainable development and positive change in their home countries. It supports full-time, one- or two-year master’s studies in Sweden across a wide range of English-taught programmes, fostering a network of global leaders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Mid-November 2025: SI Scholarship application documents and eligible master programmes are published. January 15, 2026: Application Deadline. March 26, 2026: University Admissions results announced; SI evaluates eligible scholarship applications.

basic_info.official_name: University of Warwick – ASEAN–UK SAGE Women in STEM Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers full tuition, a monthly stipend (up to £19,824 annually), return flights, and other costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 17 April 2025 (for University of Warwick course application)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to women and people who identify as women, from ASEAN member states and Timor-Leste.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) and scientific fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's programs (requires completion of an undergraduate degree).

additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Women and people who identify as women.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have a place offer from the university.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Women in STEM scholarship supports women to study master's programs in UK universities, enabling them to pursue their preferred scientific fields. It is also offered by The University of Manchester.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025-26 academic year for the general scholarship have now closed (as per British Council). The course application deadline for the University of Warwick is 17 April 2025. Scholarships are for studies starting September 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship provides full funding for an eligible master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate program at McGill University. This includes tuition and fees, a living stipend of C$2,300 per month (or $2,000 per month in some sources) during academic terms, a one-time relocation grant for moving to Montréal, and summer funding options. Scholars also participate in an interdisciplinary leadership program, connect with experienced mentors and advisors, receive professional coaching, and have access to an annual retreat, Principal’s Lecture, and McCall MacBain House.
covered_expenses: Tuition and fees for an eligible master’s or professional degree at McGill
Living stipend of C$2,300 per month (or $2,000 per month) during academic terms
One-time relocation grant for moving to Montréal

timeline_info.application_deadline: National deadline: September 24, 2025, 4pm EST (for 2026 cohort). Campus nomination deadline: September 8, 2025, 11:59 p.m. ET. General International deadline: August. General Canada & U.S. deadline: September. Applications for the 2026 cohort are now closed.
timeline_info.opening_date: Application opens June (general timeline). Applications for the 2026 cohort were open in 2025.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 30 McCall MacBain Scholars (20 Canadians, 10 international students) receive full funding. Additionally, 25 Finalist Awards of $20,000 and 15 Regional Awards of $10,000 are available for International Applicants, and 30 Finalist Awards of $10,000 and 30 Regional Awards of $5,000 for Canadian Citizens, Permanent Residents, and Refugees.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be planning to apply for Summer/Fall 2026 admission to a full-time master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate program at McGill University. They must have a bachelor's degree (or equivalent) by August 2026 or be in their final year of undergraduate studies when applying. Regarding degree timing and age: applicants must have earned their first bachelor’s degree in the last five years, OR earned their first bachelor’s degree more than five years ago and be 30 years or younger at any point in the scholarship application year. Current students and recent alumni (those who have graduated within the past two years) may be required to seek campus nomination.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate programs at McGill University (over 150 eligible programs).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not intended for PhD programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 3.0 out of 4.0, or a Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.2 out of 4.0 in the last two years of study. Some programs or campus nomination processes may require a 3.7 GPA (e.g., for NYU's ADC application).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) recognized by McGill University.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency (IELTS, TOEFL, or language waiver) is required, unless studies were conducted in English.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Yes, applicants are welcome to ask the same people to provide references for both the McCall MacBain Scholarship and their McGill program application.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Specific age/degree timing conditions apply: either earned a first bachelor’s degree in the last five years, OR earned a first bachelor’s degree more than five years ago and are 30 years or younger at any point in the scholarship application year. Conflicting information from a YouTube title suggests 'No Age Limit!'.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Open to Male/Female applicants; no specific gender requirement mentioned.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: This is a leadership-based scholarship program. Scholars participate in an interdisciplinary leadership program, connect with mentors and advisors, and develop leadership skills through bi-weekly seminars, peer-led labs, and case studies. Campus nomination may be required for some applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must apply separately to eligible programs at McGill University and be admitted to their desired graduate program(s). If selected as a finalist, applicants need to apply to McGill in December even if the program’s deadline is later in the academic year.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application, short and long essays, and references. Drafts of essays may be required for campus nomination processes.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Initial application is submitted via the McCall MacBain website. The process includes Regional Interviews (October to December) and Final Interviews (March). Top applicants are also eligible to receive regional or finalist awards.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The McCall MacBain Scholarship at McGill University is Canada’s first comprehensive, leadership-driven scholarship program for Master’s and professional degree studies. It aims to provide students with mentorship, interdisciplinary learning, and a global community to accelerate their impact on the world, focusing on developing leadership skills and fostering community.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application opens June. International deadline August. Canada & U.S. deadline September. Regional interviews October to December. Final interviews March. Classes begin September.

basic_info.official_name: Japanese Grant Aid for Human Resource Development Scholarship Programme (JDS)
basic_info.provider: Government of Japan, Japan International, JICA

funding_info.funding_details: Full scholarship, all costs to study in Japan will be fully covered by JDS.
covered_expenses: other designated expenses as per JDS Rules and Guidelines
monthly subsistence allowance to cover living expenses, including books

timeline_info.application_deadline: 12 December 2025 (Friday) at 1:00 PM (Philippines specific); November 28, 2025 (Phnom Penh/online specific)
timeline_info.opening_date: October 1st at 12 PM (IST) for the 2026 application portal
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 479 Fellows from the Philippines; 209 Fellows from Nepal (since 2015); 266 young leaders from 13 countries (in 2016); total number of JDS scholars to 3700

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be young leaders from target countries, outstanding international students from around Asia. Specific country requirements include: Filipino citizens, 22-39 years old, employed in the Philippine government, have 2 years experience, a bachelor's degree, and English proficiency. Applicants must not have been awarded or scheduled to receive another scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Graduate degrees in top Japanese Universities. Priority fields of study and research fields are determined based on Japan’s Country Assistance Policies and survey results, leading to country-specific four-year plans.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No borderline for GPA score (Nepal specific); minimum 3.0/4.0 GPA (from 2015 application)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree. Master's Degree holders can apply unless they obtained their master's degree funded by another scholarship.

experience_requirements.min_years: 2 years experience (Philippines specific)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Employed in the Philippine government (Philippines specific)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language ability sufficient to understand course materials. Requirements include: TOEFL 500, IELTS score of 5.0 or higher. All applicants must take the English examination (IELTS Academic Module) unless presenting a valid IELTS score obtained within 2 years (not earlier than 31st May 2024).

additional_requirements.age_limits: 22-39 years old (Philippines specific)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Demonstrate financial need (from 2015 application)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: May be of any faith or belief system (from 2015 application); Has not been awarded or scheduled to receive another scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: ERD application, Application Guidelines (country-specific PDFs like Timor-Leste 2025, 2015 application, general application guidelines)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A preparatory survey is conducted by the target country's government, Japanese government representatives, and JICA to determine the selection process, among other program details.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Project for Human Resource Development Scholarship (JDS) Program supports human resource development by providing young leaders from target countries with full scholarships for graduate degrees in top Japanese Universities. Funded by the Government of Japan and executed by Japan International. Launched in Nepal in 2015. Accepts outstanding international students from around Asia.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Country-specific four-year plans are developed for the program schedule.

basic_info.official_name: International Cultural Service Program (ICSP) Scholarship - University of Oregon

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers a portion of the cost of tuition, up to $25,000, and is renewable each year. It is a tuition-waiver scholarship, covering approximately 60% of the cost of tuition and about 40% of the total cost. The tuition waiver can range from 0 – 15 non-resident academic credits.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to new and continuing international students admitted to the University of Oregon. Applicants must demonstrate financial need. Selected students are required to complete 80 hours per year of cultural service, which involves giving presentations about their home country to children and community organizations.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any undergraduate program at the University.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0 or 3.5 cumulative GPA (sources conflict).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Proficiency is required for admission to the University of Oregon. Minimum TOEFL iBT score: 88. Duolingo English Test (DET) is new for 2025/2026 (score requirements to be added). International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is also accepted.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must apply for admission to the University of Oregon before applying for the scholarship. Requires 80 hours per year of cultural service.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The International Cultural Service Program (ICSP) Scholarship is a partial tuition-waiver scholarship for international students at the University of Oregon. It is renewable annually until degree completion, contingent upon meeting program requirements. Students provide cross-cultural exchange opportunities by sharing their experiences and culture with the UO and local community.

basic_info.official_name: University of Geneva Excellence Masters Fellowships
basic_info.provider: Faculty of Science, University of Geneva

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded masters scholarship for international students. The Excellence Fellowship consists of a grant amounting to CHF 10,000 to CHF 15,000/year (no teaching duties); it is awarded for one year and extended for the regular duration of the chosen Master's program (three or four semesters) provided the applicant is academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies. It is a living allowance.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several Excellence Fellowships are awarded annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding and highly motivated international students who wish to pursue a Master of Science degree in a discipline covered by the Faculty. Students who have already started a Master’s at the Faculty of Science are not eligible. Candidates must fulfill the standard Master’s admission requirements and be from any university with very good performance in their bachelor's studies, belonging to the best 10% of their bachelor's program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master of Science degree in any discipline covered by the Faculty of Science. This includes fields within the Astronomy Department. A complete list of Master programs is available at http://www.unige.ch/sciences/Masters.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No English Language Requirements. Results of GRE (General requirement examination), TOEFL or other language tests can be submitted but are not explicitly required.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicant must be academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies for the fellowship to be extended. Must be an outstanding and highly motivated student.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A motivation letter (or two-page essay) describing specific scientific interests, specifying the Master's program at the Faculty of Science, and motivating the intention to pursue a Master of Science program at the University of Geneva. Applications should be sent as a UNIQUE PDF file by e-mail to the Dean of the Faculty of Science: Excellence-Master-Sciences@unige.ch. Other pertinent information like GRE, TOEFL, or other language test results may be included.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Faculty of Science, with the support of external partners, has established an Excellence Fellowship program to encourage outstanding and highly motivated international students to pursue a Master of Science degree in one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Program Starting Date: September 15, 2026

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship providing a monthly allowance of CHF 1,600 for 10 months (from September 15 to July 15) per year, for the complete duration of the master's program (one and a half or two years). The total amount can be up to 19,200 CHF.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately ten scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to international/foreign (non-Swiss) university graduates with excellent/outstanding academic achievements. Applicants must not already be enrolled in a Master’s program at UNIL or in a preparatory year there. Applicants must have obtained a foreign university degree considered equivalent to a Swiss university bachelor before the beginning of the master's program, though applications can be submitted before obtaining the degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Most UNIL Master’s programs
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some courses/programs are exempted/have important exceptions (no specific list provided).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree from a university outside of Switzerland, considered equivalent to a Swiss university bachelor's degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency (C1 level) in French or English, depending on the Master’s language of instruction at UNIL. A language certificate is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation letter, passport copy, CV. Applicants whose bachelor’s university is in a country that did not ratify the Lisbon Recognition Convention must send certified (sealed) copies of diploma and transcripts by post in addition to PDF uploads. The scholarship application also serves as an application for admission to the chosen master's program and registration at UNIL.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, passport copy, CV, motivation letter, reference letters, language certificates, diploma. Certified (sealed) copies of diploma and transcripts may be required by post for some applicants. Complete application file must be uploaded in PDF during online application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: If the application file is complete and formally eligible by the Admissions Office (SII), it is forwarded to the faculty for a decision on admission to the master's program. Applications are chosen by a Committee to receive the Master’s Grant.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A highly competitive scholarship program for excellence, designed to attract bright, international students with very high academic results to pursue a Master’s degree at the University of Lausanne. It alleviates financial burden and offers a world-class education.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded master’s scholarships. CHF 10'000 per semester. Living Allowance: CHF 1,500 per month.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 1st round: December 15; 2nd round: March 31. Recommendation letters deadline: January 31 (1st round), April 15 (2nd round).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international students with outstanding academic records. Anyone applying to a Master’s program at EPFL is eligible. Candidates who already hold a Master’s degree or are currently enrolled in a Master’s program at EPFL are not eligible. To keep the fellowship for the second year, recipients must earn ≥50 ECTS credits and maintain a minimum GPA of 5.0/6.0.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All EPFL Master's programs (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science, Life Sciences, Architecture, Civil Engineering, Environmental Sciences and Engineering, Urban Systems). EPFL offers 29 Master’s programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.5 out of 4.0 (or 5.0/6.0 for renewal).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to apply for a Master's program).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three academic referees are required to provide letters of recommendation. Exception for candidates already registered in another Swiss Federal Institute of Technology or University, who apply for a Master’s degree in the same branch of study as their Bachelor’s.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Candidates who distinguish themselves in extracurricular activities (sporting, artistic, civic, or entrepreneurial) are rewarded.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Candidates are required to declare all scholarships received during their Master’s program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Contact details of three academic referees.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Part of the “Attract Talent” pillar of the Student Support Program, a philanthropic program that supports the educational journey of students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Fellowship paid for 4 semesters maximum (3 semesters for a 90-credit master’s program). Covers two to three semesters of the Master’s cycle (depending on program duration) plus one semester for the Master’s project.

funding_info.funding_details: CHF 1,600 per month from 15 September to 15 July (10 months a year) for the minimum statutory period of the program (one and a half years or two years). Total up to 19,200 CHF.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: ten students

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships for excellence awarded exclusively to international students who have graduated from a foreign university (not Swiss) and whose academic results are of a very high level. Candidates must have obtained a foreign university degree considered equivalent to a Swiss university bachelor before the beginning of the master's program at UNIL. Students with a foreign university degree who have already begun a Master's program at UNIL or who are in their preparatory year are not authorized to apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Majority of Master’s programs
field_restrictions.restrictions: Master from the School of Medicine, Master of education, most Law specialisms, Sports Didactics, Health Sciences, and all MAS or PhD courses are excluded.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Foreign university bachelor's degree considered equivalent to a Swiss university bachelor's degree, with outstanding academic record and very high-level academic results.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: C1 language proficiency appropriate to their chosen course

additional_requirements.other_requirements: A CHF 200.00 administration fee must be paid.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Complete application file in PDF (a 'list of documents for an application' is mentioned but not provided)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications will be processed by SASME and the Admissions Office between November and December. The Admissions Office (SII) will decide if the candidate is formally eligible if the application file is complete.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious scholarships for excellence offered on a competitive basis to attract the best international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025/2026 academic year are open. The application period for the 2025-2026 academic year opens September 1st and closes November 1st.

basic_info.official_name: Clarendon Fund Scholarships - University of Oxford

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering course fees and providing a generous grant for living expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: December or January deadline (for the chosen graduate course)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: over 130 new scholarships every year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to academically excellent graduate students with outstanding academic records and strong potential. Open to all nationals and students from all countries around the world. Candidates must be applying for a full-time graduate degree at Oxford University and starting a new course. Current students continuing the same degree at Oxford are not eligible. Applicants must demonstrate exceptional academic performance, leadership potential, and meet the academic standards of their chosen graduate program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All degree-bearing subjects at graduate level; all subject areas offered by the university.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: GPA of at least 3.7 (out of 4.0) or an excellent academic record, usually with first-class honors. An exceptional Master’s degree can compensate for a moderate first degree performance.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate level (Master’s or DPhil course)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language requirements apply; specific scores vary by program (e.g., IELTS 7.5 overall, with a minimum of 7.0 in each component for some programs).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References are reviewed as part of the selection process.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Open to students of any gender.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate leadership skills, show research potential (for Ph.D. applicants), aptitude for research, likelihood of contributing significantly to the field of study. Other evidence of high academic achievement may include individual marks on student transcripts, previous university prizes or awards, information on overall position within cohort, and publications (if applicable).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: No additional documents are required specifically for the Clarendon Scholarships; there is no separate scholarship application form. Applicants are automatically considered when they apply for their chosen graduate course at Oxford.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are automatically considered when they apply for their chosen graduate course by the relevant deadline. Scholarships are awarded on the basis of academic excellence and potential. Selection criteria vary slightly depending on the subject area and whether applicants apply for a taught or research degree. Shortlisted applicants are contacted by the Clarendon Fund Administrator with an offer letter.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Clarendon Fund is a major graduate scholarship scheme at the University of Oxford, supporting over 500 on-course scholars from around 70 different nations. It offers the opportunity to join one of the most active, internationally diverse, and multidisciplinary communities at Oxford.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Clarendon Scholarship 2026-2027

basic_info.official_name: Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships (Art scholarships – Master’s degree)
basic_info.provider: Swiss Confederation; Federal Commission for Scholarships for Foreign Students (FCS); Swiss Government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully financed program. CHF 1,920 per month for art scholarships. ETH Zurich's Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP) offers CHF 12,000 per semester for living and study expenses (this is specific to ETH Zurich and not the general art scholarship).

timeline_info.application_deadline: 8 December 2025 (country-specific deadlines typically between September and December 2025)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to international applicants from over 180 countries. Aimed at young artists. Applicants must be early-career artists.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Artistic professions only.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Art scholarships are for art students pursuing their first master’s degree in Switzerland, available at various universities or conservatories. Not for research or other academic disciplines.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher; top 10% of Bachelor’s degree programme (grade A); strong academic track record meeting minimum requirements.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (required to apply for a first Master’s degree in Switzerland).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Artistic proposal required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Born after 31 December 1990 (for 2026-2027 scholarships); generally not older than 35 years.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate leadership, community involvement, and academic excellence. Must be eligible for admission to a first Master’s at a recognized Swiss institution.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Complete application including artistic proposal, transcripts, references, curriculum vitae, health certificate (on FCS form), copy of passport (main page), motivation letter. For painters, graphic artists and sculptors: copies or photos of 3 pieces of their work, rough drafts (with date of creation, labeled with name, surname, country). For musicians: high-quality CD of 3 different styles of music (if music involves interpreters and directors).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection process by the Federal Commission for Scholarships (FCS). Decisions for the 2025–2026 academic year announced by the end of May 2026. Final decision for ETH Zurich's ESOP rests with the Rector of ETH Zurich.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Encourages international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. Fully financed program for graduate, master’s, and postdoctoral students from outside of Switzerland. Aims to give students from more than 180 countries access to worthwhile opportunities. Scholarship start date of 1 September.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026/2027 academic year. Decisions for the 2025-2026 academic year by May 2026.

basic_info.provider: UK Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), Commonwealth Scholarship Commission in the UK (CSC)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded, comprehensive financial support designed to cover all major costs.
covered_expenses: Approved airfare from the scholar's home country to the UK and return at the end of the award
Living costs/stipend (implied by comprehensive support and family allowances)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 300

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must: be unable to afford to study in the UK without this scholarship; demonstrate potential to contribute to sustainable development of their home countries; be postgraduate applicants from low- and middle-income Commonwealth countries; hold citizenship or refugee status in an eligible Commonwealth country; demonstrate direct and applied relevance of study to development in home country; intend to pursue full-time Master’s study at a UK university beginning in September/October 2026; and study programmes which fall under the six key themes.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Programmes which fall under the six key themes (themes not specified in content)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some subjects and modes of study may be available/restricted depending on the award.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (implied for postgraduate study)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least two references required, speaking to academic potential, work experience, and leadership.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Required as part of the application process.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Must be unable to afford to study in the UK without the scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal Statement, Voluntary and Leadership Experience, and Development Impact statements are required as part of the application process.

application_documents: Proof of citizenship or refugee status in an eligible Commonwealth country
background_and_logistics.selection_process: CSC does not accept direct applications; applications must be made through a selected non-governmental organisation/charitable body or national nominating agency in home country, and submitted on the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission’s Online Application System. Provisional selection is made subject to CSC agreeing terms of admission to the university.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Aimed at talented and motivated individuals from developing Commonwealth countries to gain knowledge and skills for sustainable development, who could not otherwise afford to study in the UK. Supports full-time Master’s study at a UK university.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for the 2026/2027 academic year, with study commencing in September/October 2026.

basic_info.provider: Academy of Research and Higher Education (ARES) of the Belgian government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity for international students, covering all expenses to study postgraduate degree programs.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are open for the 2026–2027 call
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 200 fully funded awards

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a permanent resident and work in one of the 31 eligible partner countries (including Palestinian nationals). Must not yet be accepted to a French-speaking university in Belgium.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Specialized bachelor’s degrees (undergraduate specialization), specialized master’s degrees, and continuing training programs. Specific examples include one-year advanced bachelor’s or master’s degree programs, 2-to-6-month continuing education programs, Master de spécialisation – Design d’innovation sociale, and 6 Continuing Education Programs including Data Science in Global Health.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Programs must be within the Federation Wallonia-Brussels. All courses are taught in English, so applicants should select from English-taught programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum 3.5 GPA
academic_requirements.required_degree: Must have earned a higher education degree. For specialized bachelor’s, Bac+3 is required; for specialized masters and continuing education, Bac+5 is required. A B.A. or M.A. Degree in relevant fields (Finance, Business, International) is desirable for some programs.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years of relevant professional experience after graduate studies for advanced bachelors, or after postgraduate studies for advanced masters and continuing education courses. Specifically, at least two years after the end of Bac+3 for specialized bachelor’s holders, or Bac+5 for specialized masters and continuing education students.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant professional experience in an ARES partner country.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Proficiency Test Certificate (IELTS, TOEFL, or Medium of instruction letter) is required. However, students can apply without English language test scores if they meet alternative proof of proficiency, and some sources state 'No IELTS / TOEFL' is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Women are especially encouraged to apply, as ARES actively supports gender diversity in its programs.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Half of all ARES scholarships (65 for Specialized Bachelor/Master and 35 for short trainings) are earmarked for applicants from Sub-Saharan Africa. Priority is given to people who work in an institution with which ARES has entered into a partnership (Institutional Support, development research, or training project in the South). Scholarships are for young professionals from 31 partner countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Copy of a valid Passport, Personal statement of the student, Curriculum Vitae (CV). Academic performance and future reintegration prospects will also be considered.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Copy of a valid Passport, two Recommendation Letters, English Proficiency Test Certificate, Personal statement of the student, Curriculum Vitae (CV).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Academic performance and future reintegration prospects are considered. Priority is given to applicants working with ARES partner institutions in case of a tie on other selection criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarships aim to promote the expertise and experience of participants and enable scholarship holders to become agents of change in their home institutions and society, in favour of development.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The call for applications is for the 2026-2027 academic year. The 2025-2026 scholarship call for applications is now closed.

basic_info.provider: VLIR-UOS (Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number of yearly scholarships per programme (8-12), with specific numbers provided for individual programs (e.g., 8 for Bachelor of Hotel Management, 10 for International Master of Science in Agro- & Environmental Nematology, 12 for Master of Science in Nutrition and Food Systems).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding students from 29 or 30 eligible countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year. Candidates may not have previously received a scholarship from the Belgian government to attend a study programme, nor may they have enrolled in a study programme at a Belgian higher education institution before 1 January of the year of intake. Preference will be given to candidates who have never received a scholarship to study in a higher income country (bachelor or master). Candidates cannot receive any other scholarship or grant to participate in this study programme or another programme simultaneously. Professional experience is an important asset, and outstanding motivation is highly valued. The scholarship aims to support changemakers driving social change in their home country or region.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A selection of bachelor's and master's programmes taught in English at Flemish universities or universities of applied sciences and arts. Examples include: Bachelor of Hotel Management, Bachelor of Applied Computer Science, International Master of Science in Agro- & Environmental Nematology, International Master of Science in Rural Development (IMRD), Master of Aquaculture (IMAQUA), Master of Epidemiology, Master of Science in Food Technology, Master of Science in Marine and Lacustrine Science and Management, Master of Statistics and Data Science, Master in Sustainable Development, Master of Transportation Sciences - Road Safety, Master of Water Resources Engineering (WRE), Master of Science in Nutrition and Food Systems, Master of Science in Sustainable Land Management, Master of Science in Tropical Biodiversity and Ecosystems (Mundus tropicalis c/o TROPIMUNDO), Master of Human Settlements, Master of Development Evaluation.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants must choose one of the eligible ICP Connect programs.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Full-time bachelor’s or master’s degree. Advanced Master’s programmes typically require a Master's degree, but some may accept applicants with a four-year bachelor’s degree. Bachelor of Arts organized by a Flemish university of applied sciences and arts with a minimum of 60 and a maximum of 180 ECTS is also mentioned.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience is an important asset.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: If you studied in an English-speaking institution, some programmes may waive this requirement. Specific minimum scores for accepted tests are required for each programme and can be found on the university websites. Test results must be available for online verification. For some programmes, the medium of instruction is not accepted as proof of English proficiency.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Support changemakers aiming to drive social change in their home country or region after completing their studies. Outstanding motivation is highly valued.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Candidates for a bachelor or initial Master programme cannot be older than 35 as of January 1 of the intake year. Candidates for an advanced Master programme cannot be older than 45.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: The selection process applies a gender and regional balance.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Candidates may not have previously received a scholarship from the Belgian government to attend a study programme, nor may they have enrolled in a study programme at a Belgian higher education institution before 1 January of the year of intake. Preference is given to candidates who have never received a scholarship to study in a higher income country. Candidates cannot receive any other scholarship or grant simultaneously.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Only complete submissions will be taken into consideration. While some programmes may prefer related backgrounds, applicants with relevant work experience may still qualify for specialised programmes.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: The scholarship selection is based on ICP Connect selection criteria, including gender and regional balance, professional experience, and outstanding motivation. The pool of applicants changes yearly, and scholarships are awarded considering relative criteria (e.g., number of females, regional balance), meaning the best scoring students may not always receive a scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The VLIR-UOS ICP Connect Scholarship supports outstanding students from Africa, Asia, and Latin America (29 or 30 eligible countries) to pursue full-time bachelor’s or master’s degrees at Flemish universities in Belgium. The ambition is to support changemakers driving social change in their home country or region. Scholarships are awarded for the full duration of the study program (12, 24, or 36 months), and partial scholarships are not offered.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026-2027 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarship, covering everything including tuition, travel, living expenses, and health insurance.
covered_expenses: Living costs (accommodation, food, clothing, daily needs)

timeline_info.application_deadline: 1 December (for Master's program application to be considered for scholarship)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to four scholarships are awarded each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from developing countries (examples include Afghanistan, Ghana, Nigeria, Ethiopia, Kenya, India, Vietnam). Applicants must have received a provisional or unconditional admission offer for a Master’s program at the University of Groningen before February. Candidates must be in good health so that health insurance in the Netherlands can be arranged. Scholarship is for outstanding students. Master's programs must be 1 or 2 years in length and start in September only. It is not possible to actively apply for an Eric Bleumink Fund Scholarship; candidates are nominated.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Master’s Programs taught at the University of Groningen, specifically MSc/MA/LL.M. degree programs.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of five years
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience in a relevant related field.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Excellent English language proficiency, in accordance with the admission requirements of the program of choice, proven by a test like IELTS (minimum 6.5) or other accepted certificates.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Master’s programs must last one or two years and start in September only.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: The University of Groningen Admission Office, in consultation with the Admission Boards of its faculties, will determine which applicants will be nominated for an Eric Bleumink Fellowship scholarship. Nominees are selected from among applicants who have applied for a Master’s program by 1 December and have received an offer of admission (provisional or unconditional) before February. It is not possible to actively apply for the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eric Bleumink Fellowship is a fully funded scholarship for international students pursuing a Master's degree at the University of Groningen. It applies to all Master’s Programs (MSc/MA/LL.M.) and has a duration of 1 or 2 years. Up to four scholarships are awarded annually. It offers a transformative chance to receive a top-notch education in Europe and integrate into Groningen’s thriving, globally inclusive academic community.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants must have received a provisional or unconditional admission offer for a Master’s program before February. Master’s degree programs start in September only. Nominees are selected from among applicants who have applied for a Master’s program by 1 December and have received an offer of admission (provisional or unconditional) before February.

funding_info.funding_details: Stipend of €10,000 per academic year for up to two years (total up to €20,000). Some sources mention ~€11,000 per academic year.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Maximum 30 students per year (10 per faculty)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aims to support international students (EU & non-EU) enrolling in a Master's program at the University of Luxembourg. Candidates should be top graduate students with excellent academic records.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All eligible Master's programs

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 CGPA (for university admission)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: First, apply for the Master's programme.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Notification of finalists: mid-May 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Guillaume Dupaix International Master's Scholarship supports international students (EU & non-EU) pursuing Master's studies at the University of Luxembourg. It is a prestigious opportunity for top graduate students with excellent academic records.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline: 31 March 2026. Notification of finalists: mid-May 2026. Program start date: September 2026.

basic_info.provider: Flemish government; Flemish Ministry of Education and Training

funding_info.funding_details: € 10.020 per academic year for 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. Described as fully funded.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 15 January 2026, 23.59 CET (for master's program application including scholarship candidacy form; host institution deadlines may vary)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 30 Master Mind Scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding international students. Must apply to or be accepted into a master's degree program at a Flemish higher education institution in Flanders and Brussels. Previous degree must have been obtained from an institution outside Flanders and cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply, unless they were previously enrolled on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any eligible master’s degree programme offered at one of the participating Flemish host institutions.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5 out of 4.0 (or strong GPA record)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Previous degree (used to enroll for the master program) from an institution outside Flanders.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL) is required. Online language tests like IELTS Indicator and TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition are accepted.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: International students who have completed a credit mobility programme at a host Flemish higher education institution are still eligible.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Master Mind Scholarship Application Form (mandatory), KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (as an annexe to master's application), Host institution performs an academic check of the student’s file.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Complete application file for an eligible master’s programme, KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (as an annexe), Master Mind application form, Official letter of acceptance from the host institution, Letter of motivation, other required documents.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates first apply for admission to an eligible Flemish host institution. Host institution checks eligibility, performs preselection, and accepts the student for a degree program. If preselected, the host institution creates the scholarship application file via the Mobility Online application tool. The host institution validates and submits the completed application file to the Flemish Higher Education Council.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Master Mind Scholarship offers an exceptional, fully funded opportunity for outstanding international students to pursue a master’s degree in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 1. Check host institution's participation and application deadline. 2. Submit a complete application file for an eligible master’s programme to the host institution (e.g., by 15 January 2026 for KU Leuven), including the scholarship candidacy form. 3. Host institution preselects eligible students and accepts them for a degree program. 4. Host institution creates and submits the scholarship application file via the Mobility Online tool to the Flemish Higher Education Council.

basic_info.official_name: IOE–International Students House Centenary Master’s Scholarship
basic_info.provider: IOE (Institute of Education, UCL), International Students House (ISH)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Covers full tuition and accommodation for one year at ISH/UCL. One source states it does not cover living expenses beyond accommodation.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from low and middle income countries (or low-income/lower-middle income countries). Applicants must have an offer of admission to a full-time master's program at the UCL Institute of Education (IOE) and have at least two years of relevant work experience. Proof of financial need is required. Applicants must not have studied previously at IOE/UCL (implied).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Education (specifically a full-time master's program at the UCL Institute of Education)

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree program (applicants must have an offer for a full-time Master's)

experience_requirements.min_years: two years
experience_requirements.accepted_types: relevant work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS score should be 7.0 overall (Reading: 6.5 and Writing: 6.0)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: letters of (implied reference letters)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: personal statement, proof of financial need, student ID number (for application), not have studied previously at IOE/UCL (implied).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: academic transcripts, a personal statement, proof of financial need, letters of (reference), an official unconditional offer letter to study a full-time Master's degree at IOE, student ID number.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Partnership with International Students House (ISH). Since 2002, over 80 Centenary Scholarships have been awarded.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the IOE Centenary Master's Scholarships 2025-26 are now open.

funding_info.funding_details: Full tuition + EUR 4000. The scholarship can also cover tuition fees, living expenses, travel and insurance costs.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding student from Southeast Asia who wishes to pursue a master's or advanced master's degree at KU Leuven. Nominated applicants must participate in the Master Mind selections. International students who have completed a credit mobility programme at a host Flemish higher education institution are still eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Humanities and Social Sciences, Science, Engineering and Technology, Biomedical Sciences

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submit a complete application file for an eligible Master’s programme before the deadline, including the KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form as an annexe. Nominated applicants must participate in the Master Mind selections.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form
background_and_logistics.selection_process: After the application deadline of 15 January, KU Leuven's master's programmes will nominate eligible students who have expressed their interest in the scholarship. The central Selection Committee of KU Leuven will preselect up to 20 students for the application for Master Mind at Flemish level, including the preselected candidates for the KU Leuven ASEAN Scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The KU Leuven ASEAN Scholarship is awarded to an outstanding student from Southeast Asia who wishes to pursue a master's or advanced master's degree at KU Leuven. The university has established a fund for donations from the global KU Leuven community to award scholarships to outstanding students. It offers scholarships to outstanding students from Southeast Asia.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline: 15 January 2025. Nomination by master's programmes after deadline. Preselection by central Selection Committee for Master Mind (up to 20 students).
