Finland scholarships are awarded to the most merited applicant in each Master’s programme. For a €2,000 tuition fee reduction, Bachelor's degree must be completed at Tampere University within three academic years. For a higher 50% scholarship waiver at TAMK, students must reach 60 credits per academic year and submit a Finnish language test (YKI) result. Scholarships are awarded to a limited number of best-performing applicants.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: English-taught Bachelor's and Master's degree programmes; Doctoral studies in social, health, natural sciences, and humanities; relevant fields for Master's degrees.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (minimum 180 ECTS credits, 3-4 years full-time study) for Master's programs; Master's degree for Doctoral programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Evidence of good command of the English language for academic purposes; Finnish language test (YKI) result (for TAMK 50% scholarship waiver).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (Letter(s) of Recommendation)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Required to pay tuition fees; non-EU/EEA student status; graduate from Bachelor's programme within three academic years (for €2,000 reduction); reach 60 credits per academic year (for TAMK 50% waiver); Passport / National ID copy; Statement of Purpose; Academic transcripts.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts; Passport / National ID copy; Statement of Purpose; Letter(s) of Recommendation; Evidence of good command of the English language; Finnish language test (YKI) result (for TAMK 50% waiver).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded to a limited number of the best-performing applicants; Finland scholarships awarded to the most merited applicant in each Master’s programme.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Tampere University offers various scholarships for fee-paying, non-EU/EEA students in English-taught Bachelor's and Master's programs, and grants for doctoral studies. Scholarships can cover 50% or 100% of tuition fees for the program duration (e.g., two-year Master's), or 100% for the first year (Finland Scholarship). Some scholarships include relocation grants (5000€) or annual living scholarships (7000€). Additional offers like early bird discounts, Bachelor's to Master's reductions (2000€), and International Advancement Scholarships (1500€) are also available. Doctoral funding includes grants from City of Tampere and University of Tampere Foundation for research, publication, travel, and partial projects.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period for Master's programmes at Tampere University is from 15 December 2025 to 5 January 2026. For Bachelor's programmes at Tampere University and all Bachelor's and Master's programmes at TAMK, the application period is from 7 January 2026 to 21 January 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: The Leiden University Excellence Scholarship offers three levels of financial support: €10000, €15000 and full tuition fee waiver.

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 1 (for February intake) and February 1 (for September intake). For example, October 1, 2025 and February 1, 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 50-60 annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Tuition fee masters scholarship for international students, specifically non-EU students, pursuing full-time Master's degrees at Leiden University. Applicants must be excellent students demonstrating exceptional academic merit and potential.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Greek and Roman Studies, Divinity, Archaeology (Palaeoanthropology), Law, Social and Behavioural Sciences, Science, Medicine/LUMC, Governance and Global, Research Master African Studies.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarships cannot be awarded to students who will follow an LLM (non-advanced) or MSc programme at Leiden Law School.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Good grades comparable with an average mark of at least 7.5 (Dutch grading system) for your entire bachelor's programme
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (applicants must hold a Bachelor's degree)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter, which should highlight academic achievements and drive to study at Leiden University.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Ensure application and scholarship documents are submitted before the deadline.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic Transcript, Statement of Purpose, Letter of Recommendation, Admission Essay Writing, Student Curriculum Vitae.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Leiden University Excellence Scholarship (LExS) is a tuition fee masters scholarship for international students, aiming to support excellent students who demonstrate exceptional academic merit and potential.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadlines are October 1 for programs starting in February and February 1 for programs starting in September. For example, October 1, 2025 and February 1, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: University of Helsinki awards scholarships, bursaries, tuition fee reductions and discounts that help you cover existing tuition and living costs. The scholarship is partially or fully funded.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 16 January 2026 (for master's programs starting in autumn 2026)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to one Finland scholarship for a newly admitted student of each master’s degree programme.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are intended for excellent students from outside the EU/EEA and Switzerland who want to complete a Master's programme at the University of Helsinki. Applicants must be international students who are non-EU/EEA nationals and eligible for the Master’s programme at the University of Helsinki. Students are required to study full time (earn at least 55 ECTS per year) to fulfil the requirements of the scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's Programme in Art Studies, Master's Programme in English Studies, Master's Programme in Gender Studies, Master's Programme in Literary Studies. Other fields mentioned include Gender and Women's Studies, Genetics, Global Affairs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or equivalent for admission. Academic excellence is demonstrated with a minimum GPA of 3.5 or equivalent for the scholarship.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's programme

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, with a minimum score of 6.0 in the writing section. The University of Helsinki only accepts IELTS. A TOEFL score of 92 is also mentioned. Some sources claim 'Fully Funded without IELTS' or that proof of previous education in English is sufficient.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If employed at the University of Helsinki, one cannot receive a grant from University of Helsinki Funds, but if there is a period during a period of three years when not employed at the university, a grant can be received.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Students are required to study full time (earn at least 55 ECTS per year) to fulfil the requirements of the scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, CV or resume, Motivation letter (1–2 pages).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is available for up to two years (the full duration of the master's program), with the condition of completing 55 ECTS credits per year. Scholarship winners have the option to take part in the University of Helsinki Student Ambassador Programme.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application period for master's programs starting in autumn 2026 is from 2 to 16 January 2026. Applications for admission and scholarships must be submitted during this period. The scholarship is available for up to two years.

basic_info.official_name: VU Fellowship Programme (VUFP) – Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers tuition fees only. It does not provide any additional allowance towards study or living costs, like rent or food. Non-EEA students will receive €15,000 to cover their tuition fees.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from around the world who do not have Dutch nationality or an EU/EEA passport and are not eligible for lower tuition fees. Students must not have completed secondary or higher education in the Netherlands. Applicants must be admitted to an English-taught Master's degree at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam and can only apply for the first year of their Master's degree. Students already enrolled in a one-year or two-year Master's program cannot apply for the second year. Applicants must prove academic excellence and be highly motivated.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: English taught Master's degrees
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only pre-selected Master's degrees at VU University are eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 80% of the highest possible mark (calculated over full previous degree). Some sources mention a GPA of at least 75%.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (BSc degree or equivalent previous degree) to apply for a Master's.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, internships, research are relevant for summarizing in the application.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation letter is important.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form (e.g., VUFP NLS-1)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is made by a committee, and only a very few students are selected each year.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The VU Fellowship Programme (VUFP) is the university's own scholarship for highly motivated students with excellent study results.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2026-2027 VU Fellowship Programme is open for applications.

funding_info.funding_details: A Radboud Scholarship will reduce your tuition fee to €2,601 instead of €18,000. It is a partial tuition waiver.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to non-EU/EEA international students. Must be talented, highly motivated, with outstanding study results. Have applied for the Radboud Scholarship Programme for 2026-2027, starting 1 September 2026. Must be able to comply with the conditions. Must meet the English language proficiency requirement for the Master's programme of your choice. Must have been fully admitted to the English-taught Master's degree. Must be enrolled at Radboud University as a full-time student for the academic year and Master's programme for which the scholarship will be awarded. Must not hold a degree from the Netherlands.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All English-taught Master’s programmes
field_restrictions.restrictions: Erasmus Mundus Master's programmes and joint-degree Master's programmes are not eligible.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's programme

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL, if applicable); meet the English language proficiency requirement for the Master's programme of your choice.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years old by Sept 2026
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Talented, highly motivated, outstanding study results. The programme is very selective and highly competitive.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Radboud Scholarship Programme is a very selective and highly competitive scholarship programme. It offers talented, highly motivated, non-EEA students with outstanding study results the opportunity to be awarded a scholarship for a complete English-taught Radboud University Master’s programme.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are open for the 2026/2027 academic year, starting 1 September 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: The Merit Award includes a full tuition waiver, worth up to approximately € 13,000 per year for Graduate students. A limited number of students may also be offered free accommodation.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 23 April 2025 (4th round) and 27 May 2025 (5th round) for Graduate applicants
timeline_info.number_of_awards: A limited number of awards. The number of awards to applicants will not be equally divided amongst the different rounds.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be first-year graduate applicants for the academic year 2025-2026. Applicants should be academic top profiles and outstanding graduate applicants. Students enrolled in a Double/Joint Degree that offers a full tuition waiver at Bocconi and/or scholarships covering tuition and fees to a partnered university will not be allowed to renew the award. Acceptance of an equal or larger benefit in Bocconi for the same academic year makes one ineligible; if the larger benefit is lost, the Bocconi Graduate Merit Award cannot be reinstated.

field_restrictions.restrictions: Not allowed to renew if enrolled in a Double/Joint Degree offering a full tuition waiver at Bocconi or scholarships covering tuition/fees to a partnered university. Ineligible if accepting an equal or larger benefit in Bocconi for the same academic year.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate applicants (MSc applicants)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Standardised test scores (if applicable).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letters of recommendation
additional_requirements.other_requirements: First-year graduate applicants for the academic year 2025-2026. Academic top profiles. Outstanding applicants. Renewal is automatic for a maximum of two years (or four years for Law programs) if academic progress conditions (number of credits) are met.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Admissions Application, Academic transcripts showcasing excellent performance, Standardised test scores (if applicable), Letters of recommendation, Statement of Purpose (SOP).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Each candidate’s online application has to be submitted by the same deadline as their Online Admissions Application. The selection is based on academic merit. The number of awards will not be equally divided amongst the different rounds. The decision on numbers, amounts and recipients is final and unquestionable.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Bocconi Graduate Merit Awards provide a full tuition and fees waiver, and potentially free accommodation, to outstanding first-year graduate applicants at Bocconi University in Milan, Italy, for the academic year 2025-2026.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the academic year 2025-2026 have deadlines of 23 April 2025 (4th round) and 27 May 2025 (5th round). Applications for 2026-27 are also mentioned as open. Renewal is possible for a maximum of two years (or four for Law programs) if academic progress is met.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded masters scholarship. For Norwegian and international applicants who are residents of Norway, it covers full tuition fees for each semester, for up to two years. For international applicants, it covers full tuition fees for up to two years and a stipend for living expenses of NOK 50,000 per semester. All funding is contingent on achieving academic progression requirements.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 50 full scholarships are granted each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must possess an outstanding record of superior academic achievement and demonstrate exceptional academic excellence. Open to Norwegian and international applicants to all Master of Science programs. Applicants must meet BI’s admission standards for master’s studies. International applicants who have completed a bachelor’s degree in Norway are considered residents of Norway for the purpose of this scholarship. International candidates eligible for a regular student loan through the Norwegian State Educational Loan Fund may apply for the BI Presidential Scholarship only. Scholarship applications are considered only if the offer of admission has been accepted.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: all Master of Science programs

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.50 (B) on ECTS scale. A student with a slightly lower GPA than 3.50, but no less than 3.30, may still meet the minimum admission requirements provided he/she has attained a strong GMAT-result.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree for admission to Master of Science programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language: IELTS 6.0+, TOEFL iBT 78+, Duolingo 105+. GMAT 600 or GRE 158 (quantitative) required, or a waiver application. A strong GMAT result may compensate for a slightly lower GPA (no less than 3.30).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: International applicants who have completed a bachelor’s degree in Norway are considered residents of Norway for the purpose of this scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have a valid passport/ID and obtain a student visa if required. Financial documentation may be needed for visa/support. Personal ambitions and financial need are part of the decision criteria. Scholarship applications are assessed based on academic background, scholarship letter, and program suitability. International applicants are automatically considered for the MSc International Scholarship. The scholarship application must be submitted simultaneously with the MSc application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic documents (diploma/certificate, certified translations, transcripts), English test score report, GMAT/GRE score report, scholarship letter, valid passport/ID, financial documentation (for visa/support). All documents must be submitted through the online portal.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: BI will assess your academic background, scholarship letter, and program suitability. Grades from previous studies, previous experiences, personal ambitions and financial need are part of the decision criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One of the most prestigious awards offered by BI Norwegian Business School, designed to attract highly qualified students. Scholarships are tied to academic progression requirements.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2026-2027 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Provides up to 19,000€ per year. Benefits include a monthly allowance and tuition fee grant. One source mentions €15,925. Funded by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 1st February 2026 (for Masters Programs). Other deadlines mentioned include January 20, 2026 and January 8, 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 220 students (in 2015); 36 students (in 2020-2021)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to students from non-European countries (including non-European Union students and U.S. students). Candidates must be arriving at Sciences Po for their first year of studies. Students cannot apply after being admitted to Sciences Po or during their studies. Not eligible for joint scholarship with CSC. Students enrolling in a dual degree program directly in the third year will lose their Boutmy scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Almost all academic fields and majors for students pursuing bachelor's and master's degree programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0 GPA, minimum GPA of 70%, or 3.5 GPA or above (conflicting information across sources).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Completed a bachelor’s or equivalent degree (for Master’s applicants).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience (general), Work experience with a UN agency.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL, if applicable); English or French proficiency test score (as required).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Academic reference/recommendation letter.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students cannot apply for the Émile Boutmy scholarship after being admitted to Sciences Po or during their studies there. Candidates cannot submit applications for the joint scholarship with CSC and the Emile Boutmy Simple Scholarship. Students who enrol in a dual degree programme directly in the third year lose their Boutmy scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Proof of income and family financial information.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Previous academic transcripts and certificates (for undergraduate applicants, implies for master's too); Academic transcripts and certificates (for master’s applicants); Academic reference/recommendation letter; English or French proficiency test score (as required); Proof of income and family financial information. Master's level candidates must indicate their application for the Émile Boutmy scholarship in the “Financial information” section of their Sciences Po application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants applying before October 19 may receive a response by December. Applicants applying by November 30th may receive a response by February 19, 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Created in honour of Sciences Po's founder, Émile Boutmy. It is a prestigious program and one of the most distinguished scholarships in Europe. Contributes largely to the financial aid of U.S. students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period opens November 2025 – January 2026 and closes between February – April 2026 (depending on the university or scholarship). For the 2025/2026 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science together with Dutch Higher Education Institutions

funding_info.funding_details: A scholarship of €5,000, typically disbursed as €2,500 in the 1st semester and €2,500 in the 2nd semester.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university, typically either 1 February or 1 May. For non-EU/EEA students for Fall intake, common deadlines are April 1st or May 1st. Applicants must check the website of their chosen institution.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by institution: e.g., a maximum of 12 scholarships at Radboud University, approximately 30 at Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences. One source mentions approximately 50 awards annually, but this contradicts other funding details.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aimed at stimulating talented international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) to study bachelor's or master's in the Netherlands. Applicants must be admitted for a Bachelor or Master programme at a participating Dutch higher education institution. Specific university requirements may apply (e.g., for Utrecht University, applicants must have applied for an international master’s programme with a start date of 1 September 2026).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor's or Master's programs in the Netherlands. Specific programs may be eligible at certain institutions (e.g., Master of Music, Music Design at HKU).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must not have a degree from an education institution in the Netherlands.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form (must be located and submitted via the participating Dutch higher-education institution).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: If the number of applications exceeds the number of available scholarships, a selection process will occur. Applicants are typically informed about the outcome of the NL Scholarship selection in mid-June.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The NL Scholarship (formerly known as Holland Scholarship) is a national scholarship programme for Dutch and international students, primarily aimed at stimulating talented international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) to study in the Netherlands. It is financed by the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science together with Dutch Higher Education Institutions. It also aims to increase the international mobility of Dutch students studying outside the EEA.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the academic year 2026–2027 opened on 1 November 2025. Applicants are typically informed about the outcome of the selection in mid-June.

funding_info.funding_details: Grants ranging from €3,000 to €22,000 for one year, helping to cover study-related expenses. It is up to the scholarship student to decide how to spend the money. Tuition costs are not covered.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for the University Twente Scholarship (UTS) 2026 are now open.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 50 scholarships are available

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Excellent international students from non-EU/EER countries, applying for a graduate programme (MSc) at the University of Twente. Applicants should be in the top 5-10% of their graduating class. The scholarship is continued during the second year if students meet process requirements, such as achieving at least 50% of ECTS credits and maintaining a minimum GPA of 7/10.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's Degree in eligible fields of study offered at University of Twente, including Business Administration, Chemical, Applied Mathematics, Applied Physics, Biomedical, and other qualifying Master's programs.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's Degree (MSc), typically pursued directly after a Bachelor's degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of work experience is required for the MBA program. Generally, work experience is not looked at for Master's programs, as it's traditional to pursue a Master's directly after a Bachelor's.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Academic IELTS 6.5 (or TOEFL iBT of 90) and an additional 6.0 (TOEFL iBT 20) on the subscore of speaking skills.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must first apply for a Master's programme and receive a (conditional) admission letter. They can then apply for the scholarship using their student number. Candidates should check the total costs of study and living in the Netherlands. Applying for UTS can make one eligible for a Kipaji Scholarship. Working next to your study is allowed in the Netherlands.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University Twente Scholarship (UTS) is for excellent international students from non-EU/EER countries pursuing a graduate (MSc) programme at the University of Twente. While some sources describe it as 'fully funded', specific details indicate it provides grants ranging from €3,000 to €22,000 for study-related expenses, and tuition is not covered.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open in two rounds, with deadlines on February 1, 2026 (first round) and May 1, 2026 (second round) for programmes starting September 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Platinum Scholarship covers complete tuition fees, university residence, and approximately €5000 in cash for one academic year. Other merit scholarships (Gold/Silver) offer €10,000 gross per year plus tuition fees waiver/exemption (up to 100%). Scholarships have a minimum duration of one academic year and can be renewed for the following academic year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Exclusively merit-based for outstanding international students. Open to international students applying to the first year of Master of Science programs taught in English. The selection criteria are based on the evaluation of previous education, its match with Laurea Magistrale programs, provided documents, and the scholarship application form.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master of Science programs taught in English
field_restrictions.restrictions: Programs on Cremona, Lecco, Mantova or Piacenza Campuses (for 2026-2027 academic year call)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: GPA 3.5/4 or above; 70% in Undergraduate Degree. Platinum awards often require perfect GPAs.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (for Master of Science program admission)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience (beneficial for Platinum Scholarship applicants)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS 6.0 (Minimum) / PTE / TOEFL Accepted

additional_requirements.reference_letters: One recommendation letter is required. If multiple documents, merge into a single PDF.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Requires a separate application apart from the university application, though the process is integrated with the university’s online portal. Gap up to 5-6 years accepted with justification.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Documents provided upon application and the scholarship application form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on the evaluation of previous education, its match with Laurea Magistrale programs, provided documents, and the scholarship application form.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Merit-based award for international students, supporting outstanding academic excellence. Scholarships are for a minimum of one academic year and can be renewed for the subsequent year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are offered for academic years 2025/2026 and 2026-2027.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is worth £15,000 and is tenable for one year. It aims to enable and encourage international students from lower income backgrounds to pursue full-time Master's degree studies at UCL. It supports living expenses and tuition fees. The scholarship may be held alongside other scholarships, studentships, awards, or bursaries depending on the total value of other funds received. Scholarship recipients are obliged to inform the UCL Student Funding Office immediately of any other funding they are awarded towards their UCL Master’s degree studies, before or subsequent to the UCL Global Masters Scholarship being awarded.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 85 scholarships (including five specifically for students from India). The scholarship is part of the International Master's Awards (IMA) funding umbrella, which has 96 awards in total, including 4 Humanitarian Scholarships.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students from lower income backgrounds. They must have submitted a complete admission application (including the submission of references) for a full-time Master's degree at UCL in 2025/26. Candidates can be from any country outside the UK. Distance-learning options are not eligible; students must be coming to the UK to attend UCL in person.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time Master's degree studies at UCL.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Distance-learning options are not eligible; students must attend UCL in person.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Admission to a full-time Master's degree program at UCL.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Proficiency

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required as part of the complete UCL admission application.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must be from lower income backgrounds.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Recipients must inform UCL Student Funding Office of any other funding received.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV with educational and work experience details, Personal Statement outlining motivations and goals, and references (as part of the admission application).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must complete their UCL admission application before applying for the scholarship. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted mid-June. Successful candidates will be informed by late June 2026 or the beginning of July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The UCL Global Master's Scholarship aims to enable and encourage international students from lower income backgrounds to pursue full-time Master's degree studies at UCL. It is part of the International Master's Awards (IMA) funding umbrella.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application Deadline: 7 May 2026 (5 pm BST). Result Announcement Dates: by late June 2026 / beginning of July.

basic_info.official_name: University of Bologna – Unibo Action 1 & 2 (International Talents @Unibo)
basic_info.provider: University of Bologna / Alma Mater Studiorum

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Unibo Action 1: Full tuition fee waiver. Unibo Action 2: Study grant of €11,000 gross. Some sources also mention €6,500 gross allowance/scholarship value including full tuition fee exemption.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students intending to enrol in Second Cycle Degree Programmes (Master's). Must demonstrate academic merit and excellence.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Second Cycle Degree Programmes (Master's)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0/4.0 or equivalent

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS 6.0+, TOEFL 80+, B2-level Italian for Italian-taught programs. GRE test scores are required, GMAT also mentioned.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Documentation on family's economic situation / verified financial status.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Test results (GRE/GMAT), documentation on family's economic situation/verified financial status.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on GRE test scores and verified financial status.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is for international students enrolling in Second Cycle Degree Programmes. It includes Unibo Action 1 (tuition fee waivers) and Unibo Action 2 (study grant of €11,000 gross). Some sources state scholarships are awarded for one academic year, while others state two academic years. The application is valid only for requesting the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call for applications typically published in January. Deadline for 2025/26 academic year is 30 May 2025, 12:00 CEST.
